<h1>XIV. FERTILIZERS</h1>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 376 L 0116: Council Directive 76/116/EEC of 18 December 1975 on the<br>approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to fertilizers (OJ<br>No L 24, 30.1.1976, p.21), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;388 L 0183: Council Directive 88/183/EEC of 22 March 1988 (OJ No<br>L83, 29.3.1988, p.33)</p>
<p>389 L 0284: Council Directive 89/284/EEC of 13 April 1989 supple-<br>menting and amending Directive 76/116/EEC in respect of the cal-<br>cium, magnesium, sodium and sulphur content of fertilizers (OJ No<br>Lill, 22.4.1989, p.34)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;389 L 0530: Council Directive 89/530/EEC of 18 September 1989<br>supplementing and amending Directive 76/116/EEC in respect of<br>the trace elements boron, cobalt, copper, iron, manganese, molyb-<br>denum and zinc contained in fertilizers (OJ No L 281, 30.9.1989,<br>p.116)</p>
<p>The EFTA States will be free to limit access to their market according to<br>the requirements of their legislation existing at the date of entry into force<br>of this Agreement concerning cadmium in fertilizers. The Contracting Par-<br>ties shall jointly review the situation in 1995.</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adapations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Annex I, chapter AII, the following shall be added to no. 1, co-<br>lumn 6, third paragraph, to the text in brackets:</p>
<p>“Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden, Swit-<br>zerland”.</p>
<p>(b) In Annex I, chapter B 1, 2 and 4, the following shall be added to<br>column 9, point 3, to the text in brackets after (6b):</p>
<p>“Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden, Swit-<br>zerland”.</p>
<p>2. 377 L 0535: Commission Directive 77/535/EEC of 22 June 1977 on the<br>approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to methods of<br>sampling and analysis for fertilizers (OJ No L 213,22.8.1977, p.l), as amen-<br>ded by:</p>
<p>379 L 0138: Commission Directive 79/138/EEC of 14 December<br>1978 (OJ No L 39, 14.2.1979, p.3), as corrected by OJ No L 1,<br>3.1.1980, p.ll</p>

<p>3. 380 L 0876: Council Directive 80/876/EEC of 15 July 1980 on the approxi-<br>mation of the laws of the Member States relating to straight ammonium nit-<br>rate fertilizers of high nitrogen content (OJ No L 250, 23.9.1980, p.7)</p>

<p>427</p>
<h1>XV. DANGEROUS SUBSTANCES</h1>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 367 L0548: Council Directive 67/548/EEC of 27 June 1967 on the approx-<br>imation of laws, regulations and administrative provisions relating to the<br>classification, packaging and labelling of dangerous substances (OJ No 196,<br>16.8.1967, p.l), as amended and supplemented by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;379 L 0831: Council Directive 79/831/EEC of 18 September 1979<br>(OJ No L 259, 15.10.1979, p.10)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;179 H: Acts concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties - Accession to the European Communities of<br>the Hellenic Republic (OJ No L 291, 19.11.1979, p.17)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;384 L 0449: Commission Directive 84/449/EEC of 25 April 1984 (OJ<br>No L 251, 19.9.1984, p.l)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;388 L 0302: Commission Directive 88/302/EEC of 18 November<br>1987 (OJ No L 133, 30.5.1988, p.l) as corrected by OJ No L 136,</p>
<p>2.6.1988, p.20</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;390 D 0420: Commission Decision 90/420/EEC of 25 July 1990 on<br>the classification and labelling of Di(2-ethylhexyl)phthalate in ac-<br>cordance with Article 23 of Council Directive 67/548/EEC (OJ No<br>L222, 17.8.1990, p.49)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;391 L 0325: Commission Directive 91/325/EEC of 1 March 1991 (OJ<br>No L 180, 8.7.91, p.l)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;391 L 0326: Commission Directive 91/326/EEC of 5 March 1991 (OJ<br>No L 180, 8.7.91, p.79)</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties agree on the objective that the provisions of the<br>Community acts on dangerous substances and preparations should apply by<br>1 January 1995. Finland shall comply with the provisions of the acts as from<br>the entry into force of the 7th amendment to Council Directive 67/548/EEC.<br>Pursuant to cooperation to be initiated from the signature of this Agreement<br>in order to solve remaining problems, a review of the situation will take place<br>during 1994, including matters not covered by Community legislation. If an<br>EFTA State concludes that it will need any derogation from the Community<br>acts relating to classification and labelling, the latter shall not apply to it un-<br>less the EEA Joint Committee agrees on another solution.</p>
<p>As regards the exchange of information, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>(i) The EFTA States that comply with the acquis on dangerous sub-<br>stances and preparations shall give equivalent guarantees to<br>those existing within the Community that:</p>
<p>- where the information is treated as confidential on the grounds of<br>industrial and commercial secrecy within the Community, accor-<br>ding to the provisions of the Directive, only those EFTA States<br>which have taken over the relevant acquis shall participate in the<br>exchange of information;</p>
<p>- confidential information will be afforded the same degree of pro-<br>tection in the EFTA States as that which obtains within the Com-<br>munity.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex II</p>
<p>428</p>
<p>(ii) All EFTA States will participate in the exchange of information<br>concerning all other aspects as provided for in the Directive.</p>

<p>The EFTA States may apply their national legislation, existing at the date<br>of entry into force of this Agreement. The Contracting Parties shall organize<br>practical ways of cooperation. They shall jointly review the situation in 1995.</p>

<h1>XIX. GENERAL PROVISIONS IN THE<br>FIELD OF TECHNICAL BARRIERS TO<br>TRADE</h1>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 383 L 0189: Council Directive 83/189/EEC of 28 March 1983 laying down<br>a procedure for the provisions of information in the field of technical stan-<br>dards and regulations (OJ No L 109, 26.4.1983. p.8), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;1 85 I: Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties - Accession to the European Communities of<br>the Kingdom of Spain and the Portuguese Republic (OJ No L 302,<br>15.11.1985, p.214)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;388 L 0182: Council Directive 88/182/EEC of 22 March 1988 (OJ No<br>L 81, 26.3.1988, p.75)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;Article 1(7) is replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“7. ”product&quot;, any industrially manufactured product and any agri-<br>cultural product, including fish products”.</p>
<p>(b) The following shall be added to the end of the first subparagraph of<br>Article 8(1):</p>
<p>“A full text of the draft technical regulation notified shall be made<br>available in the original language as well as in a full translation into<br>one of the official languages of the European Community&quot;.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;The following shall be added to the second subparagraph of Article<br>8(1):</p>
<p>“The Community, on the one side, and the EFTA Surveillance Aut-<br>hority or the EFTA States through the EFTA Surveillance Autho-<br>rity, on the other side, may ask for further information on a draft<br>technical regulation notified”.</p>
<p>(d) The following shall be added to Article 8(2):</p>
<p>“The comments of the EFTA States shall be forwarded by the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority to the EC Commission in the form of a single<br>coordinated communication and the comments of the Community<br>shall be forwarded by the Commission to the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority. The Contracting Parties shall, when a six-month stands-<br>till is invoked according to the rules of their respective internal sy-<br>stems, inform each other thereof in a similar manner”.</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;The first subparagraph of Article 8(4) shall be replaced by the follo-<br>wing:</p>
<p>“The information supplied under this Article shall be considered as<br>confidential upon request”.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;Article 9 shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“The competent authorities of the EC Member States and the EFTA<br>States shall postpone the adoption of draft technical regulations no-<br>tified for three months from the date of receipt of the text of the<br>draft regulation:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex II</p>
<p>437</p>
<p>- by the EC Commission in case of drafts notified by Member States<br>of the Community,</p>
<p>- by the EFTA Surveillance Authority for drafts notified by the<br>EFTA States.</p>
<p>However, this standstill period of three months shall not apply in those<br>cases where, for urgent reasons relating to the protection of public health or<br>safety, the protection of health and life of animal or plants, the competent<br>authorities are obliged to prepare technical regulations in a very short space<br>of time in order to enact and introduce them immediately without any con-<br>sultations being possible. The reasons which warrant the urgency of the mea-<br>sures taken shall be given. The justification for urgent measures shall be de-<br>tailed and clearly explained with particular emphasis on the unpredictability<br>and the seriousness of the danger confronting the concerned authorities as<br>well as the absolute necessity for immediate action to remedy it“.</p>
<p>(g) The following shall be added to list I of the Annex:</p>

<p>(h) For the application of the Directive, the following Communications<br>by electronic means are considered necessary:</p>
<p>1) Notification slips. They may be communicated before or toget-<br>her with the transmission of the full text.</p>
<p>2) Acknowledgement of receipt of draft text, containing inter alia,<br>the relevant expiry date of the standstill determined according<br>to the rules of each system.</p>
<p>3) Messages requesting supplementary information.</p>
<p>4) Answers to request for supplementary information.</p>
<p>5) Comments.</p>
<p>6) Requests for ad hoc meetings.</p>
<p>7) Answers to requests for ad hoc meetings.</p>
<p>8) Requests for final texts.</p>
<p>9) Information that a six-month standstill has been called.</p>
<p>The following Communications may, for the time being, be transmitted by<br>normal mail:</p>
<p>10) The full text of the draft notified.</p>
<p>11) Basic legal texts or regulatory provisions.</p>
<p>12) The final text.</p>
<p>(i)Administrative arrangements concerning the Communications<br>shall be jointly agreed by the Contracting Parties.</p>

<h1>XXVII SPIRIT DRINKS</h1>
<p>Contracting Parties shall authorise imports and marketing of spirit drinks<br>which are in conformity with the Community legislation as listed in this<br>Chapter. For all other purposes, EFTA States may continue to apply their<br>national legislation.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO:</p>
<p>1. 389 R 1576: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1576/89 of 29 May 1989 laying<br>down general rules on the definition, description and presentation of spirit<br>drinks (OJNoL 160, 12.6.1989, p.l), as corrected by OJ No. L 223,<br>2.8.1989, p.27.</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;The provisions of this Regulation shall not prejudice the right of the<br>EFTA States to prohibit on a non-discriminatory basis the placing on<br>their national market of spirit drinks for direct human consumption<br>which exceed alcoholic strength of 60%.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 1(2), the corresponding headings in the Harmonized sy-<br>stem to CN codes 2203 00, 2204, 2205, 2206 and 2207 are 2203, 2204,<br>2205, 220600 and 2207.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;As regards the definition of fruit spirit drinks in Article 1(4)(1): for<br>Austria, alcohol of agricultural origin may be added at any phase of<br>the manufacturing process, provided that the minimum proportion<br>of 33% of the alcohol contained in the final product is derived from<br>the name-giving fruit.</p>
<p>(d) As regards Article l(4)(q): Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden<br>may prohibit the marketing of vodka produced from raw materials<br>other than cereals or potatoes.</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;In application of Article 6(1) the following terms may complete the<br>sales description:</p>
<p>- The words “Suomalainen punssi/Finsk Punsch/Finnish punch”<br>and “Svensk Punsch/Swedish punch” can be used for a spirit drink<br>from sugar cane distillate as raw material. It may be mixed with<br>alcohol of agricultural origin, and sweetening. It may be flavoured<br>with wine or juice or natural aroma from citrus- or other fruits or<br>berries.</p>
<p>- The word “Spritglögg” can be used for a spirit drink produced by<br>flavouring ethyl alcohol of agricultural origin with natural extracts<br>of cloves, or any other plant which contains the same principal<br>aromatic constituent, using one of the following processes:</p>
<p>- maceration and/or distillation;</p>
<p>- redistillation of the alcohol in the presence of the buds or other<br>parts of the plants specified above;</p>
<p>- addition of natural distilled extracts of clove plants;</p>
<p>- a combination of these three methods.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex II</p>
<p>448</p>
<p>Other natural plant extracts or aromatic seed may also be used,<br>but the cloves taste must remain predominant.</p>
<p>- The word “Jägertee” can be used for a liquor normally diluted be-<br>fore consumption in hot water or tea, originating in Austria. This<br>liquor is prepared on the basis of ethyl alcohol of agricultural ori-<br>gin, essence of certain spirit drinks or tea to which several natural<br>aromatizing substances have been added. The alcohol strength is<br>at least 22.5% vol. The sugar content is at least 100 g per litre ex-<br>pressed as invert sugar.</p>
<p>This liquor may also be designated as “Jägertee” or “Jagatee”.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;In Article 3(2) “Regulation” shall read “EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;Articles 7(6), 7(7), 10(2), 11 and 12 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(h) Annex II shall be completed as follows:</p>

<p>391 R 1781: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1781/91 of 19 June<br>1991 (OJNo L 160, 25.6.1991, p.6)</p>

<p>3. 391R1601: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1601/91 of 10 June 1991 laying<br>down general rules on the definition, description and presentation of aroma-<br>tized wines, aromatized wine-based drinks and aromatized wine-product<br>cocktails (OJ No L 149, 14.6.1991, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;Article 2(2) shall be completed as follows:</p>
<p>(d) Starkvinsglögg:</p>
<p>Aromatized wine which has been prepared from wine as referred to<br>in paragraph l(a), the characteristic taste of which is obtained by the<br>use of cloves which must always be used together with other spices;<br>this drink may be sweetened according to Article 3(a).</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;In the heading and text of Article 2(3)(f), “or vinglögg” shall be in-<br>serted after “Gluhwein”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Articles 8(7), 8(8), 9(2), 10 and 11 shall not apply.</p>

<h1>ANNEX III</h1>
<h1>PRODUCT LIABILITY</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 23 (c)</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provi-<br>ded for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACT REFERRED TO</p>
<p>385 L 0374: Council Directive 85/374/EEC of 25 July 1985 on the approxima-<br>tion of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member<br>States concerning liability for defective products (OJ No L 210, 7.8.1985, p.<br>29)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;As regards the liability of the importer as foreseen in Article 3(2),<br>the following shall apply:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;Without prejudice to the liability of the producer any person<br>who imports into the EEA a product for sale, hire, leasing or<br>any form of distribution in the course of his business shall be<br>responsible as a producer.</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;The same applies as concerns imports from an EFTA State<br>into the Community or from the Community into an EFTA<br>State or from an EFTA State into another EFTA State.</p>
<p>From the date of entry into force for any EC Member State<br>or EFTA State of the Lugano Convention on jurisdiction and<br>the enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters<br>of 16 September 1988, the first sentence of this subparagraph<br>shall no longer apply between those States which have ratified<br>the Convention to the extent a national judgement in favour<br>of the injured person is, by the fact of those ratifications, en-<br>forceable against the producer or the importer within the<br>meaning of subparagraph (i).</p>
<p>(iii) &nbsp;&nbsp;Switzerland and Liechtenstein may waive importer’s liability<br>between themselves.</p>
<p>(b) As regards Article 14 the following shall apply:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex III</p>
<p>452</p>
<p>The Directive shall not apply to injury or damage arising from nuclear acci-<br>dents and covered by an international convention ratified by EFTA States<br>and EC Member States.</p>
<p>For Switzerland and Liechtenstein in addition the Directive shall not apply<br>if their national law provides equivalent protection to that afforded by inter-<br>national conventions within the meaning mentioned above.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex III</p>
<p>453</p>
<h1>ANNEX IV</h1>
<h1>ENERGY</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 24</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provi-<br>ded for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 372 R 1056: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1056/72 of 18 May 1972 on<br>notifying the Commission of investment projects of interest to the Commu-<br>nity in the petroleum, natural gas and electricity sectors (OJNo L 120,<br>25.5.1972, p. 7), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;376 R 1215: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1215/76 of 4 May 1976<br>amending Council Regulation (EEC) No 72/1056 (OJ No L 140,<br>28.5.1976, p. 1)</p>
<p>2. 375 L 0405: Council Directive 75/405/EEC of 14 April 1975 concerning<br>the restriction of the use of petroleum products in power stations (OJ No L<br>178, 9.7.1975, p. 26)</p>
<p>3. 376 L 0491: Council Directive 76/491/EEC of 4 May 1976 regarding a<br>Community procedure for information and consultation on the prices of<br>crude oil and petroleum products in the Community (OJNo L 140,<br>28.5.1976, p. 4)</p>
<p>4. 378 L 0170: Council Directive 78/170/EEC of 13 February 1978 on the<br>performance of heat generators for space heating and the production of hot<br>water in new or existing non-industrial buildings and on the insulation of heat<br>and domestic hot-water distribution in new non-industrial buildings (OJ No<br>L 052, 23.2.1978, p. 32), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;382 L 0885: Council Directive 82/885/EEC of 10 December 1982 (OJ<br>NoL378, 31.12.1982, p. 19)</p>
<p>5. 379 R 1893: Council Regulation (EEC) 79/1893 of 28 August 1979 intro-<br>ducing registration for crude oil and/or petroleum product imports in the<br>Community (OJ No L 220, 30.8.1979, p. 1), as amended by:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IV</p>
<p>454</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;388 R 4152: Council Regulation (EEC) No 88/4152 of 21 December<br>1988 (OJ No L 367, 31.12.1988, p. 7)</p>
<p>6. 385 L 0536: Council Directive 85/536/EEC of 5 December 1985 on crude-<br>oil savings through the use of substitute fuel components in petrol (OJ No L<br>334, 12.12.1985, p. 20), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;387 L 0441: Commission Directive 87/441/EEC of 29 July 1987 on<br>crude-oil savings through the use of substitute fuel components in<br>petrol (OJ No L 238, 21.8.1987, p. 40)</p>
<p>7. 390 L 0377: Council Directive 90/377/EEC of 29 June 1990 concerning a<br>Community procedure to improve the transparency of gas and electricity pri-<br>ces charged to industrial end-users (OJ No L185, 17.7.1990, p. 16)'</p>
<p>8. 390 L 0547: Council Directive 90/547/EEC of 29 October 1990 on the<br>transit of electricity through transmission grids (OJ No L 313, 13.11.1990, p.<br>30)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 3(4),</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;each of the entities concerned may request that, with regard<br>to intra-Community trade, the conditions of transit be subject<br>to conciliation by a body set up and chaired by the Commis-<br>sion and on which the entities responsible for transmission<br>grids in the Community are represented;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;each of the entities concerned may request that, with regard<br>to intra-EFTA trade, the conditions of transit be subject to<br>conciliation by a body set up and chaired by the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority and on which the entities responsible for<br>transmission grids in the EFTA countries are represented;</p>
<p>(iii) &nbsp;each of the entites concerned may request that, with regard<br>to trade between the Community and an EFTA State, the<br>conditions of transit be subject to a conciliation procedure to<br>be decided by the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>(b) Appendix 1 contains the list of entities and grids relevant for the ap-<br>plication of this Directive in respect of EFTA States.</p>
<p>9. 391 L 0296: Council Directive 91/296/EEC of 31 May 1991 on the transit<br>of natural gas through grids (OJ No L 147, 12.6.1991, p. 37)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) in Article 3(4)</p>
<p>(i) each of the entities concerned may request that, with regard<br>to intra-Community trade, the conditions of transit be subject<br>to conciliation by a body set up and chaired by the Commis-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IV</p>
<p><sup>1</sup> Listed here for information purposes only: for application see Annex XXI on statis-<br>tics.<br></p>
<p>455</p>
<p>sion and on which the entities responsible for transmission<br>grids in the Community are represented;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;each of the entities concerned may request that, with regard<br>to intra-EFTA trade, the conditions of transit be subject to<br>conciliation by a body set up and chaired by the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority and on which the entities responsible for<br>transmission grids in the EFTA countries are represented;</p>
<p>(iii) &nbsp;each of the entities concerned may request that, with regard<br>to trade between the Community and an EFTA State, the<br>conditions of transit be subject to a conciliation procedure to<br>be decided by the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>(b) Appendix 2 contains the list of entities and grids relevant for the ap-<br>plication of this Directive in respect of EFTA States.</p>

<h1>ANNEX V</h1>
<h1>FREE MOVEMENT OF WORKERS</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 28</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public</p>
<p>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provi-<br>ded for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Annex and notwithstanding the provisions of Proto-<br>col 1, the term “Member State(s)” contained in the acts referred to shall be<br>understood to include, in addition to its meaning in the relevant EC acts,<br>Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden and Switzerland.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 364 L 0221: Council Directive 64/221/EEC of 25 February 1964 on the co-<br>ordination of special measures concerning the movement and residence of<br>foreign nationals which are justified on grounds of public policy, public secu-<br>rity or public health (OJ No 56,4.4.1964, p.850/64)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Article 4(3) shall not apply.</p>
<p>2. 368 R 1612: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1612/68 of 15 October 1968 on<br>freedom of movement for workers within the Community<br>(OJ No L257,19.10.1968, p.2), as amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;376 R 0312: Council Regulation (EEC) No 312/76 of 9 February 1976</p>
<p>(OJ No L39,14.2.1976, p.2)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 15(2), the phrase “within eighteen months following the<br>entry into force of this Regulation” shall not apply.</p>
<p>(b) Article 40 shall not apply.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex V</p>
<p>459</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 41 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(d) Article 42(1) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;In Article 42(2), the reference to Article 51 of the EEC Treaty shall<br>be replaced by reference to Article 29 of this Agreement.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;Article 48 shall not apply.</p>
<p>3. 368 L 0360: Council Directive 68/360/EEC of 15 October 1968 on the abo-<br>lition of restrictions on movement and residence within the Community for<br>workers of Member States and their families (OJ No L257,19.10.1968, p.13)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In Article 4(2), the words “Residence Permit for a national of a<br>Member State of the EEC” shall be replaced by “Residence Per-<br>mit”.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 4(3), the words “Residence Permit for a national of a<br>Member State of the EEC” shall be replaced by “Residence Per-<br>mit”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 11 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(d) Article 13 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(e) In the Annex:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the first paragraph of the statement shall be replaced by the<br>following:</p>
<p>“This permit is issued pursuant to Regulation (EEC)<br>No 1612/68 of 15 October 1968 and to the measures taken in<br>implementation of Directive 68/360/EEC as integrated into<br>the EEA Agreement.”;</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;the footnote shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“Austrian, Belgian, British, Danish, German, Greek, Icelan-<br>dic, Irish, Finnish, French, Italian, Liechtenstein, Luxem-<br>bourg, Netherlands, Norwegian, Portuguese, Spanish, Swe-<br>dish, Swiss, according to the country issuing the permit.”.</p>
<p>4. 370 R 1251: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1251/70 of 29 June 1970<br>on the right of workers to remain in the territory of a Member State after<br>having been employed in that State (OJ No L142,30.6.1970, p.24)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Article 9 shall not apply.</p>
<p>5. 372 L 0194: Council Directive 72/194/EEC of 18 May 1972 extending to<br>workers exercising the right to remain in the territory of a Member State<br>after having been employed in that State the scope of Directive 64/221/EEC<br>(OJ No L121,26.5.1972, p.32)</p>
<p>6. 377 L 0486: Council Directive 77/486/EEC of 25 July 1977 on the educa-<br>tion of the children of migrant workers (OJ No L 199, 6.8.1977, p.32)</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex V</p>
<p>460</p>
<h1>ANNEX VI</h1>
<h1>SOCIAL SECURITY</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 29</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- references to territories or languages of the EC;references to rights and<br>obligations of EC Member States, their public entities, undertakings or<br>individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provi-<br>ded for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>I. &nbsp;&nbsp;For the purposes of this Annex and notwithstanding the provisions<br>of Protocol 1, the term “Member State(s)” contained in the acts re-<br>ferred to shall be understood to include, in addition to its meaning<br>in the relevant EC acts, Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein,<br>Norway, Sweden and Switzerland.</p>
<p>II. &nbsp;In applying the provisions of the acts referred to in this Annex for<br>the purposes of the present Agreement, the rights and duties confer-<br>red upon the Administrative Commission on Social Security for Mi-<br>grant Workers attached to the EC Commission and the rights and<br>duties conferred upon the Audit Board attached to the said Admi-<br>nistrative Commission shall be assumed, according to the provisions<br>of Part VII of the Agreement, by the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>ACTS REFFERED TO</p>
<p>1. Council Regulation (EEC) No 1408/71 of 14 June 1971 on the application<br>of social security schemes to employed persons, to self-employed persons<br>and to members of their families moving within the Community,</p>
<p>as updated by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;383 R 2001: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2001/83 of 2 June 1983<br>(OJ No L 230, 22.8.1983, p.6)</p>
<p>and subsequently amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;385 R 1660: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1660/85 of 13 June 1985<br>(OJ No L 160, 20.6.1985, p.l)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;385 R 1661: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1661/85 of 13 June 1985</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>461</p>
<p>(OJ No L 160, 20.6.1985, p.7)</p>
<p>1 85 I: Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties Ö Accession to the European Communities of<br>the Kingdom of Spain and the Portuguese Republic (OJ No L 302,<br>15.11.1985, p.170)</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>

<p>(c) &nbsp;In Article 88, the words “Article 106 of the Treaty” shall be replaced<br>by the words “Article 41 of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(d) Article 94(9) shall not apply.(e) Article 96 shall not apply.</p>

<p>O. &nbsp;ICELAND</p>

<p>(c) Article 3 of the said Convention as regards persons resi-<br>ding in a third State.</p>
<p>(d) Paragraph 3(g) of the Final Protocol to the said Conven-<br>tion as regards persons residing in a third State.</p>
<p>(e) Article 4(1) of the Convention as regards the German le-<br>gislation, under which accidents (and occupational disea-<br>ses) occuring outside the territory of the Federal Repu-<br>blic of Germany, and periods completed outside that ter-<br>ritory, do not give rise to payment of benefits, or only<br>give rise to payment of benefits under certain conditions,<br>when those entitled to them reside outside the territory<br>of the Federal Republic of Germany, in cases in which:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;the benefit at the date of entry into force of the Agree-<br>ment is already granted or could be granted;</p>
<p>(ii) the person concerned has taken up ordinary residence in<br>Austria before the entry into force of the Agreement and<br>the granting of pensions from pension and accident insu-<br>rance started within one year of the entry into force of<br>the Agreement.</p>
<p>(f) Paragraph 19(b) of the Final Protocol to the said Conven-<br>tion. In applying Number 3 (c) of this provision the<br>amount taken into account by the competent institution<br>shall not exceed the amount, which is due in respect of the<br>corresponding periods to be remunerated by this institu-<br>tion.</p>
<p>(g) Article 2 of the Complementary Convention No 1 of 10<br>April 1969 to the said Convention.</p>
<p>(h) Articles 1(5) and 8 of the Convention on unemployment<br>insurance of 19 July 1978.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>465</p>
<p>30 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 15</p>
<p>(i) Paragraph 10 of the Final Protocol to the said Convention.</p>

<p>AUSTRIA - GERMANY</p>

<p>(e) Article 4(1) of the Convention as regards the German le-<br>gislation, under which accidents (and occupational disea-<br>ses) occuring outside the territory of the Federal Repu-<br>blic of Germany, and periods completed outside that ter-<br>ritory, do not give rise to payment of benefits, or only<br>give rise to payment of benefits under certain conditions,<br>when those entitled to them reside outside the territory<br>of the Federal Republic of Germany, in casesin which:</p>
<p>(i) the benefit at the date of entry into force of the Agree-<br>ment is already granted or could be granted;</p>

<p>(f) Paragraph 19(b) of the Final Protocol to the said Conven-<br>tion. <p>31 Riksdagen 199H92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 15<br></p>

<p>171. SWITZERLAND - UNITED KINGDOM</p>
<p>Article 3(1) and (2) of the Convention on social security of<br>21 February 1968 as regards the payment of cash benefits to<br>persons residing in a third State.&quot;</p>
<p>(m) The following shall be added to Annex IV:</p>
<p>“M. AUSTRIA</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>N. &nbsp;FINLAND</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>O. &nbsp;ICELAND</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>P. &nbsp;&nbsp;LIECHTENSTEIN</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>Q. &nbsp;NORWAY</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>R. &nbsp;SWEDEN</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>S. &nbsp;&nbsp;SWITZERLAND</p>
<p>None.</p>
<p>(n) The following shall be added to Annex VI:</p>
<p>“M. AUSTRIA</p>
<p>1. For the purpose of applying Chapter 1 of Title III of the<br>Regulation, a person receiving a civil servanfs pension<br>shall be considered to be a pensioner.</p>
<p>2. For the purpose of applying Article 46(2) of the Regula-<br>tion, increments for contributions for supplementary insu-<br>rance and the miner’s supplementary benefit under Aust-<br>rian legislation shall be disregarded. In these cases the<br>amount calculated according to Article 46(2) of the Regu-<br>lation shall be increased by increments for contributions<br>for supplementary insurance and the miner’s supplemen-<br>tary benefit.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>482</p>
<p>3. For the purpose of applying Article 46(2) of the Regula-<br>tion, in applying Austrian legislation the day relevant for<br>a pension (Stichtag) shall be considered as the date when<br>the risk materializes.</p>
<p>4. The application of the provisions of the Regulation shall<br>not have the effect of reducing any entitlement to benefits<br>by virtue of Austrian legislation with regard to persons<br>who have suffered in their social security situation for poli-<br>tical or religious reasons or for reasons of their descent.</p>
<p>N. &nbsp;FINLAND</p>
<p>1. In order to determine whether the period between the oc-<br>currence of the pension contingency and the pensionable<br>age (future period) should be taken into account when cal-<br>culating the amount of the Finnish employment pension,<br>the periods of insurance or residence under the legislation<br>of another State to which this Regulation applies shall be<br>taken into consideration for the condition relating to resi-<br>dence in Finland.</p>
<p>2. Where employment or self-employment in Finland has<br>terminated and the contingency occurs during employ-<br>ment or self-employment in another State to which this<br>Regulation applies and where the pension according to the<br>Finnish employment pension legislation no longer inclu-<br>des the period between the contingency and the pensio-<br>nable age (future period), periods of insurance under the<br>legislation of another State to which this Regulation ap-<br>plies shall be taken into consideration for the requirement<br>of the future period as if they were periods of insurance in<br>Finland.</p>
<p>3. When, under the legislation of Finland, an increment is<br>payable by an institution in Finland because of a delay in<br>processing a claim for a benefit, a claim submitted to an<br>institution of another State to which this Regulation ap-<br>plies shall, for the purpose of applying the provisions of<br>the Finnish legislation relating to such increment, be consi-<br>dered to have been presented on the date when that claim,<br>along with all necessary enclosures, reaches the competent<br>institution in Finland.</p>
<p>O. &nbsp;ICELAND</p>
<p>Where employment or self-employment in Iceland has ter-<br>minated and the contingency occurs during employment or<br>self-employment in another State to which this Regulation<br>applies and where the disability pension of both the social<br>security and the supplementary pension schemes (pension<br>funds) in Iceland no longer includes the period between<br>the contingency and the pensionable age (future periods),<br>periods of insurance under the legislation of another State<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>483</p>
<p>to which this Regulation applies shall be taken into consi-<br>deration for the requirement of the future periods as if they<br>were periods of insurance in Iceland.</p>
<p>P. &nbsp;&nbsp;LIECHTENSTEIN</p>
<p>Any employed or self-employed person who is no longer<br>subject to the Liechtenstein legislation on invalidity insu-<br>rance shall, for the purpose of Chapter 3 of Title III of the<br>Regulation, be considered as insured under this insurance<br>for the granting of an ordinary invalidity pension if:</p>
<p>(a) either for the date on which the insurance risk materiali-<br>zes according to the provisions of the Liechtenstein legis-<br>lation on invalidity insurance:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;he benefits from rehabilitation measures provided<br>under the invalidity insurance of Liechtenstein; or</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;he is insured under the legislation on old age, survi-<br>vors’ or invalidity insurance of another State to<br>which this Regulation applies; or</p>
<p>(iii) he can establish a claim to pensions under the invali-<br>dity or old age insurance of another State to which<br>this Regulation applies or if he receives such a pen-<br>sion; or</p>
<p>(iv) he is incapable for work under the legislation of an-<br>other State to which this Regulation applies and can<br>establish a claim to benefits from the sickness or ac-<br>cident insurance of that State or if he receives such a<br>benefit; or</p>
<p>(v) &nbsp;he can establish a claim, due to unemployment, to<br>cash benefits from the unemployment insurance of<br>another State to which this Regulation applies or if<br>he receives such a benefit;</p>
<p>(b) or if he worked in Liechtenstein as a frontier worker<br>and, within the three years immediately before the risk<br>materializes according to the Liechtenstein legislation,<br>he paid contributions under this legislation for at least<br>twelve months; or</p>
<p>(c) if he has to give up his employment or self-employment<br>in Liechtenstein following an accident or illness, for as<br>long as he stays in Liechtenstein; he shall be required to<br>contribute on the same basis as a person without a gainful<br>activity.</p>
<p>Q. &nbsp;NORWAY</p>
<p>1. The transitional provisions of the Norwegian legislation<br>entailing a reduction of the insurance period which is re-<br>quired for a full supplementary pension for persons bom<br>before 1937 shall be applicable to persons covered by the<br>Regulation provided that they have been residents of Nor-<br>way, or engaged in gainful occupation as employed or self-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>484</p>
<p>employed in Norway, for such a number of years as is re-<br>quired after their sixteenth birthday and before 1 January<br>1967. This requirement shall be one year for each year the<br>person’s year of birth falls before 1937.</p>
<p>2. A person insured under the National Insurance Act who<br>provides care to insured care-needing old, disabled or sick<br>persons shall, according to prescribed conditions, be credi-<br>ted pension points for such periods. Likewise, a person<br>who takes care of small children shall be credited pension<br>points when staying in another State to which this Regula-<br>tion applies than Norway provided that the person concer-<br>ned is on parental leave under Norwegian labour law.</p>
<p>R. &nbsp;SWEDEN</p>
<p>1. When applying Article 18(1) for the purpose of establish-<br>ing a person’s entitlement to a parental benefits periods of<br>insurance completed under the legislation of another State<br>to which this Regulation applies than Sweden shall be con-<br>sidered to be based on the same average earnings as the<br>Swedish periods of insurance to which they are aggrega-<br>ted.</p>
<p>2. The provisions of the Regulation on the aggregation of in-<br>surance or residence periods shall not apply to the transi-<br>tional rules of the Swedish legislation on the right to a<br>more favourable calculation of basic pensions for persons<br>residing in Sweden for a specified period preceding the<br>date of the claim.</p>
<p>3. For the purpose of establishing the entitlement to an inva-<br>lidity or survivor’s pension partly based on future assumed<br>insurance periods a person shall be considered to meet the<br>insurance and income requirements of the Swedish legisla-<br>tion when covered as an employed or self-employed per-<br>son by an insurance or residence scheme of another State<br>to which this Regulation applies.</p>
<p>4. Years of care of small children shall, according to prescri-<br>bed conditions of the Swedish legislation, be considered<br>as insurance periods for supplementary pension purposes<br>even when the child and the person concerned are residing<br>in another State to which this Regulation applies, provided<br>that the person taking care of the child is on parental leave<br>under the provisions of the Law on Right to Leave for<br>Child Rearing.</p>
<p>S. &nbsp;&nbsp;SWITZERLAND</p>
<p>1. Where according to the provisions of the Regulation a per-<br>son is entitled to apply for membership with a Swiss recog-<br>nized sickness fund, the members of his family residing in<br>the territory of another State to which this Regulation ap-<br>plies are also entitled to apply for membership with the<br>same sickness fund.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>485</p>
<p>2. For the purposes of Article 9(2) and Article 18(1) of the<br>Regulation, insurance periods completed under the legis-<br>lation of another State to which this Regulation applies<br>shall be taken into account as if the person concerned was<br>a “Ziiger - passant - passante” (passer) according to the<br>Swiss legislation. The insurance or entitlement as a mem-<br>ber of the family is assimilated to a personal insurance.</p>
<p>3. Any employed or self-employed person who is no longer<br>subject to the Swiss legislation on invalidity insurance<br>shall, for the purposes of Chapter 3 of Title III of the Re-<br>gulation, be considered as insured under this insurance for<br>the granting of an ordinary invalidity pension if:</p>
<p>(a) either for the date on which the insurance risk materiali-<br>zes according to the provisions of the Swiss legislation on<br>invalidity insurance:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;he benefits from rehabilitation measures provided under<br>the Swiss invalidity insurance; or</p>
<p>(ii) &nbsp;he is insured under the legislation on old age, survivors’<br>or invalidity insurance of another State to which this Re-<br>gulation applies; or</p>
<p>(iii) he can establish a claim to pensions under the invalidity<br>or old age insurance of another State to which this Regu-<br>lation applies or if he receives such a pension; or</p>
<p>(v) he is incapable for work under the legislation of another<br>State to which this Regulation applies and can establish<br>a claim to benefits from the sickness or accident insu-<br>rance of that State or if he receives such a benefit; or</p>
<p>(v) he can establish a claim, due to unemployment, to cash<br>benefits from the unemployment insurance of another<br>State to which this Regulation applies or if he receives<br>such a benefit;</p>
<p>(b) or if he worked in Switzerland as a frontier worker and,<br>within the three years immediately before the risk mate-<br>rializes according to the Swiss legislation, he paid contri-<br>butions under this legislation for at least twelve months;</p>
<p>(c) or if he has to give up his employment or self-employment<br>in Switzerland following an accident or illness, for as long<br>as he stays in Switzerland; he shall be required to contri-<br>bute on the same basis as a person without a gainful acti-<br>vity.&quot;</p>
<p>(o) The following shall be added to Annex VII:</p>
<p>10. Where a person is self-employed in Austria and gainfully<br>employed in any other State to which this Regulation ap-<br>plies.</p>
<p>11. Where a person resident in Finland is self-employed in<br>Finland and gainfully employed in any other State to<br>which this Regulation applies.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>486</p>
<p>12. Where a person resident in Iceland is self-employed in<br>Iceland and gainfully employed in any other State to<br>which this Regulation applies.</p>
<p>13. Where a person is self-employed in Liechtenstein and<br>gainfully employed in any other State to which this Regu-<br>lation applies.</p>
<p>14. Where a person resident in Norway is self-employed in<br>Norway and gainfully employed in any other State to<br>which this Regulation applies.</p>
<p>15. Where a person resident in Sweden is self-employed in<br>Sweden and gainfully employed in any other State to<br>which this Regulation applies.</p>
<p>16. Where a person is self-employed in Switzerland and gain-<br>fully employed in any other State to which this Regula-<br>tion applies.&quot;</p>
<p>2. Council Regulation (EEC) No 574/72 of 21 March 1972 laying down the<br>procedure for implementing Regulation No 1408/71/EEC on the application<br>of social security schemes to employed persons, to self-employed persons<br>and to their families moving within the Community,</p>
<p>as updated by:</p>
<p>383 R 2001: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2001/83 of 2 June 1983<br>(OJ No L 230, 22.8.1983, p.6)</p>

<p>385 R 1661: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1661/85 of 13 June</p>
<p>1985 (OJ No L 160, 20.6.1985, p.7)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;1 85 I: Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and the Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties - Accession to the European Communities of<br>the Kingdom of Spain and the Portuguese Republic (OJ No L 302,<br>15.11 1985, p. 188)</p>
<p>386 R 513: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 513/86 of 26 February</p>
<p>1986 (OJ No L 51, 28.2.1986, p. 44)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;386 R 3811: Council Regulation (EEC) No 3811/86 of 11 December<br>1986 (OJ No L 355, 16.12.1986, p. 5)</p>
<p>389 R 1305: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1305/89 of 11 May 1989<br>(OJ No L 131, 13.5.1989, p.l)</p>
<p>389 R 2332: Council Regulation (EEC) No 2332/89 of 18 July 1989<br>(OJ No L 224, 2.8.1989, p.l)</p>

<p>(b) The following shall be added to Annex 2:</p>
<p>“M. AUSTRIA</p>
<p>The competence of the Austrian institutions shall be gover-<br>ned by the provisions of Austrian legislation, unless otherwise<br>specified hereinafter:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>488</p>
<p>1. Sickness insurance</p>
<p>(a) Where the person concerned is resident in the territory<br>of another State to which this Regulation applies and a<br>Gebietskrankenkasse (Regional Fund for Sickness Insu-<br>rance) is competent for an insurance and under Austrian<br>legislation the local competence cannot be decided the lo-<br>cal competence shall be determined as follows:</p>
<p>- Gebietskrankenkasse (Regional Fund for Sickness Insu-<br>rance) competent for the last employment in Austria, or</p>
<p>- Gebietskrankenkasse (Regional Fund for Sickness Insu-<br>rance) competent for the last residence in Austria, or</p>
<p>- if there has never been an employment for which a Gebiets-<br>krankenkasse (Regional Fund for Sickness Insurance) was<br>competent or there has never been a residence in Austria,<br>the Wiener Gebietskrankenkasse (Regional Fund for Sick-<br>ness Insurance of Vienna), Wien.</p>
<p>(b) For the purpose of applying Sections 4 and 5 of Chapter<br>1 of Part III of the Regulation in connection with Article<br>95 of the implementing Regulation in relation to the re-<br>fund of the expenses for benefits to persons entitled to a<br>pension under the ASVG (General Social Insurance<br>Law):</p>
<p>Hauptverband der österreichischen Sozialversicherungsträ-<br>ger (Main Association of Austrian Social Insurance Institu-<br>tions), Wien, it being understood that the refund of the ex-<br>penses shall be made from contributions for sickness insu-<br>rance of the pensioners received by the said Main Associa-<br>tion.</p>
<p>2. Pension insurance</p>
<p>In determining the institution responsible for paying a benefit<br>only insurance periods under the Austrian legislation shall be<br>taken into consideration.</p>
<p>3. Unemployment insurance</p>
<p>(a) For the announcement of being unemployed:<br>Arbeitsamt (Employment Office) competent for the place of<br>residence or place of stay of the person concerned.</p>
<p>(b) For the issue of the Forms Nos. E 301, E 302 and E 303:<br>Arbeitsamt (Employment Office) competent for the place of<br>employment of the person concerned.</p>
<p>4. Family benefits:</p>
<p>(a) Family benefits with the exception of Karenzurlaubsgeld<br>(special maternity allowance):</p>
<p>Finanzamt (Finance Office).</p>
<p>(b) Karenzurlaubsgeld (special maternity allowance):<br>Arbeitsamt (Employment Office) competent for the place of<br>residence or place of stay of the person concerned.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>

<p>N. FINLAND</p>

<p>S. SWITZERLAND</p>
<p>1. Sickness and maternity:</p>
<p>492</p>

<p>(i) &nbsp;Persons residing in Switzerland:</p>

<p>(ii) &nbsp;Persons residing outside Switzerland:</p>

<p>(b) Occupational scheme:</p>
<p>the pension fund to which the last employer is affiliated.</p>
<p>4. Accidents at work and occupational diseases:</p>
<p>(a) Employed persons:</p>
<p>the accidents insurer with which the employer is insured.</p>
<p>(b) Self-employed persons:</p>
<p>the accidents insurer with which the person is voluntarily in-<br>sured.</p>
<p>5. Unemployment:</p>
<p>(a) In case of whole unemployment:</p>
<p>the unemployment insurance fund chosen by the employed<br>person.</p>
<p>(b) In case of partial unemployment:</p>
<p>the unemployment insurance fund chosen by the employer.</p>
<p>6. Family benefits:</p>
<p>(a) Federal scheme:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;Employed persons:</p>

<p>Annex VI</p>

<p>(a) Invalidity insurance:</p>
<p>Liechtensteinische Invalidenversicherung (Invalidity Insu-<br>rance of Liechtenstein).</p>
<p>(b) Occupational scheme:</p>
<p>Amt fiir Volkswirtschaft (Office of National Economy).</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>496</p>
<p>4. Family benefits:</p>
<p>Liechtensteinische Familienausgleichskasse (Families’ Com-<br>pensation Fund of Liechtenstein).</p>
<p>Q. &nbsp;NORWAY</p>
<p>De lokale arbeidskontor og trygdekontor på bostedet eller<br>oppholdsstedet (the local labour and insurance offices of the<br>place of residence or the place of stay).</p>
<p>R. &nbsp;SWEDEN</p>
<p>1. For all contingencies except unemployment benefits:</p>
<p>the social insurance office of the place of residence or place<br>of stay.</p>
<p>2. For unemployment benefits:</p>
<p>the employment office of the place of the residence or palce<br>of stay.</p>
<p>S. &nbsp;&nbsp;SWITZERLAND</p>
<p>1. Invalidity:</p>
<p>(a) Invalidity insurance:</p>
<p>Schweizerische Ausgleichskasse, Genf - Caisse suisse de<br>compensation, Geneve - Cassa svizzera di compensazione,<br>Ginevra - (Swiss Compensation Fund, Geneva).</p>
<p>2. Old age and death:</p>
<p>Old age and survivors insurance:</p>
<p>Schweizerische Ausgleichskasse, Genf - Caisse suisse de<br>compensation, Geneve - Cassa svizzera di compensazione,<br>Ginevra - (Swiss Compensation Fund, Geneva).</p>
<p>3. Accidents at work and occupational diseases:<br>Schweizerische Unfallversicherungsanstalt, Luzern - Caisse<br>nationale suisse d’assurance en cas d’accidents, Lucerne -<br>Cassa nazionale svizzera di assicurazione contro gli incidenti,<br>Lucerna - (Swiss National Accidents Insurance Fund, Lu-<br>cerne).</p>
<p>4. Unemployment:</p>
<p>(a) In case of whole unemployment:</p>
<p>the unemployment insurance fund chosen by the employed<br>person.</p>
<p>(b) In case of partial unemployment:</p>
<p>the unemployment insurance fund chosen by the employer.&quot;</p>

<p>Q. NORWAY</p>
<p>1. For the purpose of applying Articles 14(l)(a) and (b) of<br>the Regulation, Article ll(l)(a) and (2) of the implemen-<br>ting Regulation when the work is carried out outside Nor-<br>way, and Article 14a(l)(b):</p>
<p>Folketrygdkontoret for utenlandssaker (the National<br>Insurance Office for Social Insurance Abroad), Oslo.</p>
<p>2. For the purpose of applying Article 14a(l)(a) if the work<br>is carried out in Norway:</p>
<p>The local insurance office in the municipality where the<br>person concerned is resident.</p>
<p>3. For the purpose of applying Article 14(l)(a) of the Regula-<br>tion, if the person concerned is posted in Norway:</p>
<p>The local insurance office in the municipality where the<br>employer’s representative is registered in Norway, and if<br>the employer has no representative in Norway, the local<br>insurance office in the municipality where the work is car-<br>ried out.</p>
<p>4. For the purpose of applying Article 14(2) and Article<br>14(3):</p>
<p>The local insurance office in the municipality in which<br>the person concerned is resident.</p>
<p>5. For the purpose of applying Article 14a(2):</p>
<p>The local insurance office in the municipality where the<br>work is carried out.</p>
<p>6. For the purpose of applying Article 14b(l) and (2):<br>Folketrygdkontoret for utenlandssaker (the National In-<br>surance Office for Social Insurance Abroad), Oslo.</p>
<p>7. For the purpose of applying Chapters 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 8 of<br>Part III of the Regulation and the provisions linked to<br>these provisions in the implementing Regulation:</p>
<p>Rikstrygdeverket (the National Insurance Administra-<br>tion), Oslo and its designated bodies (the regional bodies<br>and the local insurance offices).</p>
<p>8. For the purpose of applying Chapter 6 of Part III of the<br>Regulation and the provisions linked to these provisions in</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>506</p>
<p>the implementing Regulation:</p>
<p>Arbeidsdirektoratet (the Directorate of Labour), Oslo<br>and its designated bodies.</p>
<p>9. For the pension insurance scheme for seafarers:</p>
<p>(a) The local insurance office at the place of residence when<br>the person concerned is resident in Norway.</p>
<p>(b) Folketrygdkontoret for utenlandssaker (the National In-<br>surance Office for Social Insurance Abroad), Oslo in re-<br>lation to paying benefits under the Scheme to persons re-<br>sident abroad.</p>
<p>10. For family allowances:</p>
<p>Rikstrygdeverket (the National Insurance Administra-<br>tion), Oslo and its designated bodies (the local insurance<br>offices).</p>
<p>R. SWEDEN</p>
<p>1. For the purpose of applying Articles 14(1), 14a(l), 14b(l)<br>and (2) of the Regulation and Articles ll(l)(a) and lla(l)<br>of the implementing Regulation:</p>
<p>The social insurance office with which the person con-<br>cerned is insured.</p>
<p>2. For the purpose of applying Articles 14(l)(b) and<br>14a(l)(b) in cases when a person is posted to Sweden:<br>The social insurance office at the place where the work is<br>preformed.</p>
<p>3. For the purpose of applying Articles 14b(l) and (2) in ca-<br>ses when a person is posted to Sweden for a longer period<br>than 12 months:</p>
<p>Göteborgs allmänna försäkringskassa, Sjöfartskontoret<br>(Social Insurance Office of Gothenburg, Mariners’ sec-<br>tion).</p>
<p>4. For the purpose of applying Articles 14(2) and (3), 14a(2)<br>and (3) of the Regulation:</p>
<p>The social insurance office of the place of residence.</p>
<p>5. For the purpose of applying Articles 14a(4) of the Regula-<br>tion and Articles ll(l)(b), lla(l)(b) and 12a(5),(6) and<br>(7)(a) of the implementing Regulation:</p>
<p>The social insurance office at the place where the work is<br>performed.</p>
<p>6. For the purpose of applying Article 17 of the Regulation:</p>
<p>(a) The social insurance office at the place where the work is<br>or will be performed, and</p>
<p>(b) Riksförsäkringsverket (National Social Insurance Board)<br>concerning categories of employed or self-employed per-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>sons.</p>
<p>507</p>
<p>7. For the purpose of applying Article 102(2):</p>
<p>(a) Riksförsäkringsverket (National Social Insurance<br>Board).</p>
<p>(b) Arbetsmarknadsstyrelsen (National Labour Market<br>Board), for unemployment benefits.</p>
<p>S. SWITZERLAND</p>

<p>518</p>
<p>MODALITIES FOR THE PARTICIPATION OF EFTA<br>STATES IN THE ADMINISTRATIVE COMMISSION ON<br>SOCIAL SECURITY FOR MIGRANT WORKERS AND<br>IN THE AUDIT BOARD ATTACHED TO THIS<br>COMMISSION IN ACCORDANCE WITH ARTICLE<br>101(1) OF THE AGREEMENT</p>
<p>Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden and Switzerland<br>may each send a representative, present in an advisory capacity (observer),<br>to the meetings of the Administrative Commission on Social Security for Mi-<br>grant Workers attached to the Commission of the European Communities<br>and to the meetings of the Audit Board attached to the said Administrative<br>Commission.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VI</p>
<p>519</p>
<h1>ANNEX VII</h1>
<h1>MUTUAL RECOGNITION OF<br>PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 23 (c)</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Annex and notwithstanding the provisions of Proto-<br>col 1, the term “Member State(s)” contained in the acts referred to shall be<br>understood to include, in addition to its meaning in the relevant EC acts,<br>Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden and Switzerland.</p>
<p>ACTS REFFERED TO</p>
<p>A. GENERAL SYSTEM</p>
<p>1. 389 L 0048: Council Directive 89/48/EECof 21 December 1988 on a gene-<br>ral system for the recognition of higher-education diplomas awarded on<br>completion of professional education and training of at least three years’ du-<br>ration (OJ No L 19, 24.1.1989, p.16)</p>
<p>Switzerland, by derogation from the provisions from Directive<br>89/48/EEC, as adapted in this Agreement, shall comply with the obligations<br>stated therein at the latest by 1 January 1995 instead of 1 January 1993.</p>
<p>B. LEGAL PROFESSIONS</p>

<p>C. MEDICAL AND PARA-MEDICAL ACTIVITIES</p>
<p>3. 381 L 1057: Council Directive 81/1057/EEC of 14 December 1981<br>supplementing Directives 75/362/EEC, 77/452/EEC, 78/686/EEC and</p>
<p>78/1026/EEC concerning the mutual recognition of diplomas, certificates<br>and other evidence of the formal qualifications of doctors, nurses respon-<br>sible for general care, dental practitioners and veterinary surgeons respecti-<br>vely, with regard to acquired rights (OJ No L 385, 31.12.1981, p.25)</p>
<p>Doctors</p>
<p>4. 375 L 0362: Council Directive 75/362/EEC of 16 June 1975 concerning the<br>mutual recognition of diplomas, certificates and other evidence of formal</p>
<p>qualifications in medicine, including measures to facilitate the effective exer-<br>cise of the right of establishment and freedom to provide services (OJ No L<br>167, 30.6.1975, p.l), as amended by:</p>
<p>1 79 H: Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties - Accession of the Hellenic Republic<br>(OJ NoL291,19.11.1979,p.90)</p>

<p>521</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) The following shall be added to Article 3:</p>
<p>“(m)in Austria</p>
<p>“Doktor der gesamten Heilkunde” (diploma of doctor of medicine)<br>awarded by a university faculty of medicine and “Bescheinigung<br>iiber die Absolvierung der Tätigkeit als Arzt im Praktikum” (certifi-<br>cate of practical training) issued by the competent authorities;</p>
<p>(n) in Finland</p>
<p>“todistus lääketieteen lisensiaatin tutkinnosta/ bevis om medicine li-<br>centiat examen” (certificate of the degree of licentiate in medicine)<br>awarded by a university faculty of medicine and a certificate of prac-<br>tical training issued by the competent public health authorities;</p>
<p>(o) in Iceland</p>
<p>“prof i laeknisfrasi frä laeknadeild Häskola Islands” (diploma from the<br>medical faculty of the University of Iceland) and a certificate of<br>practical training in a hospital of at least 12 months issued by the<br>chief medical doctor;</p>
<p>(p) in Liechtenstein</p>
<p>the diplomas, certificates and other titles awarded in another State<br>to which this Directive applies and listed in the present Article, ac-<br>companied by a certificate on the completed practical training issued<br>by the competent authorities;</p>
<p>(q) in Norway</p>
<p>“bevis for bestått medisinsk embetseksamen” (diploma of the deg-<br>ree cand.med.) awarded by a university faculty of medicine and a<br>certificate of practical training issued by the competent public health<br>authorities;</p>
<p>(r) &nbsp;in Sweden</p>
<p>“läkarexamen” (university medical degree) awarded by a university<br>faculty of medicine and a certificate of practical training issued by<br>the National Board of Health and Welfare;</p>
<p>(s) &nbsp;in Switzerland</p>
<p>“Eidgenössisch diplomierter Arzt/titulaire du diplöme fédéral de<br>médecin/titolare di diploma federale di medico” (diploma of doctor<br>of medicine) awarded by the Federal Department of Home Affairs.“</p>
<p>(b) The following shall be added to Article 5(2):</p>
<p>“zn Austria</p>
<p>“Facharztdiplom” (diploma of medical specialist) issued by the com-<br>petent authorities;</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VII</p>
<p>522</p>
<p>in Finland</p>

<p>5. 375 L 0363: Council Directive 75/363/EECof 16 June 1975 concerning the<br>co-ordination of provisions laid down by law, regulation or administrative</p>
<p>action in respect of activities of doctors (OJ No L 167, 30.6.1975, p.14), as<br>amended by:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;382 L 0076: Council Directive 82/76/EEC of 26 January 1982<br>(OJNoL43, 15.2.1982, p.21)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;389 L 0594: Council Directive 89/594/EEC of 30 October 1989<br>(OJNoL341, 23.11.1989, p.19)</p>
<p>Switzerland, by derogation from the provisions of Directive 75/363/EEC,<br>as adapted in this Agreement, shall comply with the obligations stated the-<br>rein at the latest by 1 January 1997 instead of 1 January 1993.</p>
<p>6. 386 L 0457: Council Directive 86/457/EEC of 15 September 1986 on speci-<br>fic training in general medical practice (OJ No L 267,19.9.1986, p.26)</p>
<p>Norway, by derogation from the provisions of Article 1 of Directive<br>86/457/EEC, as adapted in this Agreement, shall comply with the obligations<br>stated therein at the latest by 1 January 1995 instead of 1 January 1993.</p>
<p>Switzerland, by derogation from the provisions of Directive 86/457/EEC,<br>as adapted in this Agreement, shall comply with the obligations stated the-<br>rein at the latest by 1 January 1997 instead of 1 January 1993 and 1 January<br>1999 instead of 1 January 1995 respectively.</p>
<p>7. C/268/90/p.2: List 90/C 268/02 of designations of diplomas, certificates or<br>other evidence of formal qualifications as general medical practitioner<br>published in accordance with Article 12 (2) of Council Directive 86/457/EEC<br>(OJ No C 268, 14.10.1990, p.2)</p>
<p>Nurses</p>
<p>8. 377 L 0452: Council Directive 77/452/EEC of 27 June 1977 concerning the<br>mutual recognition of diplomas, certificates and other evidence of the formal<br>qualifications of nurses responsible for general care, including measures to<br>facilitate the effective exercise of this right of establishment and freedom to<br>provide services (OJ No L 176, 15.7.1977, p.l), as amended by:</p>
<p>1 79 H: Act concerning the Conditions of Accession and Adjust-<br>ments to the Treaties - Accession of the Hellenic Republic<br>(OJ NoL291,19.11.1979,p.91)</p>

<p>(d)The following shall be inserted:“Article 19 b</p>
<p>From the date on which Austria takes the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Directive, the States to which this Directive applies shall recog-<br>nize, for the purposes of carrying out the activities referred to in Article<br>1 of this Directive, as adapted for EEA purposes, the diplomas, certifica-<br>tes and other evidence of formal qualifications in medicine awarded in<br>Austria to persons who had begun their university training before the<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement, accompanied by a certificate is-<br>sued by the competent Austrian authorities, certifying that these persons<br>have effectively, lawfully and principally been engaged in Austria in the<br>activities specified in Article 5 of Directive 78/687/EEC for at least three<br>consecutive years during the five years prior to the issue of the certificate<br>and that these persons are authorized to carry out the said activities under<br>the same conditions as holders of the diploma, certificate or other evi-<br>dence of formal qualifications referred to in Article 3(m). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The requi-</p>
<p>rement of three years’ experience referred to in the first subparagraph<br>shall be waived in the case of persons who have successfully completed at<br>least three years of study which are certified by the competent authorities<br>as being equivalent to the training referred to in Article 1 of Directive<br>78/687/EEC.&quot;</p>
<p>11. 378 L 0687 xCouncil Directive 78/687/EEC of 25 July 1978 concerning<br>the co-ordination of provisions laid down by law, regulation or administra-<br>tive action in respect of the activities of dental practitioners (OJ No L 233,<br>24.8.1978, p.10)</p>

<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>In Article 6, the phrase “persons covered by Article 19 of Directive<br></p>
<p>536</p>
<p>78/686/EEC” shall read “persons covered by Article 19, 19a and 19b of Di-<br>rective 78/686/EEC”.</p>
<p>In addition, as concerns Directives 78/686/EEC and 78/687/EEC (i.e.<br>points 10 and 11 above), the following shall apply:</p>
<p>Until such time as the training of dental practitioners in Austria under the<br>conditions laid down pursuant to Directive 78/687/EEC is completed and un-<br>til 31 December 1998 at the latest, freedom of establishment and freedom to<br>provide services shall be deferred for qualified dental practitioners from the<br>other States to which this Directive applies in Austria and for qualified Aust-<br>rian doctors practising dentistry in the other States to which this Directive<br>applies.</p>
<p>During the temporary derogation provided for above, general or special<br>facilities concerning the right of establishment and freedom to provide servi-<br>ces which would exist pursuant to Austrian provisions or conventions gover-<br>ning relations between the Republic of Austria and any other State to which<br>this Directive applies will be maintained and appliedon a non-discriminatory<br>basis with regard to all other States to which this Directive applies.</p>

<p>D. ARCHITECTURE</p>
<p>18. 385 L 0384: Council Directive 85/384/EECof 10 June 1985 on the mutual<br>recognition of diplomas, certificates and other evidence of formal qualifi-<br>cations in architecture, including measures to facilitate the effective exercise<br>of the right of establishment and freedom to provide services (OJ No L 223,<br>21.8.1985, p.15), as amended by:</p>

<p>(OJNoL27, 1.2.1986, p.71)</p>
<p>390 L 0658: Council Directive 90/658/EEC of 4 December 1990<br>(OJ No L 353, 17.12.1990, p.73)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) The following shall be added to Article 11:</p>
<p>“(1) in Austria</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by Universities of Technology on architec-<br>ture (“Architektur”), building-engineering (“Bauingenieurwe-<br>sen”) or building (“Hochbau”, “Wirtschafts-ingenieurwesen-Bau-<br>wesen”, “Kulturtechnik und Wasserwirtschaft”);</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by the Academy of Fine Arts in Vienna on<br>architecture (“Meisterschule fiir Architektur”);</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VII</p>
<p>541</p>
<p>-the diplomas awarded by the Universital College of Applied Arts<br>in Vienna on architecture (“Meisterklasse fiir Architektur”);</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by the Universital College of Industrial De-<br>sign in Linz on architecture (“Meisterklasse fiir Architektur”);</p>
<p>-the diplomas of Certified Engineers (Ing.) awarded by Higher<br>Technical Colleges or Technical Colleges for Building, plus the li-<br>cence of “Baumeister” attesting a minimum of six years of profes-<br>sional experience in Austria, sanctioned by an examination;</p>
<p>- the certificates of qualification for Civil Engineers or Engineering<br>Consultants in the field of construction (“Hochbau”, “Bauwesen”,<br>“Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen-Bauwesen”, “Kulturtechnik und<br>Wasserwirtschaft”) according to the Civil Technician Act (Zivil-<br>technikergesetz, Federal Gazette No 146/1957);</p>
<p>(m) in Finland</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by the architecture departments of Univer-<br>sities of Technology and the University of Oulu (arkkitehti - arki-<br>tekt);</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by the Institutes of Technology (rakennu-<br>sarkkitehti);</p>
<p>(n) in Iceland</p>
<p>- the diplomas, certificates and other titles awarded in another State<br>to which this Directive applies and listed in the present Article,<br>accompanied by a certificate on the completed practical training<br>issued by the competent authorities;</p>
<p>(o) in Liechtenstein</p>
<p>- the diplomas of the Higher Technical College (Höhere Technische<br>Lehranstalt: Architekt HTL);</p>
<p>(p) in Norway</p>
<p>- the diplomas (sivilarkitekt) awarded by the Norwegian Institute of<br>Technology at the University of Trondheim, the Oslo College of<br>Architecture and the Bergen College of Architecture;</p>
<p>- the certificates of membership of the “Norske Arkitekters Lands-<br>forbund” (NAL) if the persons concerned have received their trai-<br>ning in a State to which this Directive applies;</p>
<p>(q) in Sweden</p>
<p>- the diplomas awarded by the School of Architecture at the Royal<br>Institute of Technology, the Chalmers Institute of Technology and<br>the Institute of Technology at Lund University (arkitekt, Master<br>of Architecture);</p>
<p>- the certificates of membership of the “Svenska Arkitekters Riks-<br>förbund” (SAR) if the persons concerned have received their trai-<br>ning in a State to which this Directive applies;</p>
