<h1>ANNEX VIII</h1>
<h1>RIGHT OF ESTABLISHMENT</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 31</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Annex and notwithstanding the provisions of Proto-<br>col 1, the term “Member State(s)” contained in the acts referred to shall be<br>understood to include, in addition to its meaning in the relevant EC acts,<br>Austria, Finland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Sweden and Switzerland.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 361X 1201P 0032/62: General Programme for the abolition of restrictions<br>on freedom to provide services (French version: OJ No 002,15.1.1962, p.32;<br>English version: English Special Edition (2nd Series) IX, p.3)</p>
<p>The provisions of the General Programme shall, for the purposes of the<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Title III, first paragraph, first indent, the reference to Article 55<br>of the EEC Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 32 of this<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;In Title III, first paragraph, second indent, the reference to Article<br>56 of the EEC Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 33 of<br>this Agreement.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In Title III, first paragraph, third indent, the reference to Article 61<br>of the EEC Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 38 of this<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;In Title VI, first paragraph, the reference to Article 57(3) of the<br>EEC Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 30 of this Ag-<br>reement.</p>
<p>2. 361 X 1202 P 0036/62: General Programme for the abolition of restrictions<br>on freedom of establishment (French version: OJ No 002, 15.1.1962, p.36;<br>English version: English Special Edition (2nd Series) IX, p.7)</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VIII</p>
<p>558</p>
<p>The provisions of the General Programme shall, for the purposes of the<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In the first paragraph of Title I, the first phrase until “attained inde-<br>pendence after the entry into force of the Treaty” shall not apply.</p>
<p>(b) The following paragraph shall be added to Title I:</p>
<p>“The references to overseas countries and territories shall be read<br>in the light of the provisions of Article 126 of the EEA Agreement.”</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In Title V, first paragraph, the reference to Article 57(3) of the EEC<br>Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 30 of the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;In Title VII, the reference to Articles 92 et seq. of the EEC Treaty<br>shall be replaced by reference to Articles 61 et seq. of the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>3. 373 L 0148: Council Directive 73/148/EEC of 21 May 1973 on the aboli-<br>tion of restrictions on movement and residence within the Community for<br>nationals of Member States with regard to establishment and the provision<br>of services (OJ No L 172, 28.6.1973, p.14)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In the second subparagraph of Article 4(1), the words “Residence<br>Permit for a National of a Member State of the European Communi-<br>ties” shall be replaced by the words “Residence Permit”.</p>
<p>(b) Article 10 shall not apply.</p>
<p>4. 375 L 0034: Council Directive 75/34/EEC of 17 December 1974 concer-<br>ning the right of nationals of a Member State to remain in the territory of<br>another Member State after having pursued therein an activity in a self-em-<br>ployed capacity (OJ No L 14, 20.1.1975, p.10)</p>
<p>5. 375 L 0035: Council Directive 75/35/EEC of 17 December 1974 extending<br>the scope of Directive 64/221/EEC to include nationals of a Member State<br>who exercise the right to remain in the territory of another Member State<br>after having pursued therein an activity in a self-employed capacity<br>(OJNoL14, 20.1.1975, p.14)</p>
<p>6. 390 L 0364: Council Directive 90/364/EEC of 28 June 1990 on the right of<br>residence (OJ No L 180, 13.7.1990, p.26)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>In the first subparagraph of Article 2(1), the words “Residence Permit for<br>a national of a Member State of the EEC” shall be replaced by the words<br>“Residence Permit”.</p>
<p>7. 390 L 0365: Council Directive 90/365/EEC of 28 June 1990 on the right of<br>residence for employees and self-employed persons who have ceased their<br>occupational activity (OJ No L 180, 13.7.1990, p.28)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VIII</p>
<p>559</p>
<p>In the first subparagraph of Article 2(1), the words “Residence Permit for<br>a national of a Member State of the EEC” shall be replaced by the words<br>“Residence Permit”.</p>
<p>8. 390 L 0366: Council Directive 90/366/EEC of 28 June 1990 on the right of<br>residence for students (OJ No L 180, 13.7.1990, p.30)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>In the second subparagraph of Article 2(1), the words “Residence Permit<br>for a national of a Member State of the EEC” shall be replaced by the words<br>“Residence Permit”.</p>
<p>9. Notwithstanding Articles 31 to 35 of the Agreement and the provisions of<br>this Annex, Iceland may continue to apply restrictions existing on the date<br>of signature of the Agreement on establishment of non-nationals and natio-<br>nals who do not have legal domicile in Iceland in the sectors of fisheries and<br>fish processing.</p>
<p>10. Notwithstanding Articles 31 to 35 of the Agreement and the provisions<br>of this Annex, Norway may continue to apply restrictions existing on the<br>date of signature of the Agreement on establishment of non-nationals in fis-<br>hing operations or companies owning or operating fishing vessels.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex VIII</p>
<p>560</p>
<h1>ANNEX IX</h1>
<h1>FINANCIAL SERVICES</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 36(2)</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>Regarding exchange of information between the competent authorities of<br>EC Member States envisaged in the acts included in this Annex, paragraph<br>7 of Protocol 1 shall apply for the purposes of this Agreement.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>I INSURANCE</p>
<p>(i) Non-life insuranc</p>
<p>1. 364 L 0225: Council Directive 64/225/EEC of 25 February 1964 on the<br>abolition of restrictions on freedom of establishment and freedom to provide<br>services in respect of reinsurance and retrocession (OJ No 56, 4.4.1964,<br>p.878/64)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptation :</p>
<p>Article 3 shall not apply.</p>
<p>2. 373 L 0239: First Council Directive 73/239/EEC of 24 July 1973 on the<br>coordination of laws, regulations and administrative provisions relating to<br>the taking-up and pursuit of the business of direct insurance other than life<br>assurance (OJ No L 228, 16.8.1973, p.3), as amended by:</p>
<p>376 L 0580: Council Directive 76/580/EEC of 29 June 1976 (OJ No<br>L 189, 13.7.1976, p.13)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;384 L 0641: Council Directive 84/641/EEC of 10 December 1984</p>
<p>amending, particularly as regards tourist assistance, the first Direc-<br>tive (73/239/EEC) on the coordination of laws, regulations and ad-<br>ministrative provisions relating to the taking up and pursuit of the<br>business of direct insurance other than life assurance (OJ No L 339,<br>27.12.1984, p.21)</p>

<p>Each Contracting Party may, by means of agreements concluded<br>with one or more third countries, agree to the application of provi-<br>sions different from those provided for in Articles 23 to 28 of the<br>Directive on the condition that its insured persons are given ade-<br>quate and equivalent protection. The Contracting Parties shall in-<br>form and consult each other prior to concluding such agreements.</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties shall not apply to branches of insurance<br>undertakings having their head office outside the territory of the<br>Contracting Parties provisions which result in more favourable treat-<br>ment than that accorded to branches of insurance undertakings ha-<br>ving their head office within the territory of the Contracting Parties.</p>

<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IX</p>
<p>563</p>
<p>17. The competent supervisory authority shall require such underta-<br>kings to meet the requirements of these Articles by 1 January 1995.<br>Prior to that date the EEA Joint Committee shall examine the finan-<br>cial situation of the undertakings still not meeting the requirements<br>and make appropriate recommendations. As long as an insurance<br>undertaking fails to meet the requirements of Articles 16 and 17 it<br>shall not establish a branch or provide services in the territory of an-<br>other Contracting Party. Undertakings desiring to extend their ope-<br>rations within the meaning of Article 8(2) or Article 10 may not do<br>so unless they comply immediately with the rules of the Directive.</p>
<p>(e) As regards relations with third-country insurance undertakings<br>described in Article 29b ( see Article 4 of Council Directive<br>90/618/EEC) the following shall apply:</p>
<p>1. With a view to achieving a maximum degree of convergence in<br>the application of a third-country regime for insurance underta-<br>kings, the Contracting Parties shall exchange information as descri-<br>bed in Articles 29b(l) and 29b(5) and consultations shall be held re-<br>garding matters referred to in Articles 29b(2), 29b(3) and 29b(4),<br>within the framework of the EEA Joint Committee and according<br>to specific procedures to be agreed by the Contracting Parties.</p>
<p>2. Authorizations granted by the competent authorities of a<br>Contracting Party to insurance undertakings being direct or indirect<br>subsidiarics of parent undertakings governed by the laws of a third<br>country shall have validity in accordance with the provisions of the<br>Directive throughout the territory of all Contracting Parties. Howe-<br>ver,</p>
<p>(a) when a third country imposes quantitative restrictions on the es-<br>tablishment of insurance undertakings of an EFTA State or imposes<br>restrictions on such insurance undertakings that it does not impose<br>on Community insurance undertakings, authorizations granted by<br>competent authorities within the Community to insurance underta-<br>kings being direct or indirect subsidiaries of parent undertakings go-<br>verned by the laws of that third country shall have validity only in<br>the Community, except where an EFTA State decides otherwise for<br>its own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>(b) where the Community has decided that decisions regarding aut-<br>horizations of insurance undertakings being direct or indirect subsi-<br>diaries of parent undertakings governed by the laws of a third<br>country shall be limited or suspended, any authorization granted by<br>a competent authority of an EFTA State to such insurance underta-<br>kings shall have validity only in its jurisdiction, except where an-<br>other Contracting Party decides otherwise for its own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>(c) the limitations or suspensions referred to in sub-paragraphs (a)<br>and (b) may not apply to insurance undertakings or their subsidia-<br>ries already authorized in the territory of a Contracting Party.</p>
<p>3. Whenever the Community negotiates with a third country on<br>the basis of Articles 29b(3) and 29b(4) in order to obtain national<br>treatment and effective market access for its insurance underta-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IX</p>
<p>564</p>
<p>kings, it shall endeavour to obtain equal treatment for the insurance<br>undertakings of the EFTA States.</p>

<p>Bilaga 15</p>

<p>undertakings having their head office outside the territory of the<br>Contracting Parties provisions which result in more favourable treat-<br>ment than that accorded to branches of insurance undertakings ha-<br>ving their head office within the territory of the Contracting Parties.</p>
<p>(e) As regards relations with third-country insurance undertakings<br>described in Article 32b (see Article 9 of Council Directive<br>90/619/EEC) the following shall apply:</p>
<p>1. <p>2. Authorizations granted by the competent authorities of a Cont-<br>racting Party to insurance undertakings being direct or indirect<br>subsidiaries of parent undertakings governed by the laws of a<br>third country shall have validity in accordance with the provi-<br>sions of the Directive throughout the territory of all Contracting<br>Parties. However,</p>
<p>(a) when a third country imposes quantitative restrictions on<br>the establishment of insurance undertakings of an EFTA<br>State, or imposes restrictions on such insurance underta-<br>kings that it does not impose on Community insurance un-<br>dertakings, authorizations granted by competent authori-<br>ties within the Community to insurance undertakings being<br>direct or indirect subsidiaries of parent undertakings gover-<br>ned by the laws of that third country shall have validity only<br>in the Community, except where an EFTA State decides ot-<br>herwise for its own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>(b) where the Community has decided that decisions regarding<br>authorizations of insurance undertakings being direct or in-<br>direct subsidiaries of parent undertakings governed by the<br>laws of a third country, shall be limited or suspended, any<br>authorization granted by a competent authority of an EFTA<br>State to such insurance undertakings shall have validity only<br>in its jurisdiction, except where another Contracting Party<br>decides otherwise for its own jurisdiction.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;the limitations or suspensions referred to in subparagraphs</p>
<p>(a) and (b) may not apply to insurance undertakings or their<br>subsidiaries already authorized in the territory of a Contrac-<br>ting Party</p>
<p>3. Whenever the Community negotiates with a third country on the<br>basis of 32b(3) and 32b(4), in order to obtain national treatment<br>and effective market access for its insurance undertakings, it<br>shall endeavour to obtain equal treatment for the insurance un-</p>

<p>Annex IX</p>
<p>568</p>
<p>dertakings of the EFTA States.</p>

<p>(i) Coordination of legislation on establishment and freedom to provide<br>services</p>
<p>14. 373 L 0183: Council Directive 73/183/EEC of 28 June 1973 on the aboli-<br>tion of restrictions on freedom of establishment and freedom to provide ser-<br>vices in respect of self-employed activities of banks and other financial insti-<br>tutions. <p>15. 377 L 0780: First Council Directive 77/780/EEC of 12 December 1977<br>on the coordination of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions<br>relating to the taking-up and pursuit of the business of credit institutions (OJ<br>No L 322, 17.12.1977, p.30), as amended by:</p>

<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;386 L 0524: Council Directive 86/524/EEC of 27 October 1986<br>amending Directive 77/780/EEC in respect of the list of permanent<br>exclusions of certain credit institutions (OJ No L 309, 4.11.1986,<br>P-15)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;389 L 0646: Second Council Directive 89/646/EEC of 15 December<br>1989 on the coordination of laws, regulations and administrative<br>provisions relating to the taking-up and pursuit of the business of<br>credit institutions and amending Directive 77/780/EEC (OJ No L<br>386, 30.12.1989, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;Articles 2(5) and 2(6), 3(3)(b) to (d), 9(2), 9(3) and 10 of the Direc-<br>tive shall not apply.</p>
<p>(b) The following shall be added to Article 2(2) :</p>
<p>- In Austria, enterprises recognized as building associations for<br>the public benefit</p>
<p>- In Iceland “Byggingarsjodir rikisins”</p>
<p>- In Liechtenstein, the 'Liechtensteinische Landesbank’</p>
<p>- In Sweden, the 'Svenska skeppshypotekskassan’</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Iceland shall implement the provisions of the Directive by 1 January<br>1995.</p>
<p>16. 389 L 0646: The Second Council Directive 89/646/EEC of 15 December<br>1989 on the coordination of laws, regulations and administrative provisions<br>relating to the taking-up and pursuit of the business of credit institutions and<br>amending Directive 77/780/EEC (OJ No L 386, 30.12.1989, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) As regards relations with third-country credit institutions described<br>in Articles 8 and 9 of the Directive, the following shall apply :</p>
<p>1. With a view to achieving a maximum degree of convergence in<br>the application of a third-country regime for credit institutions,<br>the Contracting Parties shall exchange information as described<br>in Articles 9(1) and 9(5) and consultations shall be held regarding<br>matters referred to in Articles 9(2), 9(3) and 9(4), within the fra-<br>mework of the EEA Joint Committee and according to specific<br>procedures to be agreed by the Contracting Parties.</p>
<p>2. Authorizations granted by the competent authorities of a Cont-<br>racting Party to credit institutions being direct or indirect subsi-<br>diaries of parent undertakings governed by the laws of a third<br>country, shall have validity in accordance with the provisions of<br>this Directive throughout the territory of all Contracting Parties.<br>However,</p>
<p>(a) when a third country imposes quantitative restrictions on the<br>establishment of credit institutions of an EFTA State, or imposes<br>restrictions on such credit institutions that it does not impose on</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IX</p>
<p>571</p>
<p>Community credit institutions, authorizations granted by compe-<br>tent authorities within the Community to credit institutions being<br>direct or indirect subsidiaries of parent undertakings governed by<br>the laws of that third country shall have validity only in the Com-<br>munity, except where an EFTA State decides otherwise for its<br>own jurisdiction;</p>
<p>(b) where the Community has decided that decisions regarding<br>authorizations of credit institutions being direct or indirect subsi-<br>diaries of parent undertakings governed by the laws of a third<br>country shall be limited or suspended, authorizations granted by<br>a competent authority of an EFTA State to such credit institu-<br>tions shall have validity only in its jurisdiction, except where an-<br>other Contracting Party decides otherwise for its own jurisdic-<br>tion;</p>
<p>(c) the limitations or suspensions referred to in subparagraphs<br>(a) and (b) may not apply to credit institutions or their subsidia-<br>ries already authorized in the territory of a Contracting Party.</p>
<p>3. Whenever the Community negotiates with a third country on the<br>basis of Articles 9(3) and 9(4), in order to obtain national treat-<br>ment and effective market access for its credit institutions, it shall<br>endeavour to obtain equal treatment for the credit institutions of<br>the EFTA States, (b) In Article 10(2), the words “when the<br>Directive is implemented” shall be replaced by “when the<br>EEAAgreement enters into force”, and the words “the date of<br>the notification of this Directive ” shall be replaced by “the date<br>of signature of the EEAAgreement”.</p>
<p>(c) Iceland shall implement the provisions of the Directive by 1 January<br>1995. During the transition period it shall recognize, in accordance<br>with the provisions of the Directive, authorizations granted to credit<br>institutions by the competent authorities of the other Contracting<br>Parties. Authorizations granted to credit institutions by the compe-<br>tent Icelandic authorities shall not have EEA-wide validity before<br>the full application of the Directive.</p>
<p>(ii) Prudential requirements and regulations</p>
<p>17. 389 L 0299: Council Directive 89/299/EEC of 17 April 1989 on the own<br>funds of credit institutions (OJ No L 124, 5.5.1989, p.16)</p>
<p>18. 389 L 0647: Council Directive 89/647/EEC of 18 December 1989 on a<br>solvency ratio for credit institutions (OJ No L 386, 30.12.1989, p.14)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) Loans fully and completely secured by shares in Finnish residential<br>housing companies, operating in accordance with the Finnish Hou-<br>sing Company Act of 1991 or subsequent equivalent legislation,<br>shall be given the same weighting as the one applied to mortgages<br>on residential property in accordance with the rules set out in Article</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex IX</p>
<p>572</p>
<p>6(l)(c)(l) of the Directive.</p>
<p>(b) Article 11(4) shall also apply to Austria and Iceland.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Austria and Finland shall before 1 January 1993 establish a system<br>for identification of those credit institutions that are unable to meet<br>the requirement of Article 10(1) of the Directive. For each of those<br>credit institutions, the competent authority shall take the appro-<br>priate measures to ensure that the 8% solvency ratio is met as<br>quickly as possible and no later than 1 January 1995. Until the credit<br>institutions in question reach the 8% solvency ratio, the competent<br>authorities in Austria and Finland will, in relation to Article 19(3)<br>of Council Directive 89/646/EEC, regard the financial situation of<br>such credit institutions as inadequate.</p>
<p>19. 391 L 0031: Commission Directive 91/31/EEC of 19 December 1990<br>adapting the technical definition of “multilateral development banks” in<br>Council Directive 89/647/EEC of 18 December 1989 on a solvency ratio for<br>credit institutions (OJ No L 17, 23.1.1991, p.20) (zzz) Supervision and ac-<br>counts</p>
<p>20. 383 L0350: Council Directive 83/350/EECof 13 June 1983 on the super-<br>vision of credit institutions on a Consolidated basis (OJ No L 193, 18.7.1983,<br>p.18)</p>
<p>21. 386 L 0635: Council Directive 86/635/EEC of 8 December 1986 on the<br>annual accounts and Consolidated accounts of banks and other financial insti-<br>tutions (OJ No L372, 31.12.1986, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Austria, Norway and Sweden shall implement the provisions of the Direc-<br>tive by 1 January 1995, and Liechtenstein and Switzerland by 1 January 1996.<br>During the transition periods, there shall be mutual recognition of the an-<br>nual accounts published by the credit institutions of the Contracting Parties<br>relative to branches.</p>
<p>22. 389 L 0117: Council Directive 89/117/EEC of 13 February 1989 on the<br>obligations of branches established in a Member State of credit institutions<br>and financial institutions having their head offices outside that Member State<br>regarding the publication of annual accounting documents (OJ No L 44,<br>16.2.1989, p.40)</p>

<p>23. 391 L 0308 : Council Directive 91/308/EEC of 10 June 1991 on preven-<br>tion of the use of the financial system for the purpose of money launde-<br>ring.(OJ No L 166, 28.6.1991, p.77)</p>
<p>Modalities for association of EFTA States in accordance with Article 101<br>of the Agreement:</p>

<h1>ANNEX X</h1>
<h1>AUDIOVISUAL SERVICES</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 36(2)</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 389 L 0552 Council Directive 89/552/EEC of 3 October 1989 on the coor-<br>dination of certain provisions laid down by law, regulation or administrative<br>action in Member States concerning the pursuit of television broadcasting<br>activities. (OJ No L 298, 17.10.1989, p.23).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations :</p>
<p>(a) With regard to EFTA States, the works referred to in Article 6(l)(c)<br>of the Directive are also works made, as described in Article 6(3),<br>by and with producers established in European third countries with<br>which the EFTA State concerned has agreements to this effect.</p>
<p>If a Contracting Party intends to conclude an agreement as men-<br>tioned in Article 6(3), it shall inform the EEA Joint Committee the-<br>reof. Consultations concerning the contents of such agreements may<br>take place at the request of any Contracting Party.</p>
<p>(b) The following shall be added to Article 15 of the Directive :</p>
<p>The EFTA States shall be free to compel cable companies opera-<br>ting on their territories to scramble or otherwise obscure spot adver-<br>tisements for alcoholic beverages. This exception shall not have the<br>effect of restricting the retransmission of parts of television pro-<br>grams other than advertising spots for alcoholic beverages. The<br>Contracting Parties will jointly review this exception in 1995.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>

<p>577</p>

<h1>ANNEX XII</h1>
<h1>FREE MOVEMENT OF CAPITAL</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 40</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>1. 388 L 0361 Council Directive 88/361/EEC of 24 June 1988 for the imple-<br>mcntation of Article 67 of the Treaty (OJ L 178,08.07.1988, p.5).</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall for the purposes of the present Agree-<br>ment, be read with the following adaptations :</p>
<p>(a) The EFTA States shall notify the EEA Joint Committee of the mea-<br>sures referred to in Article 2 of the Directive. The Community shall<br>notify the EEA Joint Committee of the measures taken by its Mem-<br>ber States. Exchanges of information regarding such measures shall<br>take place within the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>(b) For the application of measures as referred to in Article 3 of the<br>Directive, the EFTA States shall follow the procedure as set out in<br>Protocol 18. For cooperation between the Contracting Parties the<br>joint procedures as set out in Article 45 of the Agreement shall ap-<br>ply.</p>
<p>(c) Any decisions the Community may take in accordance with Article<br>6(2) of the Directive, shall not be subject to the procedures of Chap-<br>ter 2, Part VII to the Agreement. The Community shall inform the<br>other Contracting Parties of such decisions. The restrictions for<br>which an extension of the transition periods is granted may be up-<br>held within the framework of this Agreement on the same terms as<br>in the Community.</p>
<p>(d) The EFTA States may continue to apply domestic legislation regu-<br>lating foreign ownership and/or ownership by non-residents, exis-<br>ting on the date of entry into force of the EEA Agreement, subject<br>to time limits and within the areas set out below:</p>
<p>- Up to 1 January 1995 for Iceland regarding short term Capital mo-<br>vement operations set out in Annex II of the Directive;</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XII</p>
<p>580</p>
<p>- Up to 1 January 1995 for Norway regarding acquisition of domes-<br>tic securities and admission of domestic securities to a foreign Ca-<br>pital market;</p>
<p>-Up to 1 January 1995 for Norway and Sweden, and up to 1 Ja-<br>nuary 1996 for Finland, Iceland and Liechtenstein regarding di-<br>rect investment on national territory;</p>
<p>-Up to 1 January 1998 for Switzerland regarding direct investment<br>in professional real estate business on national territory;</p>
<p>- Up to 1 January 1995 for Norway, up to 1 January 1996 for Aust-<br>ria, Finland and Iceland and up to 1 January 1998 for Liechten-<br>stein and Switzerland regarding investments in real estate on na-<br>tional territory;</p>
<p>- For Austria regarding direct investments in the sector of inland<br>waterways, until equal access to EC waterways is obtained.</p>
<p>(e) During transition periods EFTA States shall not treat new and exis-<br>ting investments by companies or nationals of EC Member States<br>or other EFTA States less favourably than under the legislation ex-<br>isting at the date of signature of the Agreement, without prejudice<br>to the right of EFTA States to introduce legislation which is in con-<br>formity with the Agreement and in particular provisions concerning<br>the purchase of secondary residences which correspond in their ef-<br>fect to legislation that has been upheld within the Community in<br>accordance with Article 6(4) of the Directive.</p>
<p>(f) The reference in the introductory part of Annex I of the Directive<br>to Article 68(3) of the EEC Treaty shall be deemed to be to Article<br>42(2) of the Agreement.</p>
<p>(g) Notwithstanding Article 40 of the Agreement and the provisions of<br>this Annex, Iceland may continue to apply restictions existing on<br>the date of signature of the Agreement, on foreign ownership an-<br>d/or ownership by non-residents in the sectors of fisheries and fish<br>processing.</p>
<p>These restrictions shall not prevent investments by non-nationals<br>or nationals who do not have legal domicile in Iceland in companies<br>which are only indirectly engaged in fisheries or fish processing. Ho-<br>wever, national authorities shall have the right to oblige companies<br>which have, wholly or partly, been acquired by non nationals or na-<br>tionals who do not have legal domicile in Iceland to divest themsel-<br>ves of any investments in fish-processing activities or fishing vessels.</p>
<p>(h) “Notwithstanding Article 40 of the Agreement and the provisions<br>of this Annex, Norway may continue to apply restrictions existing<br>on the date of signature of the Agreement on ownership by non-<br>nationals of fishing vessels.</p>
<p>These restrictions shall not prevent investments by non-nationals<br>in land-based fish processing or in companies which are only indi-<br>rectly engaged in fishing operations. National authorities shall have<br>the right to oblige companies which have been wholly or partly ac-<br>quired by non-nationals to divest themselves of any investments in<br>fishing vessels.”</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XII</p>
<p>581</p>
<h1>ANNEX XIII</h1>
<h1>TRANSPORT</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 47</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>I. Where the acts referred to in this Annex contain references to the EEC</p>
<p>Treaty, they shall, for the purposes of the present Agreement,</p>
<p>(a) be read, with regard to the following references, as indicated below:</p>
<p>-Article 55 EEC = Article 32 EEA</p>
<p>- Article 56 EEC = Article 33 EEA</p>
<p>-Article 57 EEC = Article 30 EEA</p>
<p>-Article 58 EEC = Article 34 EEA</p>
<p>- Article 77 EEC = Article 49 EEA</p>
<p>- Article 79 EEC = Article 50 EEA</p>
<p>- Article 85 EEC = Article 53 EEA</p>
<p>- Article 86 EEC = Article 54 EEA</p>
<p>-Article 92 EEC = Article 61 EEA</p>
<p>-Article 93 EEC = Article 62 EEA</p>
<p>-Article 214 EEC = Article 122 EEA</p>
<p>(b) be deemed, with regard to the following references, as not relevant:</p>
<p>- Article 75 EEC</p>
<p>-Article 83 EEC</p>
<p>-Article 94 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 95 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 99 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 172 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 192 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 207 EEC</p>
<p>- Article 209 EEC</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIII</p>
<p>II. For the purposes of the present Agreement, the following shall be added<br>to the lists set out in Annex II, A.l of Regulation (EEC) No 1108/70, Article</p>
<p>582</p>
<p>19 of Regulation (EEC) No 1191/69, Article 1 of Decision 83/418/EEC, Ar-<br>ticle 3 of Regulation (EEC) No 1192/69, Article 2 of Regulation (EEC)<br>No 2830/77, Article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No 2183/78 and Article 2 of Deci-<br>sion 82/529/EEC:</p>
<p>“Österreichische Bundesbahnen</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;Valtionrautatiet/Statsjärnvägarna</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;Norges Statsbaner</p>
<p>Statens Järnvägar</p>
<p>Schweizerische Bundesbahnen/Chemins de fer fédéraux suisses/Fer-<br>rovie federali svizzere/ Viafiers federalas svizras&quot;</p>
<p>III. When an act referred to in this Annex provides for procedures to settle<br>a dispute between EC Member States and a dispute arises between EFTA<br>States they shall submit the dispute for settlement to the appropriate EFTA<br>body applying equivalent procedures. If a dispute arises between an EC<br>Member State and an EFTA State, the respective Contracting Parties shall<br>submit the dispute for settlement by the EEA Joint Committee applying<br>equivalent procedures.</p>

<p>5. 378 D 0174: Council Decision No 78/174/EEC of 20February 1978 institu-<br>ting a consultation procedure and setting up a Committee in the field of<br>transport infrastructure (OJ No L054, 25.2.1978, p.15)</p>

<p>(a) &nbsp;in Articles 1 point 2 and 2(1) of the Decision, the words “of Commu-<br>nity interest” shall be replaced by “of interest to the Contracting Par-<br>ties to the EEAAgreement” and in Article5 thereof the words “of<br>interest to the Community” shall be replaced by “of interest to the<br>Contracting Parties to the EEAAgreement”.</p>
<p>(b) Article l(2)(c) shall not apply.</p>
<p>Modalities for association of EFTA States in accordance with Article 112<br>of the Agreement:</p>
<p>An expert from each EFTA State may participate in the tasks of the Com-<br>mittee on transport infrastructure which are described in this Decision.</p>
<p>The EC Commission shall, in due time, inform the participants of the date<br>of the meeting of the Committee and transmit the relevant documentation.</p>

<p>(v) FRONTIER FACILITATION</p>
<p>12. 389 R 4060: Council Regulation (EEC) No 4060/89 of 21 December 1989<br>on the elimination of Controls performed at the frontiers of Member States<br>in the field of road and inland waterway transport (OJ No L 390,30.12.1989,<br>p.18)</p>

<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIII</p>
<p><sup>1</sup> Listed here for purposes of information only. For application, see Annex XIV.</p>
<p><sup>2</sup> Listed here for purposes of information only. For application see Protocol 21.</p>
<p>589</p>
<p>(a) Pursuant to Article 17 of the Agreement between the European<br>Economic Community and the Republic of Austria on transit of<br>goods by road and rail (referred to as ’the transit agreement’), Aust-<br>ria may perform Controls at the frontier to verify compliance with<br>the ecopoint system as referred to in Articles 15 and 16 of the transit<br>agreement.</p>
<p>All Contracting Parties concerned may perform Controls at the<br>frontier to verify compliance with the quota arrangements referred<br>to in Article 16 of the transit agreement which are not replaced by<br>the ecopoint system and with quota arrangements covered by bilate-<br>ral agreements between Austria on the one hand and Finland, Nor-<br>way, Sweden and Switzerland on the other.</p>
<p>All other Controls shall be performed in conformity with the Re-<br>gulation.</p>
<p>(b) Switzerland may perform Controls at the frontier to verify permits<br>issued under Annex 6 to the Agreement between the European<br>Communities and the Swiss Confederation on carriage of goods by<br>road and rail.</p>
<p>All other Controls shall be performed in conformity with the Re-<br>gulation.</p>
<p>(iv) COMBINED TRANSPORT</p>
<p>13. 375 L 0130: Council Directive No 75/130/EEC of 17 February 1975 on<br>the establishment of common rules for certain types of combined transport<br>of goods between Member States (OJ No L 048, 22.2.1975, p.31), as amen-<br>ded by:</p>

<p>II ROAD TRANSPORT</p>
<p>(i) TECHNICAL HARMONISATION AND SAFETY</p>
<p>14. 385 L 0003: Council Directive No 85/3/EEC of 19 December 1984 on the<br>weights, dimensions and certain other technical characteristics of certain<br>road vehicles (OJNoL 002, 3.1.1985, p.14), as amended by:</p>
<p>386 L 0360: Council Directive No 86/360/EEC of 24 July 1986<br>(OJNoL 217, 5.8.1986, p.19)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;388 L 0218: Council Directive No 88/218/EEC of 11 April 1988<br>(OJNoL 098, 15.4.1988, p.48)</p>
<p>389 L0338: Council Directive No 89/338/EEC of 27April 1989<br>(OJNoL 142, 25.5.1989, p.3)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;389 L0460: Council Directive No 89/460/EEC of 18 July 1989 amen-<br>ding, with a view to fixing an expiry date for the derogations accor-<br>ded to Ireland and the United Kingdom, Directive/85/3/EEC<br>(OJNoL 226, 3.8.1989, p.5)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;389 L0461: Council Directive No 89/461/EEC of 18 July 1989 amen-<br>ding with a view to fixing certain maximum authorized dimensions<br>for articulated vehicles, Directive/85/3/EEC (OJ No L 226,<br>3.8.1989, p.7)</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;391 L 0060: Council Directive No 91/60/EEC of 4 February 1991<br>amending, with a view to fixing certain maximum authorized dimen-<br>sions for road trains, Directive/85/3/EEC (OJ No L 037, 9.2.1991,<br>p.37)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Austria may maintain its national legislation for maximum authorized<br>weights of motor vehicles and trailers as set out in Annex I, sections 2.2.1<br>and 2.2.2 of this Directive. Therefore provisions authorizing the use of vehic-<br>les (individual or combined) which are not in conformity with such national<br>legislation shall not be applicable in Austria. This situation will be jointly<br>reviewed six months before the expiry of the agreement between the Euro-<br>pean Communities and the Republic of Austria on transit of goods by road<br>and rail.</p>
<p>Switzerland may maintain its national legislation for maximum authorized<br>weights of motor vehicles and trailers as set out in Annex I, sections 2.2 and<br>2.3.3 of this Directive. Therefore provisions authorizing the use of vehicles<br>(individual or combined) which are not in conformity with such national le-<br>gislation shall not be applicable in Switzerland. This situation will be jointly</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIII</p>
<p>591</p>
<p>reviewed six months before the expiry of the agreement between the Euro-<br>pean Communities and the Swiss Confederation on the carriage of goods by<br>road and rail.</p>
<p>All other provisions on weights and dimensions covered by this Directive<br>shall be fully implemented by Austria and Switzerland.</p>
<p>15. 386 L 0364: Council Directive No 86/364/EEC of 24 July 1986 relating<br>to proof of compliance of vehicles with Directive 85/3/EEC on the weights,<br>dimensions and certain other technical characteristics of certain road vehic-<br>les (OJ No L 221, 7.8.1986, p.48)</p>

<h1>ANNEX XIV</h1>
<h1>COMPETITION</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 60</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the ec;</p>
<p>- references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provi-<br>ded for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>Unless otherwise provided for, the provisions of this Annex shall, for the<br>purposes of the present Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>I. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term 'Commission’ shall read 'competent surveillance autho-<br>rity’.</p>
<p>II. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term 'common market’ shall read ’the territory covered by the<br>EEA Agreement’.</p>
<p>III. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term 'trade between Member States’ shall read 'trade between<br>Contracting Parties’.</p>
<p>IV. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term ’the Commission and the authorities of the Member Sta-<br>tes’ shall read ’the EC Commission, the EFTA Surveillance Autho-<br>rity, the authorities of the EC Member States and of the EFTA Sta-<br>tes’.</p>
<p>V. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;References to Articles of the Treaty establishing the European Eco-<br>nomic Community (EEC) or the Treaty establishing the European<br>Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) shall be read as references to<br>the EEA Agreement (EEA) as follows:</p>
<p>Article 85 (EEC) - Article 53 (EEA)<br>Article 86 (EEC) - Article 54 (EEA)<br>Article 90 (EEC) - Article 59 (EEA)</p>
<p>Article 66 (ECSC) - Article 2 of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment</p>
<p>Article 80 (ECSC) - Article 3 of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>VI. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term “this Regulation” shall read “this Act”.</p>
<p>VII. &nbsp;&nbsp;The term “the competition rules of the Treaty” shall read “the com-<br>petition rules of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>606</p>
<p>VIII. The term “High Authority” shall read “competent surveillance aut-<br>hority”.</p>
<p>Without prejudice to the rules on control of concentrations, the term<br>“competent surveillance authority” as referred to in the rules below shall<br>read “the surveillance authority which is competent to decide on a case in<br>accordance with Article 56 of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>A.MERGER CONTROL</p>
<p>1. 389 R 4064: Council Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89 of 21 December 1989<br>on the control of concentrations between undertakings (OJ No L 395,<br>30.12.1989, p.l), as corrected by OJ No L 257, 21.9.1990, p.13</p>
<p>The provisions of Articles 1 to 5 of the Regulation shall, for the purposes<br>of the Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 1(1), the phrase “,or the corresponding provision envisa-<br>ged in Protocol 21 to the EEA Agreement,” shall be inserted after<br>the words “Without prejudice to Article 22”.</p>
<p>Furthermore, the term “Community dimension” shall be replaced<br>by “Community or EFTA dimension”.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 1(2), the term “Community dimension” shall be replaced<br>by “Community or EFTA dimension respectively”.</p>
<p>Furthermore, the term “Community-wide turnover” shall be repla-<br>ced by “Community-wide or EFTA-wide turnover”.</p>
<p>In the last subparagraph, the term “Member State” shall be replaced<br>by “State”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 1(3) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(d) In Article 2(1), first subparagraph, the term “common market” shall<br>be replaced by “functioning of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(e) In Article 2(2), at the end, the term “common market” shall be re-<br>placed by “functioning of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;In Article 2(3), at the end, the term “common market” shall be re-<br>placed by “functioning of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(g) In Article 3(5)(b), the term “Member State” shall be replaced by<br>“EC Member State or an EFTA State”.</p>
<p>(h) In Article 4(1), the term “Community dimension” shall be replaced<br>by “Community or EFTA dimension”.</p>
<p>Furthermore, in the first sentence, the phrase “in accordance with<br>Article 57 of the EEAAgreement” shall be inserted after the words<br>“... shall be notified to the Commission”.</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;In Article 5(1), the last subparagraph shall be replaced by the follo-<br>wing:</p>
<p>“Turnover, in the Community or in an EC Member State, shall<br>comprise products sold and services provided to undertakings or<br>consumers, in the Community or in that EC Member State as the<br>case may be. The same shall apply as regards turnover in the terri-<br>tory of the EFTA States as a whole or in an EFTA State.”.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>607</p>
<p>(J) In Article 5(3)(a), second subparagraph, the term “Community-<br>wide turnover” shall be replaced by the words “Community-wide or<br>EFTA-wide turnover”.</p>
<p>Furthermore, the term “Community residents” shall be replaced by<br>“Community or EFTA residents, respectively”.</p>
<p>(k) In Article5(3)(a), third subparagraph, the term “Member State”<br>shall be replaced by “EC Member State or EFTA State”.</p>
<p>(l) &nbsp;In Article 5(3)(b), the last phrase “..., gross premiums received from<br>Community residents and from residents of one Member State re-<br>spectively shall be taken into account.” shall be replaced by the fol-<br>lowing:</p>
<p>“..., gross premiums received from Community residents and from<br>residents of one EC Member State respectively shall be taken into<br>account. The same shall apply as regards gross premiums received<br>from residents in the territory of the EFTA States as a whole and<br>from residents in one EFTA State, respectively.”.</p>
<p>B. EXCLUSIVE DEALING AGREEMENTS</p>
<p>2.383 R 1983: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1983/83 of 22 June 1983<br>on the application of Article 85(3) of the Treaty to categories of exclusive<br>distribution agreements (OJ No L 173, 30.6.1983, p.l), as corrected by OJ<br>No L 281, 13.10.1983, p.24, and as amended by:</p>
<p>1 85 I: Act concerning the conditions of Accession and Adjustments<br>to the Treaties - Accession of the Kingdom of Spain and the Portu-<br>guese Republic (OJNo L 302, 15.11.1985, p.166)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 5(1), the term “the Treaty” shall read “the Treaty estab-<br>lishing the European Economic Community”.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 6, introductory paragraph, the phrase “pursuant to Ar-<br>ticle 7 of Regulation No 19/65/EEC” shall read “either on its own<br>initiative or at the request of the other surveillance authority or a<br>State falling within its competence or of natural or legal persons clai-<br>ming a legitimate interest”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;The following paragraph shall be added at the end of Article 6:<br>“The competent surveillance authority may in such cases issue a de-<br>cision in accordance with Articles 6 and 8 of Regulation (EEC) No<br>17/62, or the corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to<br>the EEA Agreement, without any notification from the underta-<br>kings concerned being required.”</p>
<p>(d) Article 7 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(e) Article 10 shall read:</p>
<p>“This Act shall expire on 31 December 1997.”.</p>
<p>3. 383 R 1984: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1984/83 of 22 June 1983<br>on the application of Article 85(3) of the Treaty to categories of exclusive</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>608</p>
<p>purchasing agreements (OJ No L 173, 30.6.1983, p.5), as corrected by OJ<br>No L 281, 13.10.1983, p. 24, and as amended by:</p>

<p>F. KNOW-HOW LICENSING AGREEMENTS</p>
<p>9. 389 R 0556: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 556/89 of 30 November<br>1988 on the application of Article 85(3) of the Treaty to certain categories of<br>know-how licensing agreements (OJ No L 61, 4.3.1989, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In Article 1(2), the term “EEC” shall read “the territory covered by<br>the EEAAgreement”.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;Article 1(4) shall read:</p>
<p>“In so far as the obligations referred to in paragraph 1 (1) to (5) con-<br>cern territories including EC Member States or EFTA States in<br>which the same technology is protected by necessary patents, the ex-<br>emption provided for in paragraph 1 shall extend for those States as<br>long as the licensed product or process is protected in those States<br>by such patents, where the duration of such protection exceeds<br>the periods specified in paragraph 2.”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In Article 1(7), points 6 and 8, the term “Member States” shall read<br>“EC Member States or EFTA States”.</p>
<p>(d) In Article 4(1), the phrase “on condition that the agreements in<br>question are notified to the Commission in accordance with the pro-<br>visions of Commission Regulation No 27 and that the Commission<br>does not oppose” shall read “on condition that the agreements in</p>
<p>614</p>
<p>question are notified to the EC Commission or the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority in accordance with the provisions of Commission<br>Regulation No 27/62, as last amended by Regulation (EEC)<br>No 2526/85, and the corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol<br>21 to the EEA Agreement, and that the competent surveillance aut-<br>hority does not oppose”.</p>
<p>(e) In Article 4(3) the term “the Commission” shall read “the EC Com-<br>mission or the EFTA Surveillance Authority”.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;Article 4(5) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;In Article 4(6), the second sentence shall be replaced as follows:</p>
<p>“It shall oppose exemption if it receives a request to do so from a<br>State falling within its competence within three months of the trans-<br>mission to those States of the notification referred to in paragraph<br>1.”.</p>
<p>(h) In Article 4(7), the second sentence shall be replaced as follows:<br>“However, where the opposition was raised at the request of a State<br>falling within its competence and this request is maintained, it may<br>be withdrawn only after consultation of its Advisory Committee on<br>Restrictive Practices and Dominant Positions.”.</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;The following shall be added to the end of Article 4(10):</p>
<p>“, or the corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to the<br>EEA Agreement.”.</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;In Article 7, introductory paragraph, the phrase “pursuant to Ar-<br>ticle 7 of Regulation No 19/65/EEC” shall read “either on its own<br>initiative or at the request of the other surveillance authority or a<br>State falling within its competence or of natural or legal persons clai-<br>ming a legitimate interest”.</p>
<p>(k) &nbsp;In Article 7, the following shall be added at the end of point (5) (a)<br>and (b):</p>
<p>“The competent surveillance authority may in such cases issue a de-<br>cision in accordance with Articles 6 and 8 of Regulation (EEC) No<br>17/62, or the corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to<br>the EEA Agreement, without any notification from the underta-<br>kings concerned being required.”.</p>

<p>G.TRANSPORT</p>
<p>10. 368 R 1017: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1017/68 of 19 July 1968 ap-<br>plying rules of competition to transport by rail, road and inland waterway<br>(OJ No L 175, 23.7.1968, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of Articles 1 to 5 and of Articles 7 to 9 of the Regulation<br>shall, for the purposes of the Agreement, be read with the following adapta-<br>tions:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>615</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 2, the introductory paragraph shall read as follows:<br>“Subject to the provisions of Articles 3 to 5, Article 6 of Regulation<br>(EEC) No 1017/68 and to the provision corresponding to Article 6<br>as it is envisaged in Protocol 21 to the EEA Agreement, the follo-<br>wing shall be prohibited as incompatible with the functioning of the<br>EEAAgreement, no prior decision to that effect being required: all<br>agreements between undertakings, decisions by associations of un-<br>dertakings and concerted practices liable to affect trade between<br>Contracting Parties which have as their object or effect the preven-<br>tion, restriction or distortion of competition within the territory<br>covered by the EEA Agreement, and in particular those which:”.</p>
<p>(b) Article 3(2) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 6 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(d) In the first subparagraph of Article 8, the phrase “incompatible with<br>the common market” shall read “incompatible with the functioning<br>of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;Article 9(1) shall read:</p>
<p>“In the case of public undertakings and undertakings to which EC<br>Member States or EFTA States grant special or exclusive rights,<br>Contracting Parties shall ensure that there is neither enacted nor<br>maintained in force any measure contrary to the provisions of the<br>foregoing Articles.”.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;In Article 9(2), the term “Community” shall read “the Contracting<br>Parties”.</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;Article 9 (3) shall read:</p>
<p>‘The EC Commission and the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall<br>see to it that the provisions of this Article are applied and shall,<br>where necessary, address appropriate measures to States falling wit-<br>hin their respective competence.”.</p>
<p>11. 386 R 4056: Council Regulation (EEC) No 4056/86 of 22 December 1986<br>laying down detailed rules for the application of Articles 85 and 86 of the<br>Treaty to maritime transport (OJ No L 378, 31.12.1986, p.4)</p>
<p>The provisions of Section I of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the<br>Agreement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In Article 1(2), the term “Community ports” shall read “ports in the<br>territory covered by the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(b) Article 2 (2) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In Article 7(1), introductory paragraph, the term “Section II” shall<br>read “Section II or the corresponding provisions envisaged in Proto-<br>col 21 to the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>Furthermore, in the second indent, the term “Article 11 (4)” shall<br>read “Article 11 (4) or the corresponding provisions envisaged in<br>Protocol 21 to the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(d) In Article 7(2)(a), the term “Section II” shall read “Section II or the<br>corresponding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to the EEA Ag-<br>reement”.</p>
<p>(e) The following subparagraphs shall be added to Article 7 (2)(c)(i):</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>616</p>
<p>“If any of the Contracting Parties intends to undertake consultations<br>with a third country in accordance with this Regulation, it shall in-<br>form the EEA Joint Committee.</p>
<p>Whenever appropriate, the Contracting Party initiating the proce-<br>dure may request the other Contracting Parties to cooperate in these<br>procedures.</p>
<p>If one or more of the other Contracting Parties object to the inten-<br>ded action, a satisfactory solution will be sought within the EEA<br>Joint Committee. If the Contracting Parties do not reach agreement,<br>appropriate measures may be taken to remedy subsequent distor-<br>tions of competition.&quot;.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;In Article 8(2), the phrase “at the request of a Member State” shall<br>read “at the request of a State falling within its competence”.<br>Furthermore, the term “Article 10” shall read “Article 10 or the cor-<br>responding provisions envisaged in Protocol 21 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment”.</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;In Article 9(1), the term “Community trading and shipping inte-<br>rests” shall read the “trading and shipping interests of the Contrac-<br>ting Parties”</p>
<p>(h) The following paragraph shall be added to Article 9:</p>
<p>“4. If any of the Contracting Parties intends to undertake consulta-<br>tions with a third country in accordance with this Regulation, it shall<br>inform the EEA Joint Committee.”</p>
<p>Whenever appropriate, the Contracting Party initiating the proce-<br>dure may request the other Contracting Parties to cooperate in these<br>procedures.</p>
<p>If one or more of the other Contracting Parties object to the inten-<br>ded action, a satisfactory solution will be sought within the EEA<br>Joint Committee. If the Contracting Parties do not reach agreement,<br>appropriate measures may be taken to remedy subsequent distor-<br>tions of competition.&quot;.</p>
<p>H. PUBLIC UNDERTAKINGS</p>
<p>12. 388 L 0301: Commission Directive 88/301/EEC of 16 May 1988 on com-<br>petition in the markets in telecommunications terminal equipment (OJ No<br>L 131, 27.5.1988, p.73)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In the second subparagraph of Article 2, the phrase “notification of<br>this Directive” shall be replaced by “entry into force of the EEA Ag-<br>reement”.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;Article 10 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In addition, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>As regards EFTA States, it is understood that the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority shall be the addressee of all the information, Com-<br>munications, reports and notifications which according to this Direc-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XIV</p>
<p>617</p>
<p>tive are, within the Community, addressed to the EC Commission.<br>As regards the different transition periods provided for in this act,<br>a general transition period of six months as from the entry into force<br>of the EEA Agreement shall apply.</p>
<p>13. 390 L 0388: Commission Directive 90/388/EEC of 28 June 1990 on com-<br>petition in the markets for telecommunications services (OJ No L 192,<br>24.7.1990, p.10)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In Article 3, the fifth subparagraph shall be replaced by the follo-<br>wing:</p>
<p>“Before they are implemented, the EC Commission or the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority shall, in their respective competence, verify<br>the compatibility of these projects with the EEA Agreement.”.</p>
<p>(b) In the second subparagraph of Article 6, the phrase “harmonized<br>Community rules adopted by the Council” shall be replaced by “har-<br>monized rules contained in the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;The first paragraph of Article 10 shall not apply.</p>
<p>(d) In addition, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>As regards EFTA States, it is understood that the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority shall be the addressee of all the information, Com-<br>munications, reports and notifications which according to this Direc-<br>tive are, within the Community, addressed to the EC Commission.<br>Likewise, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be responsible, as<br>regards EFTA States, for making the necessary reports or assess-<br>ments.</p>
<p>As regards the different transition periods provided for in this act, a<br>general transition period of six months as from the entry into force<br>of the EEA Agreement shall apply.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>

<h1>ANNEX XV</h1>
<h1>STATE AID</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 63</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the adressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO</p>
<p>Public undertakings</p>
<p>1. 380 L 0723: Commission Directive 80/723/EEC of 25 June 1980 on the<br>transparency of financial relations between Member States and public un-<br>dertakings (OJ No L 195, 29.7.1980, p. 35), as amended by:</p>
<p>385 L 0413: Commission Directive 85/413/EEC of 24 July 1985<br>amending Directive 80/723/EEC on the transparency of financial re-<br>lations between Member States and public undertakings (OJ No L<br>229, 28.8.1985, p. 20)</p>
<p>The provisions of this Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Agree-<br>ment, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) The term “Commission” shall read “competent surveillance autho-<br>rity as defined in Article 62 of the EEAAgreement”.</p>
<p>(b) The term “trade between Member States” shall read “trade bet-<br>ween Contracting Parties”.</p>

<h1>ANNEX XVI</h1>
<h1>PROCUREMENT</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 65 (1)</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>SECTORAL ADAPTATIONS</p>
<p>1. For the purposes of applying Directives 71/305/EEC, 89/440/EEC and<br>90/531/EEC referred to in this Annex the following shall apply:</p>
<p>Until such time as they apply free movement of labour in accordance with<br>Article 28 of the Agreement, the Contracting Parties shall ensure:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;effective free access for key employees of contractors of any Cont-<br>racting Parties who have obtained public works contracts;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;non-discriminatory access to work-permits for contractors from any<br>Contracting Parties who have obtained public works contracts.</p>
<p>2. When the acts referred to in this Annex require the publication of notices<br>or documents the following shall apply:</p>
<p>(a) The publication of notices and other documents as required by the<br>acts referred to in this Annex in the Official Journal of the European<br>Communities and in the Tenders Electronic Daily shall be carried<br>out by the Office for Official Publications of the European Commu-<br>nities.</p>
<p>(b) Notices from the EFTA States shall be sent in at least one of the<br>Community languages to the Office for Official Publications of the<br>European Communities. They shall be published in the Community<br>languages in the S-Series of the Official Journal of the European<br>Communities and in the Tenders Electronic Daily. EC notices need<br>not be translated into the languages of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>3. When applying Part VII, Chapter 3, of the Agreement to surveillance for<br>the purposes of this Annex, the competence for surveillance of alleged in-<br>fringements lies with the EC Commission if the alleged infringement is com-<br>mitted by a contracting entity in the Community and with the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority if it is committed by a contracting entity in an EFTA State.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XVI</p>
<p>625</p>
<p>40 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 15</p>

<p>(b) With regard to Liechtenstein, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Directive shall enter into force by 1 January 1995;</p>
<p>with regard to Switzerland, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Directive shall enter into force by 1 January 1994;</p>

<p>- “Warenumsatzsteuer” in Liechtenstein;</p>
<p>- “Warenumsatzsteuer/ impöt sur le chiffre d’affaires/ imposta sulla<br>cifra d’affari” in Switzerland.</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;In Article 27 (5) the reference to “Article 93 (3) of the Treaty” shall<br>be replaced by a reference to “Article 62 of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;In Article 29, the term “third countries” shall be understood as<br>“countries other than the Contracting Parties to the EEA Agree-<br>ment”.</p>
<p>(h) in Article 29 (1) the term “Community” shall read “Community, as<br>regards Community entities, or the EFTA States, as regards their<br>entities”.</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;in Article 29 (1) the term “Community undertakings” shall read<br>“Community undertakings, as regards Community agreements, or<br>EFTA States’ undertakings, as regards EFTA States’ agreements”.</p>
<p>Q) in Article 29 (1) the words “the Community or its Member States in<br>respect of third countries” shall read “either the Community or its<br>Member States in respect of third countries or the EFTA States in<br>respect of third countries”.</p>
<p>(k) In Article 29 (5), the words “by a Council decision” shall read by a<br>“decision in the context of the general decision-making procedure<br>of the EEA Agreement”.</p>
<p>(l) &nbsp;Article 29 (6) shall read as follows:</p>
<p>“In the context of the general institutional provisions of the EEA<br>Agreement, annual reports shall be submitted on the progress made<br>in multilateral or bilateral negotiations regarding access for Commu-<br>nity and EFTA undertakings to the markets of third countries in the<br>fields covered by this Directive, on any result which such negotia-<br>tions may have achieved, and on the implementation in practice of<br>all the agreements which have been concluded.</p>
<p>In the context of the general decision-making procedure of the<br>EEA Agreement the provisions of this Article may be amended in<br>the light of such developments.&quot;</p>
<p>(m) In order to enable the contracting entities in the EEA to apply Ar-<br>ticle 29 (2) and (3), the Contracting Parties shall ensure that the sup-<br>pliers established in their respective territories determine the origin<br>of the products in their tenders for supply contracts in conformity<br>with Regulation (EEC) No 802/68 of the Council of 27 June 1968 on<br>the common definition of the concept of the origin of goods (OJ No<br>L 148, 28.6.1968, p.l).</p>
<p>(n) In order to obtain maximum convergence Article 29 will be applied<br>in the EEA context on the understanding that:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XVI</p>
<p>629</p>
<p>- the operation of paragraph (3) is without prejudice to the existing<br>degree of liberalization towards third countries;</p>
<p>- the Contracting Parties consult closely in their negotiations with<br>third countries.</p>
<p>The application of this regime will be jointly reviewed during<br>1996.</p>
<p>(o) &nbsp;In Article 30, the values of the thresholds in national currencies of<br>the EFTA States shall be calculated so as to come into effect on 1<br>January 1993. They shall in principle be revised every two years with<br>effect from 1 January 1995.</p>
<p>(p) Annexes I to X are supplemented by Appendices 4 to 13 to this An-<br>nex, respectively.</p>
<p>5. 389 L 0665: Council Directive 89/665/EEC of 21 December 1989 on the<br>co-ordination of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions relating<br>to the application of review procedures to the award of public supply and<br>public works contracts (OJ No L 395, 30.12.1989, p. 33)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) With regard to Liechtenstein, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Directive shall enter into force by 1 January 1995;</p>
<p>with regard to Switzerland, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Directive shall enter into force by 1 January 1994;</p>
<p>during these transition periods the application of the Directive<br>will be reciprocally suspended between these States and the other<br>Contracting Parties.</p>
<p>(b) In Article 2 (8), the reference to “Article 177 of the EEC Treaty”<br>shall be read as by a reference to the “criteria laid down by the Court<br>of Justice in its interpretation of Article 177 of the EEC Treaty”<sup>(1</sup>&gt;</p>
<p>6. 371 R1182: Regulation (EEC/Euratom) No 1182 of 3 June 1971 determi-<br>ning the rules applicable to periods, dates and time limits (OJ No L 124,<br>8.6.1971, p. 1)&lt;<sup>2</sup>&gt;</p>
<p>The provisions of the Regulation shall, for the purposes of the present Ag-<br>reement, be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) With regard to Liechtenstein, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Regulation shall enter into force by 1 January 1995;</p>
<p>with regard to Switzerland, the measures necessary to comply<br>with this Regulation shall enter into force by 1 January 1994;</p>
<p>during these transition periods the application of the Regulation<br>will be reciprocally suspended between these States and the other<br>Contracting Parties.</p>
<p>(b) The words “Council and Commission acts” shall mean acts referred<br>to in this Annex.</p>
<p>'Examples: Case 61/65 Vaassen V. Beambtenfonds Wijnbedrijf [1966] E.C.R 261;<br>[1966] C.M.L.R. 508: Case 36/73 Nederlandse Spoorwegen v. Minister van Verkeer<br>en Waterstaat [1973] E.C.R 1299; [1974] 2 C.M.L.R. 148; Case 246/80 Broekmeulen<br>v. Hulsarts Registratle Commissie [1981] E.C.R. 2311: [1982] 1 C.M.L.R. 91.</p>
<p><sup>2</sup> Article 30 of Directive 71/305/EEC and Article 28 of Directive 77/623//EEC refer to<br>this Regulation which needs therefore to be part of the acquis.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XVI</p>
<p>630</p>
<p>ACTS OF WHICH THE CONTRACTING PARTIES SHALL TAKE<br>NOTE</p>
<p>In the application of the provisions of this Annex, the Contracting Parties<br>shall take note of the contents of the following acts:</p>
<p>7. Guide to the Community rules on open public procurement<br>(OJNoC358, 21.12.1987, p. 1)</p>
<p>8. Commission communication (COM(89)400 of 27.7.1989) on regional and<br>social aspects (OJ No C 311, 12.12.1989, p. 7).</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>

<p>I. In AUSTRIA:</p>

<p>Rlkisspitalar (National Hospitals)</p>

<h1>APPENDIX 5</h1>

<p>NORWAY</p>

I, jf.kap.V (LOV 1917-<br>12-14 16, kap. I), or Vassdragsreguleringsloven (LOV 1917-12-14 17) or<br>Energiloven (LOV 1990-06-29 50).</p>
<p>SWEDEN</p>

<p>SWITZERLAND</p>

<p>Rheinhäfen beider Basel: for the Kanton Basel-Stadt set up pursuant to the<br>Gesetz vom 13. November 1919 betreffend Verwaltung der baselstädtischen<br>Rheinhafenanlagen, for the Kanton Basel-Land set up pursuant to the Ge-<br>setz vom 26. Oktober 1936 uber die Errichtung von Hafen-, Geleise- und<br>Strassenanlagen auf dem “Sternenfeld”, Birsfelden, und in der “Au”, Mut-<br>tenz.</p>

<h1>ANNEX XVII</h1>
<h1>INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY</h1>
<h2>List provided for in Article 65</h2>
<p>INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>When the acts referred to in this Annex contain notions or refer to procedu-<br>res which are specific to the Community legal order, such as</p>
<p>- preambles;</p>
<p>- the addressees of the Community acts;</p>
<p>- references to territories or languages of the EC;</p>
<p>- references to rights and obligations of EC Member States, their public<br>entities, undertakings or individuals in relation to each other; and</p>
<p>- &nbsp;references to information and notification procedures;</p>
<p>Protocol 1 on horizontal adaptations shall apply, unless otherwise provided<br>for in this Annex.</p>
<p>ACTS REFERRED TO:</p>
<p>1. 387 L 0054: Council Directive 87/54/EEC of 16 December 1986 on the<br>legal protection of topographies of semiconductor products (OJ No L 24,<br>27.1.1987, p.36)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;in Article l(l)(c), the reference to Article 223 (l)(b) of the EEC<br>Treaty shall be replaced by reference to Article 123 of the EEA Ag-<br>reement.</p>
<p>(b) Article 3(6) to 3(8) shall not apply.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 5(5) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“The exclusive rights to authorize or prohibit the acts specified in<br>paragraph l(b) shall not apply to any such act committed after the<br>topography or the semiconductor product has been put on the<br>market in a Contracting Party by the person entitled to authorize<br>its marketing or with his consent”.</p>
<p>2. 390 D 0510: First Council Decision 90/510/EEC of 9 October 1990 on the<br>extension of the legal protection of topographies of semiconductor products<br>to persons from certain countries and territories (OJ No L 285, 17.10.1990,<br>p.29)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Decision shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In the Annex, the references to Austria and Sweden shall be dele-<br>ted.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;In addition, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>Where a country or territory listed in the Annex does not give the<br>same protection as provided for in that Decision to persons from</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XVII</p>
<p>656</p>
<p>a Contracting Party, the Contracting Parties will use their best en-<br>deavours to ensure that such protection is given by the said<br>country or territory to the said Contracting Party at the latest one<br>year after the date of entry into force of this Agreement.</p>
<p>3. (a) 390 D 0511: Second Council Decision 90/511/EEC of 9 October 1990</p>
<p>on the extension of the legal protection of topographies of semicon-<br>ductor products to persons from certain countries and territories (OJ<br>No L 285, 17.10.1990, p.31)</p>
<p>(b) 390 D 0541: Commission Decision 90/541/EEC of 26 October 1990<br>in accordance with Council Decision 90/511/EEC determining the<br>countries to the companies or other legal persons of which legal pro-<br>tection of topographies of semiconductors is extended (OJ No L<br>307, 7.11.1990, p.21)</p>
<p>In addition to these two Decisions, the following shall apply:</p>
<p>The EFTA States undertake to adopt for the purposes of this<br>Agreement Council Decision 90/511/EEC and the decisions taken<br>by the Commission in accordance with the said Council Decision,<br>if their application is extended beyond 31 December 1992. En-<br>suing EC amendments or replacements shall be adopted by the<br>EFTA States before the entry into force of the Agreement.</p>
<p>4. 389 L 0104: First Council Directive 89/104/EEC of 21 December 1988 to<br>approximate the laws of the Member States relating to trade marks (OJ No<br>L40, 11.2.1989, p.l)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptations:</p>
<p>(a) In Article 3(2), the term “trade mark law” shall be understood to be<br>the trade mark law applicable in a Contracting Party.</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;In Articles 4(2)(a)(i), (2)(b) and (3), 9 and 14, the provisions concer-<br>ning the Community Trade Mark shall not apply to EFTA States un-<br>less the Community Trade Mark extends to them.</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;Article 7(1) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“The trade mark shall not entitle the proprietor to prohibit its use<br>in relation to goods which have been put on the market in a Cont-<br>racting Party under that trade mark by the proprietor or with his<br>consent”.</p>
<p>5. 391 L 0250: Council Directive 91/250/EEC of 14 May 1991 on the legal<br>protection of Computer programs (OJ No L 122, 17.5.1991, p. 42)</p>
<p>The provisions of the Directive shall, for the purposes of the Agreement,<br>be read with the following adaptation:</p>
<p>Article 4(c) shall be replaced by the following:</p>
<p>“any form of distribution to the public, including the rental, of<br>the original Computer program or of copies thereof. The first sale<br>in a Contracting Party of a copy of a programme by the righthol-<br>der or with his consent shall exhaust the distribution right within<br>the territories of the Contracting Parties of that copy, with the ex-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 15</p>
<p>Annex XVII</p>
<p>657</p>
<p>42 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 15</p>
<p>ception of the right to control further rental of the program or a<br>copy thereof’.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>

<p>Equal treatment for men and women</p>
<p>17. 375 L 0117: Council Directive 75/117/EEC of 10 February 1975 on the<br>approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the application<br>of the principle of equal pay for men and women (OJ No L 45, 19.2.1975,<br>p.19)</p>
