<p>stycke b</p>
<p>på det veterinära området när lämpliga åtgärder vidtas i fall av tvister, i enlig-<br>het med:</p>
<p>-artikel 11.1, sjätte och sjunde stycket, i Rådets direktiv 86/469/EEG, se<br>punkt 29 i kapitel I i bilaga I till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>-artikel 2.2 i Rådets direktiv 87/328/EEG, se punkt 81 i kapitel I i bilaga I<br>till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>-artikel 2.2 i Rådets direktiv 90/118/EEG, se punkt 90 i kapitel 1 i bilaga I<br>till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>stycke c</p>
<p>på området för tekniska föreskrifter, standarder, provning och certifiering,<br>när det beslutas om huruvida nationella tekniska föreskrifter skall antas stå<br>i överensstämmelse med de väsentliga säkerhetskraven, i enlighet med:</p>
<p>- artikel 8.2 i Rådets direktiv 86/594/EEG, se punkt 3 i kapitel IV i bilaga II<br>till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>stycke d</p>
<p>På livsmedelsområdet, när besluta fattas om huruvida vissa villkor är upp-<br>fyllda, i enlighet med:</p>
<p>-artikel 6.4 d och 9.4 i Rådets direktiv 79/112/EEG, se punkt 18 i kapitel<br>XII i bilaga II till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>- artikel 1.4 b i Rådets direktiv 90/496/EEG, se punkt 53 i kapitel XII i bilaga<br>II till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Kommittéavtalet</p>
<p>Antecknad tolk-<br>ningsöverenskommelse</p>
<p>stycke e</p>
<p>på området för farliga ämnen:</p>
<p>164</p>
<p>i) &nbsp;&nbsp;när beslut fattas om ytterligare information eller ändring i<br>forskningsprogram till skydd för mänskligheten och miljön, i<br>enlighet med:</p>
<p>- artikel 10.2 i Rådets direktiv 67/548/EEG, se punkt 1 i kapitel<br>XV i bilaga II till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>ii) &nbsp;&nbsp;när beslut fattas om huruvida och i så fall på vilka villkor åtgär-<br>der som vidtagits av en medlemsstat får behållas eller uppre-<br>pas, i enlighet med:</p>
<p>-artikel 7.2 i Rådets direktiv 79/117/EEG, se punkt 6 i kapitel<br>XV i bilaga II till EES-avtalet,</p>
<p>.. när lämpliga åtgärder vidtas avseende iakttagande av god labo-<br>ratoriesed (GLP), i enlighet med:</p>
<p>-artikel 6.2 i Rådets direktiv 88/320/EEG, se punkt 9 i kapitel<br>XV i bilaga II till EES-avtalet.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Kommittéavtalet</p>
<p>Antecknad tolk-<br>ningsöverenskommel;</p>
<p>165</p>
<p>AVTAL OM EN KOMMITTÉ MED LEDAMÖTER</p>
<p>FRÅN EFTA-STATERNAS PARLAMENT</p>
<p>DE AVTALSLUTANDE PARTERNA I AVTALET OM<br>EN STÄNDIG KOMMITTÉ FÖR EFTA-STATERNA OCH<br>I AVTALET MELLAN EFTA-STATERNA OM<br>UPPRÄTTANDE AV EN<br>ÖVERVAKNINGSMYNDIGHET OCH EN DOMSTOL,</p>
<p>SOM MED AVSEENDE på artikel 95 i, och protokoll 36 till, avtalet om<br>Europeiska ekonomiska samarbetsområdet,</p>
<p>SOM BEAKTAR att artikel 9 i avtalet om en ständig kommitté för EFTA-<br>staterna och artikel 47 i avtalet mellan EFTA-staterna om upprättande av en<br>övervakningsmyndighet och en domstol hänvisar till en kommitté bestående<br>av ledamöter från EFTA-staternas parlament vilka är ledamöter i Gemen-<br>samma parlamentariska EES-kommittén,</p>
<p>SOM ÄR ÖVERTYGADE OM att parlamenten från EFTA-staterna kom-<br>mer att ha en viktig roll i utvecklingen av Europeiska ekonomiska samar-<br>betsområdet,</p>
<p>SOM ERINRAR OM målet för de avtalsslutande parterna i EES-avtalet att<br>bidra till att stärka samarbetet mellan ledamöter i Europa-parlamentet och<br>EFTA-staternas parlament,</p>
<p>SOM ÖNSKAR att ytterligare stärka samarbetet mellan parlamenten i<br>EFTA-staterna,</p>
<p>HAR BESLUTAT att träffa följande avtal.</p>
<p>Artikel 1</p>
<p>1. Parlamenten i EFTA-staterna skall, bland sina ledamöter, utse ledamöter<br>som skall delta i EES gemensamma parlamentarikerkommitté som avses i<br>artikel 95 i EES-avtalet, enligt följande:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;från parlamenten i Schweiz, Sverige och Österrike sex ledamöter,</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;från parlamenten i Finland och Norge fem ledamöter,</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;från parlamentet i Island tre ledamöter, och</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;från parlamentet i Liechtenstein två ledamöter.</p>
<p>2. De utsedda ledamöterna skall utgöra en kommitté med ledamöter av<br>EFTA-staternas parlament, nedan kallad Kommittén. Varje parlament får<br>utse suppleanter. Kommittén får i sin arbetsordning besluta att inbjuda ob-<br>servatörer från EFTA-staterna.</p>
<p>Artikel 2</p>
<p>I detta avtal avses med termen ”EFTA-stat” en medlemsstat i Europeiska<br>frihandelssammanslutningen som är part i EES-avtalet, avtalet om en stän-<br>dig kommitté för EFTA-staterna, avtalet mellan EFTA-staterna om upprät-<br>tande av en övervakningsmyndighet och en domstol samt i detta avtal.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Parlamentarikeravtalet</p>
<p>166</p>
<p>Artikel 3</p>
<p>1. Kommittén skall vara ett rådgivande organ till EFTA-staterna i frågor av<br>relevans för EES. Den skall i dessa frågor vidare fungera som en informa-<br>tionskanal mellan EES gemensamma parlamentarikerkommitté och EFTA-<br>staternas parlament samt mellan de sistnämnda parlamenten.</p>
<p>2. Kommittén kan vidare framlägga sina synpunkter för Ständiga kommittén<br>för EFTA-staterna i alla frågor som är relevanta för att EES skall fungera<br>och utvecklas. Den skall också fullgöra de uppgifter som följer av artikel 9<br>första stycket i avtalet om en ständig kommitté för EFTA-staterna och arti-<br>kel 47 första stycket i avtalet mellan EFTA-staterna om upprättande av en<br>övervakningsmyndighet och en domstol.</p>
<p>Artikel 4</p>
<p>Om inte annat föreskrivs i detta avtal, skall Kommittén fatta beslut med en<br>absolut majoritet av avgivna röster.</p>
<p>Artikel 5</p>
<p>Kommittén kan anta rekommendationer eller resolutioner. Minoritctsytt-<br>randen skall fogas till en rekommendation eller resolution som har antagits<br>med en majoritet.</p>
<p>Artikel 6</p>
<p>1. Kommittén skall bland sina ledamöter utse sin ordförande och vice ordfö-<br>rande för en period av ett år.</p>
<p>2. Ordföranden skall på eget initiativ sammankalla Kommittén till möte.<br>Han skall vidare sammankalla till möte antingen på begäran av en tredjedel<br>av dess ledamöter eller på begäran av Ständiga kommittén för EFTA-sta-<br>terna.</p>
<p>Artikel 7</p>
<p>Kommittén kan bland sina ledamöter tillsätta arbetsgrupper som skall<br>rapportera till Kommittén.</p>
<p>Artikel 8</p>
<p>1. Kommittén får hålla gemensamma möten med ministrar från EFTA-<br>staterna i anslutning till möten på ministernivå i Ständiga kommittén för<br>EFTA-statcrna.</p>
<p>2. Vid andra möten med ministrar från EFTA-staterna kan Kommittén in-<br>bjudas att närvara för att framlägga Kommitténs synpunkter.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Parlamentarikeravtah</p>
<p>167</p>
<p>Artikel 9</p>
<p>Ordföranden i Ständiga kommittén för EFTA-staterna samt medlemmar av<br>EFTA:s övervakningsmyndighet får, på inbjudan av Kommittén, närvara vid<br>Kommitténs möten för att höras av denna. De kan muntligen eller skriftligen<br>besvara de frågor som kommitténs ledamöter ställt till dem.</p>
<p>Artikel 10</p>
<p>Kommitténs ordförande skall hålla Ständiga kommittén för EFTA-staterna<br>underrättad om namnen på de parlamentsledamöter som är ledamöter i<br>Kommittén.</p>
<p>Artikel 11</p>
<p>1. Det parlament som utsett en ledamot skall stå för kostnaderna för delta-<br>gande i Kommittén.</p>
<p>2. Om Kommittén har inbjudits att mötas på annan ort än Geneve eller<br>Bryssel skall i vanliga fall den inbjudande EFTA-staten stå för kostnaderna<br>för mötes- och tolkningsarrangemangen.</p>
<p>Artikel 12</p>
<p>Kommittén skall anta sin arbetsordning genom beslut av en majoritet av fem<br>av de sju nationella delegationerna; de ledamöter som utsetts av varje parla-<br>ment utgör därvid en nationell delegation.</p>
<p>Artikel 13</p>
<p>Kommittén kan genom särskilt beslut av parterna i detta avtal åläggas andra<br>uppgifter än de som nämnts ovan.</p>
<p>Artikel 14</p>
<p>Varje EFTA-stat som ansluter sig till EES-avtalet skall ansluta sig till detta<br>avtal.</p>
<p>Artikel 15</p>
<p>1. Varje EFTA-stat som frånträder EES-avtalet skall upphöra att vara part i<br>detta avtal samma dag som frånträdandet blir gällande.</p>
<p>2. Varje EFTA-stat som ansluter sig till Europeiska gemenskapen skall upp-<br>höra att vara part i detta avtal samma dag som anslutningen blir gällande.</p>
<p>3. Regeringarna i de återstående EFTA-staterna skall i samförstånd besluta<br>om de nödvändiga ändringar som skall göras i detta avtal.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Parlamentarikeravtalet</p>
<p>168</p>
<p>Artikel 16</p>
<p>Detta avtal, som upprättats i ett enda autentiskt exemplar på engelska språ-<br>ket, skall ratificeras av de avtalsslutande parterna i enlighet med deras re-<br>spektive konstitutionella krav.</p>
<p>2. Detta avtal skall deponeras hos Sveriges regering, som skall lämna varje<br>EFTA-stat en bestyrkt kopia.</p>
<p>Ratifikationsinstrumenten skall deponeras hos Sveriges regering som skall<br>meddela övriga EFTA-stater.</p>
<p>3. Detta avtal träder i kraft den 1 januari 1993 om EES-avtalet träder i kraft<br>den dagen och under förutsättning att ratifikationsinstrumenten för detta av-<br>tal har deponerats av alla EFTA-stater.</p>
<p>Om EES-avtalet inte träder i kraft den dagen, träder detta avtal i kraft den<br>dag då EES-avtalet träder i kraft eller när alla ratifikationsinstrument för<br>detta avtal har deponerats av alla EFTA-stater, beroende på vilken dag som<br>inträffar senast.</p>
<p>TILL BEVIS HÄRPÅ har undertecknade befullmäktigade undertecknat<br>detta avtal.</p>
<p>SOM SKEDDE i Reykjavik den 20 maj 1992, i ett enda autentiskt exemplar<br>på engelska språket som skall deponeras hos Sveriges regering. Depositarien<br>skall överlämna bestyrkta kopior till alla signatärstater och stater som anslu-<br>ter sig till detta avtal.</p>
<p>För Republiken Finland</p>
<p>För Republiken Island</p>
<p>För Furstendömet Liechtenstein</p>
<p>För Konungariket Norge</p>
<p>För Schweiziska Edsförbundet</p>
<p>För Konungariket Sverige</p>
<p>För Republiken Österrike</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Parlamentarikeravtalet</p>
<p>169</p>
<p>AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EFTA STATES ON<br>THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A SURVEILLANCE<br>AUTHORITY AND A COURT OF JUSTICE</p>
<p>THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA, THE REPUBLIC OF<br>FINLAND, THE REPUBLIC OF ICELAND, THE<br>PRINCIPALITY OF LIECHTENSTEIN, THE<br>KINGDOM OF NORWAY, THE KINGDOM OF SWEDEN<br>AND THE SWISS CONFEDERATION,</p>
<p>HAVING REGARD to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>CONSIDERING that, in accordance with Article 108(1) ofthe EEAAgree-<br>ment, the EFTA States shall establish an independent surveillance authority<br>(EFTA Surveillance Authority) as well as create procedures similar to those<br>existing in the European Community including procedures for ensuring the<br>fulfilment of the obligations under the EEA Agreement and for control of<br>the legality of acts of the EFTA Surveillance Authority regarding competi-<br>tion;</p>
<p>FURTHER CONSIDERING that, in accordance with Article 108(2) of the<br>EEA Agreement, the EFTA States shall establish a court of justice of the<br>EFTA States;</p>
<p>RECALLING the objective of the Contracting Parties to the EEA Agree-<br>ment, in full deference to the independence of the courts, to arrive at and<br>maintain a uniform interpretation and application of the EEA Agreement<br>and those provisions of the Community legislation which are substantially<br>reproduced in that Agreement and to arrive at an equal treatment of indi-<br>viduals and economic operators as regards the four freedoms and the condi-<br>tions of competition;</p>
<p>REITERATING that the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the Commis-<br>sion of the European Communities shall cooperate, exchange information<br>and consult each other on surveillance policy issues and individual cases;</p>
<p>CONSIDERING that the preambles to acts adopted in application of the<br>Treaties establishing the European Economic Community and the European<br>Coal and Steel Community shall, in so far as those acts correspond to the<br>provisions of Protocols 1 to 4 and to the provisions of the acts corresponding<br>to those listed in Annexes I and II to this Agreement, be relevant to the ex-<br>tent necessary for the proper interpretation and application of the provisions<br>of these Protocols and Annexes;</p>
<p>WHEREAS in the application of Protocols 1 to 4 to this Agreement due ac-<br>count shall be paid to the legal and administrative practices of the Commis-<br>sion of the European Communities prior to the entry into force of this<br>Agreement;</p>
<p>HAVE DECIDED to conclude the following Agreement:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>170</p>
<h1>PARTI</h1>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Agreement:</p>
<p>(a) the term 'EEA Agreement’ means the main part of the EEA Agree-<br>ment, its Protocols and Annexes as well as the acts referred to<br>therein;</p>
<p>(b) the term 'EFTA State’ means a Contracting Party which is a Member<br>of the European Free Trade Association and is a Party to the EEA<br>Agreement and to the present Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>The EFTA States shall take all appropriate measures, whether general or<br>particular, to ensure fulfilment of the obligations arising out of this Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>They shall abstain from any measure which could jeopardize the attain-<br>ment of the objectives of this Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>1. Without prejudice to future developments of case law, the provisions of<br>Protocols 1 to 4 and the provisions of the acts corresponding to those listed<br>in Annexes I and II to this Agreement, in so far as they are identical in sub-<br>stance to corresponding rules of the Treaty establishing the European<br>Economic Community and the Treaty establishing the European Coal and<br>Steel Community and to acts adopted in application of these two Treaties,<br>shall in their implementation and application be interpreted in conformity<br>with the relevant rulings of the Court of Justice of the European Communit-<br>ies given prior to the date of signature of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. In the interpretation and application of the EEA Agreement and this<br>Agreement, the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the EFTA Court shall pay<br>due account to the principles laid down by the relevant rulings by the Court<br>of Justice of the European Communities given after the date of signature of<br>the EEA Agreement and which concern the interpretation of that Agree-<br>ment or of such rules of the Treaty establishing the European Economic<br>Community and the Treaty establishing the European Coal and Steel Com-<br>munity in so far as they are identical in substance to the provisions of the<br>EEA Agreement or to the provisions of Protocols 1 to 4 and the provisions<br>of the acts corresponding to those listed in Annexes I and II to the present<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>171</p>
<h1>PART II</h1>
<h2>THE EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY</h2>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>An independent surveillance authority among the EFTA States, the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority, is hereby established.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in accordance with the provi-<br>sions of this Agreement and the provisions of the EEA Agreement and in<br>order to ensure the proper functioning of the EEA Agreement:</p>
<p>(a) ensure the fulfilment by the EFTA States of their obligations under<br>the EEA Agreement and this Agreement;</p>
<p>(b) ensure the application of the rules of the EEA Agreement on com-<br>petition;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;monitor the application of the EEA Agreement by the other Con-<br>tracting Parties to that Agreement.</p>
<p>2. To this end, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;take decisions and other measures in cases provided for in this<br>Agreement and in the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(b) formulate recommendations, deliver opinions and issue notices or<br>guidelines on matters dealt with in the EEA Agreement, if that<br>Agreement or the present Agreement expressly so provides or if the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority considers it necessary;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;carry out cooperation, exchange of information and consultations<br>with the Commission of the European Communities as provided for<br>in this Agreement and the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(d) carry out the functions which, through the application of Protocol 1<br>to the EEA Agreement, follow from the acts referred to in the An-<br>nexes to that Agreement, as specified in Protocol 1 to the present<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>In accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and the EEA Agree-<br>ment, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may, in carrying out the duties as-<br>signed to it, request all the necessary information from the Governments and<br>competent authorities of the EFTA States and from undertakings and associ-<br>ations of undertakings.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall consist of seven members, who shall<br>be chosen on the grounds of their general competence and whose independ-<br>ence is beyond doubt.</p>
<p>172</p>
<p>Only nationals of EFTA States may be members of the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>The members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be completely inde-<br>pendent in the performance of their duties. They shall neither seek nor take<br>instructions from any Government or other body. They shall refrain from<br>any action incompatible with their duties. Each EFTA State undertakes to<br>respect this principle and not to seek to influence the members of the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority in the performance of their tasks.</p>
<p>The members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall not, during their<br>term of office, engage in any other occupation, whether gainful or not.</p>
<p>When entering upon their duties they shall give a solemn undertaking that,<br>both during and after their term of office, they will respect the obligations<br>arising therefrom and in particular their duty to behave with integrity and<br>discretion as regards the acceptance, after they have ceased to hold office,<br>of certain appointments or benefits. In the event of any breach of these ob-<br>ligations, the EFTA Court may, on application by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority, rule that the member concerned be, according to the circum-<br>stances, either compulsorily retired or deprived of his right to a pension or<br>other benefits in its stead.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>The members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be appointed by<br>common accord of the Governments of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Their term of office shall be four years. It shall be renewable.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>Apart from normal replacement, or death, the duties of a member of the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority shall end when he resigns or is compulsorily<br>retired. The vacancy thus caused shall be filled for the remainder of the<br>member’s term of office.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>If a member of the EFTA Surveillance Authority no longer fulfils the condi-<br>tions required for the performance of his duties or if he has been guilty of<br>serious misconduct, the EFTA Court may, on application by the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority, compulsorily retire him.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>The President of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be appointed from<br>among its members for a period of two years by common accord of the Gov-<br>ernments of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>173</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall adopt its own rules of procedure.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall appoint officials and other servants<br>to enable it to function.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority may consult experts or decide to set up<br>such committees and other bodies as it considers necessary to assist it in ac-<br>complishing its tasks.</p>
<p>In the performance of their duties, officials and other servants of the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority shall neither seek nor accept instructions from<br>any Government or from any body external to the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority.</p>
<p>Members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, officials and other servants<br>thereof as well as members of committees shall be required, even after their<br>duties have ceased, not to disclose information of the kind covered by the<br>obligation of professional secrecy, in particular information about undertak-<br>ings, their business relations or their cost components.</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall act by majority of its Members. In<br>the event of an equal number of votes, the President shall have a casting<br>vote.</p>
<p>The rules of procedure shall determine the quorum.</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Decisions of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall State the reasons on<br>which they are based.</p>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>Save as otherwise provided in this Agreement or in the EEA Agreement,<br>decisions of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be notified to those to<br>whom they are addressed and shall take effect upon such notification.</p>
<p>Article 18</p>
<p>Decisions of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be published in accord-<br>ance with the provisions of this Agreement and of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 19</p>
<p>Decisions of the EFTA Surveillance Authority which impose a pecuniary ob-<br>ligation on persons other than States, shall be enforceable in accordance with<br>Article 110 of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>174</p>
<p>Article 20</p>
<p>Individuals and economic operators shall be entitled to address and be ad-<br>dressed by the EFTA Surveillance Authority in any official language of the<br>EFTA States and the European Communities as regards notifications, ap-<br>plications and complaints. This shall also cover all instances of a proceeding,<br>whether it be opened on notification, application or complaint or ex officio<br>by the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>Article 21</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall annually publish a general report on<br>its activities.</p>
<h1>PART III</h1>
<h2>THE EFTA STATES’ FULFILMENT OF THEIR<br>OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE EEA AGREEMENT AND<br>THE PRESENT AGREEMENT</h2>
<p>Article 22</p>
<p>In order to ensure the proper application of the EEA Agreement, the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority shall monitor the application of the provisions of the<br>EEA Agreement and of the present Agreement by the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 23</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in accordance with Articles 22 and<br>37 of this Agreement and Articles 65(1) and 109 of, and Annex XVI to, the<br>EEAAgreement as well as subject to the provisions contained in Protocol 2<br>to the present Agreement, ensure that the provisions of the EEAAgreement<br>concerning procurement are applied by the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 24</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in accordance with Articles 49, 61<br>to 64 and 109 of, and Protocols 14, 26, 27, and Annexes XIII, section I(iv),<br>and XV to, the EEA Agreement, as well as subject to the provisions con-<br>tained in Protocol 3 to the present Agreement, give effect to the provisions<br>of the EEA Agreement concerning State aid as well as ensure that those pro-<br>visions are applied by the EFTA States.</p>
<p>In application of Article 5(2)(b), the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall,<br>in particular, upon the entry into force of this Agreement, adopt acts<br>corresponding to those listed in Annex I.</p>
<p>Article 25</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in accordance with Articles 53 to 60<br>and 109 of, and Protocols 21 to 25 and Annex XIV to, the EEAAgreement,</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>175</p>
<p>as well as subject to the provisions contained in Protocol 4 to the present<br>Agreement, give effect to the provisions of the EEA Agreement relating to<br>the implementation of the competition rules applicable to undertakings as<br>well as ensure that those provisions are applied.</p>
<p>In application of Article 5(2)(b), the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall,<br>in particular, upon the entry into force of this Agreement, adopt acts<br>corresponding to those listed in Annex II.</p>
<p>Article 26</p>
<p>Provisions governing the cooperation, exchange of information and consul-<br>tation between the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the Commission of the<br>European Communities concerning the application of the EEA Agreement<br>are laid down in Article 109 as well as in Articles 58 and 62(2) of, and Proto-<br>cols 1, 23, 24, and 27 to, the EEA Agreement.</p>
<h1>PART IV</h1>
<h2>THE EFTA COURT</h2>
<p>Article 27</p>
<p>A court of justice of the EFTA States, hereinafter referred to as the EFTA<br>Court, is hereby established. It shall function in accordance with the provi-<br>sions of this Agreement and of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 28</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall consist of seven judges.</p>
<p>Article 29</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall sit in plenary session. Decisions of the Court shall be<br>valid only when an uneven number of its members is sitting in the delibera-<br>tions. Decisions of the Court shall be valid if five members are sitting. At the<br>request of the Court, the Governments of the EFTA States may, by common<br>accord, allow it to establish chambers.</p>
<p>Article 30</p>
<p>The Judges shall be chosen from persons whose independence is beyond<br>doubt and who possess the qualifications required for appointment to the<br>highest judicial offices in their respective countries or who are jurisconsults<br>of recognized competence. They shall be appointed by common accord of<br>the Governments of the EFTA States for a term of six years.</p>
<p>Every three years there shall be a partial replacement of the Judges. Three<br>and four Judges shall be replaced alternately. The three Judges to be<br>replaced after the first three years shall be determined by lot.</p>
<p>Retiring Judges shall be eligible for reappointment.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>176</p>
<p>The Judges shall elect the President of the EFTA Court from among their<br>number for a term of three years. He may be re-elected.</p>
<p>Article 31</p>
<p>If the EFTA Surveillance Authority considers that an EFTA State has failed<br>to fulfil an obligation under the EEA Agreement or of this Agreement, it<br>shall, unless otherwise provided for in this Agreement, deliver a reasoned<br>opinion on the matter after giving the State concerned the opportunity to<br>submit its observations.</p>
<p>If the State concerned does not comply with the opinion within the period<br>laid down by the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the latter may bring the mat-<br>ter before the EFTA Court.</p>
<p>Article 32</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall have jurisdiction in actions concerning the settlement<br>of disputes between two or more EFTA States regarding the interpretation<br>or application of the EEA Agreement, the Agreement on a Standing Com-<br>mittee of the EFTA States or the present Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 33</p>
<p>The EFTA States concerned shall take the necessary measures to comply<br>with the judgments of the EFTA Court.</p>
<p>Article 34</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall have jurisdiction to give advisory opinions on the in-<br>terpretation of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Where such a question is raised before any court or tribunal in an EFTA<br>State, that court or tribunal may, if it considers it necessary to enable it to<br>give judgment, request the EFTA Court to give such an opinion.</p>
<p>An EFTA State may in its internal legislation limit the right to request such<br>an advisory opinion to courts and tribunals against whose decisions there is<br>no judicial remedy under national law.</p>
<p>Article 35</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall have unlimited jurisdiction in regard to penalties im-<br>posed by the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>Article 36</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall have jurisdiction in actions brought by an EFTA State<br>against a decision of the EFTA Surveillance Authority on grounds of lack of<br>competence, infringement of an essential procedural requirement, or in-<br>fringement of this Agreement, of the EEA Agreement or of any rule of law<br>relating to their application, or misuse of powers.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>177</p>
<p>12 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<p>Any natural or legal person may, under the same conditions, institute pro-<br>ceedings before the EFTA Court against a decision of the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority addressed to that person or against a decision addressed to an-<br>other person, if it is of direct and individual concern to the former.</p>
<p>The proceedings provided for in this Article shall be instituted within two<br>months of the publication of the measure, or of its notification to the plaint-<br>iff, or, in the absence thereof, of the day on which it came to the knowledge<br>of the latter, as the case may be.</p>
<p>If the action is well founded the decision of the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority shall be declared void.</p>
<p>Article 37</p>
<p>Should the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in infringement of this Agreement<br>or the provisions of the EEA Agreement, fail to act, an EFTA State may<br>bring an action before the EFTA Court to have the infringement established.</p>
<p>The action shall be admissible only if the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>has first been called upon to act. If, within two months of being so called<br>upon, the EFTA Surveillance Authority has not defined its position, the ac-<br>tion may be brought within a further period of two months.</p>
<p>Any natural or legal person may, under the conditions laid down in the<br>prcccding paragraph, complain to the EFTA Court that the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority has failed to address to that person any decision.</p>
<p>Article 38</p>
<p>If a decision of the EFTA Surveillance Authority has been declared void or<br>if it has been established that the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in infringe-<br>ment of this Agreement or of the provisions of the EEA Agreement, has<br>failed to act, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take the necessary meas-<br>ures to comply with the judgment.</p>
<p>This obligation shall not affect any obligation which may result from the<br>application of Article 46, second paragraph.</p>
<p>Article 39</p>
<p>Savc as otherwise provided for in Protocol 7 to this Agreement, the EFTA<br>Court shall have jurisdiction in actions against the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority relating to compensation for damage provided for in Article 46, second<br>paragraph.</p>
<p>Article 40</p>
<p>Actions brought before the EFTA Court shall not have suspensory effect.<br>The EFTA Court may, however, if it considers that circumstances so require,<br>order that application of the contcsted act be suspended.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>178</p>
<p>Article 41</p>
<p>The EFTA Court may in any case before it prescribe any necessary interim<br>measures.</p>
<h1>PART V</h1>
<h2>GENERAL AND FINAL PROVISIONS</h2>
<p>Article 42</p>
<p>The Protocols and Annexes to this Agreement shall form an integral part<br>thereof.</p>
<p>Article 43</p>
<p>1. The Statute of the EFTA Court is laid down in Protocol 5 to this Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Court shall adopt its rules of procedure to be approved by the<br>Governments of the EFTA States by common accord.</p>
<p>Article 44</p>
<p>1. The legal capacity, privileges and immunities to be recognized and gr-<br>anted by the EFTA States in connection with the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority and the EFTA Court are laid down in Protocols 6 and 7 to this Agree-<br>ment, respectively.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority and the EFTA Court, respectively,<br>may conclude with the Government of the States in whose territory their se-<br>ats are situated an agreement relating to the privileges and immunities to be<br>recognized and granted in connection with it.</p>
<p>Article 45</p>
<p>The seat of the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the EFTA Court, respect-<br>ively, shall be determined by common accord of the Governments of the<br>EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 46</p>
<p>The contractual liability of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be gov-<br>erned by the law applicable to the contract in question.</p>
<p>In the case of non-contractual liability, the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>shall, in accordance with the general principles of law, make good any dam-<br>age caused by it, or by its servants, in the performance of its duties.</p>
<p>Article 47</p>
<p>The Governments of the EFTA States shall, on a proposal from the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority and after Consulting a committee consisting of the</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>179</p>
<p>members of Parliament of the EFTA States who are members of the EEA<br>Joint Parliamentary Committee, each year before 1 January by common ac-<br>cord establish a budget for the coming year and the apportionment of those<br>expenses between the EFTA States.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be consulted before a decision<br>modifying or amending its proposal for a budget is adopted.</p>
<p>Article 48</p>
<p>The Governments of the EFTA States shall, on a proposal from the EFTA<br>Court, each year before 1 January by common accord establish a budget for<br>the EFTA Court for the coming year and the apportionment of those ex-<br>penses between them.</p>
<p>Article 49</p>
<p>The Governments of the EFTA States may, unless otherwise provided in this<br>Agreement, on a proposal from or after hearing the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority, by common accord amend the main Agreement as well as Proto-<br>cols 1 to 4 and 6 and 7. Such an amendment shall be submitted to the EFTA<br>States for acceptance and shall enter into force provided it is approved by all<br>EFTA States. Instruments of acceptance shall be deposited with the Govern-<br>ment of Sweden which shall notify all other EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 50</p>
<p>1. Any EFTA State which withdraws from the EEA Agreement shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>withdrawal takes effect.</p>
<p>2. Any EFTA State which acccdcs to the European Community shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>accession takes effect.</p>
<p>3. The Governments of the remaining EFTA States shall, by common ac-<br>cord, decide on the necessary amendments to bc made to the present Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>Article 51</p>
<p>Any EFTA State acceding to the EEA Agreement shall accede to the pre-<br>sent Agreement on such terms and conditions as may be laid down by com-<br>mon accord by the EFTA States. The instrument of accession shall be depos-<br>ited with the Government of Sweden which shall notify the other EFTA<br>States.</p>
<p>Article 52</p>
<p>The EFTA States shall communicate to the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>the measures taken for the implementation of this Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>180</p>
<p>Article 53</p>
<p>1. This Agreement, drawn up in a single copy and authentic in the English<br>language, shall be ratified by the Contracting Parties in accordance with their<br>respective constitutional requirements.</p>
<p>Before the entry into force of this Agreement, it shall also be drawn up<br>and authcnticatcd in Finnish, French, German, Icelandic, Italian, Norweg-<br>ian and Swedish.</p>
<p>2. This Agreement shall be deposited with the Government of Sweden<br>which shall transmit a certified copy to each EFTA State.</p>
<p>The instruments of ratification shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden which shall notify all other EFTA States.</p>
<p>3. This Agreement shall enter into force on 1 January 1993 provided that<br>the EEA Agreement enters into force on that day and provided that the in-<br>struments of ratification of the present Agreement have been deposited by<br>all EFTA States.</p>
<p>If the EEA Agreement does not enter into force on that day the present<br>Agreement shall enter into force on the day the EEA Agreement enters into<br>force or when all instruments of ratification of the present Agreement have<br>been deposited by all EFTA States, whichever day is the later.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>181</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL1</h1>
<p>ON THE FUNCTIONS AND POWERS OF THE EFTA<br>SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY WHICH, THROUGH<br>THE APPLICATION OF PROTOCOL 1 TO THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT, FOLLOW FROM THE ACTS REFERRED<br>TO IN THE ANNEXES TO THAT AGREEMENT</p>
<p>HAVING REGARD to the EEA Agreement and, in particular, Protocol 1<br>thereto;</p>
<p>NOTING that paragraphs 4(d) and 5 of Protocol 1 to the EEA Agreement<br>contain references to the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the Standing<br>Committee;</p>
<p>FURTHER NOTING that in paragraph 4(d) of Protocol 1 to the EEA<br>Agreement reference is made to procedures established among the EFTA<br>States;</p>
<p>WHEREAS for the proper application of acts referred to in the Annexes to<br>the EEA Agreement, it is necessary to establish among the EFTA States the<br>functions corresponding to those of the EC Commission which, through the<br>application of Protocol 1 to the EEA Agreement, should be carried out ei-<br>ther by the EFTA Surveillance Authority or the Standing Committee, as well<br>as to establish the procedures to be applied among the EFTA States for that<br>purpose;</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. Where the acts referred to in the Annexes to the EEA Agreement contain<br>provisions on procedures under which the EC Commission:</p>
<p>(a) informs a Member State whether a precautionary measure or a safe-<br>guard measure taken by a Member State was justified;</p>
<p>(b) shall be consulted by a Member State before an exemption or de-<br>rogation from a provision of an act is granted or undertaken by that<br>State;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;may, before an exemption or derogation from a provision of an act<br>is granted or undertaken by a Member State, agree or authorize that<br>State to do so, including, where necessary, to specify the conditions<br>under which the authorization is granted or to lay down detailed<br>rules concerning its implementation;</p>
<p>(d) shall, where necessary, hold consultations with the Member States<br>concerned or their competent authorities, in particular with a view<br>to settling differences and disputes and, as the case may be, propos-<br>ing appropriate Solutions;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;in the veterinary and phytosanitary field,</p>
<p>-may make or arrange for assessments, tests and on-the-spot<br>checks;</p>
<p>- may give approvals, or the like, or make recommendations regard-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 1</p>
<p>182</p>
<p>ing plans, programmes, emergency vaccinations, high-risk areas,<br>etc.;</p>
<p>-shall draw up lists, such as lists of experts, approved zones, ap-<br>proved farms, etc., and, as the case may be, forward them to the<br>Member States;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;in the veterinary field,</p>
<p>- may adopt appropriate measures in the case of disputes;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;in the field of technical regulations, standards, testing and certifica-<br>tion,</p>
<p>- shall notify the Member States of national technical specifications<br>in respect of which there is a presumption of conformity with the<br>essential safety requirements and, as the case may be, initiate<br>procedures when it considers that such a presumption of conform-<br>ity must be withdrawn;</p>
<p>(h) &nbsp;in the field of foodstuffs;</p>
<p>- may decide whether certain conditions are satisfied;</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;in the field of energy,</p>
<p>- shall implement the procedures provided for by Community law;</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;in the field of procurement,</p>
<p>- may request information from the Member States or their compet-<br>ent authorities and/or shall determine the nature of any additional<br>statistical information required;</p>
<p>- may establish lists of the categories of activities or services which<br>it considers to be covered by an exelusion;</p>
<p>- shall lay down the conditions under which Contracting entities<br>shall communicate to it the results of an awarding procedure;</p>
<p>those and comparable functions shall for the EFTA States be carried out by<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority in accordance with the procedures laid<br>down in the acts referred to.</p>
<p>2. If the EC Commission is entrusted with other comparable functions, the<br>corresponding functions shall also be carried out by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall rcceive information which an<br>EFTA State or a competent authority according to the EEA rules shall sub-<br>mit to it and pass on that information to the EC Commission.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall further receive corresponding in-<br>formation from the EC Commission for distribution to the EFTA States or<br>their competent authorities.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Where, in an act referred to in the Annexes to the EEA Agreement contain-<br>ing the procedures described in Article 1, the EC Commission shall submit<br>a draft measure to be taken to, or otherwise consult, an EC committee, the<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 1</p>
<p>183</p>
<p>EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, according to corresponding procedures<br>to be laid down by the Standing Committee, consult a corresponding com-<br>mittee, if any, set up or designated in accordance with the Agreement on a<br>Standing Committee of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, unless otherwise agreed with the<br>EC Commission, concurrently with the EC Commission prepare, as appro-<br>priate, reports, assessments or the like with regard to the EFTA States, in<br>the cases which through the application of paragraph 5 of Protocol 1 to the<br>EEA Agreement follow from the acts referred to in the Annexes to that<br>Agreement and which are not directly related to the functions of the Stand-<br>ing Committee set out in Protocol 1 to the Agreement on a Standing Com-<br>mittee of the EFTA States. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall consult,<br>and exchange views with, the EC Commission during the preparation of<br>their respective reports, copies of which are to be sent to the EEA Joint<br>Committee.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 1</p>
<p>184</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL 2</h1>
<h2>ON THE FUNCTIONS AND POWERS OF THE EFTA<br>SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY IN THE FIELD OF<br>PROCUREMENT</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. Without prejudice to Article 31 of this Agreement, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority may invoke the procedure for which the present<br>Article provides when, prior to a contract being concluded, it considers that<br>a clear and manifest infringement of the provisions of the EEA Agreement<br>in the field of procurement has been committed during a contract award<br>procedure falling within the scope of the acts referred to in points 2 and 3 of<br>Annex XVI to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall notify the EFTA State and the<br>contracting authority concerned of the reasons which have led it to conclude<br>that a clear and manifest infringement has been committed and request its<br>correction.</p>
<p>3. Within 21 days of receipt of the notification referred to in paragraph 2,<br>the EFTA State concerned shall communicate to the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;its confirmation that the infringement has been corrected; or</p>
<p>(b) a reasoned submission as to why no correction has been made; or</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;a notice to the effect that the contract award procedure has been<br>suspended either by the contracting authority on its own initiative or<br>on the basis of the powers specified in Article 2(l)(a) of the act re-<br>ferred to in point 5 of Annex XVI to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>4. A reasoned submission in accordance with paragraph 3(b) of this Article<br>may rely among other matters on the fact that the alleged infringement is<br>already the subject of judicial or other review proceedings or of a review as<br>referred to in Article 2(8) of the act referred to in point 5 of Annex XVI to<br>the EEA Agreement. In such a case, the EFTA State shall inform the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority of the result of those proceedings as soon as it be-<br>comes known.</p>
<p>5. Where notice has been given that a contract award procedure has been<br>suspended in accordance with paragraph 3(c) of this Article, the EFTA State<br>shall notify the EFTA Surveillance Authority when the suspension is lifted<br>or another contract procedure relating in whole or in part to the same subject<br>matter is begun. That notification shall confirm that the alleged infringement<br>has been corrected or include a reasoned submission as to why no correction<br>has been made.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. Not later than 1 January 1996, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall,<br>together with an advisory committee composed of representatives of the<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol2</p>
<p>185</p>
<p>EFTA States, review the manner in which the provisions of this Protocol and<br>the provisions of the act referred to in point 5 of Annex XVI of the EEA<br>Agreement have been implemented and, if necessary, make proposals for<br>amendments. The committee shall have as Chairman a representative of the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority. The committee shall be convened by its<br>Chairman either on his own initiative or at the request of one of its members.</p>
<p>2. By 1 March each year the EFTA States shall communicate to the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority information on the operation of their national review<br>procedures during the preceding calendar year. The nature of the informa-<br>tion shall be determined by the EFTA Surveillance Authority in consultation<br>with the advisory committee.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 2</p>
<p>186</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL 3</h1>
<h2>ON THE FUNCTIONS AND POWERS OF THE EFTA<br>SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY IN THE FIELD OF<br>STATE AID</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in cooperation with the EFTA<br>States, keep under constant review all systems of aid existing in those States.<br>It shall propose to the latter any appropriate measures required by the pro-<br>gressive development or by the functioning of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. If, after giving notice to the parties concerned to submit their comments,<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority finds that aid granted by an EFTA State<br>or through EFTA State resources is not compatible with the functioning of<br>the EEA Agreement having regard to Article 61 of the EEA Agreement, or<br>that such aid is being misused, it shall decide that the EFTA State concerned<br>shall abolish or alter such aid within a period of time to be determined by the<br>Authority.</p>
<p>If the EFTA State concerned does not comply with this decision within the<br>prescribed time, the EFTA Surveillance Authority or any other interested<br>EFTA State may, in derogation from Articles 31 and 32 of this Agreement,<br>refer the matter to the EFTA Court directly.</p>
<p>On application by an EFTA State, the EFTA States may, by common ac-<br>cord, decide that aid which that State is granting or intends to grant shall be<br>considered to be compatible with the functioning of the EEA Agreement, in<br>derogation from the provisions of Article 61 of the EEA Agreement, if such<br>a decision is justified by exceptional circumstances. If, as regards the aid in<br>question, the EFTA Surveillance Authority has already initiated the<br>procedure provided for in the first subparagraph of this paragraph, the fact<br>that the State concerned has made its application to the EFTA States shall<br>have the effect of suspending that procedure until the EFTA States, by com-<br>mon accord, have made their attitude known.</p>
<p>If, however, the EFTA States have not made their attitude known within<br>three months of the said application being made, the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall give its decision on the case.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall be informed, in sufficient time to<br>enable it to submit its comments, of any plans to grant or alter aid. If it con-<br>siders that any such plan is not compatible with the functioning of the EEA<br>Agreement having regard to Article 61 of the EEAAgreement, it shall with-<br>out delay initiate the procedure provided for in paragraph 2. The State con-<br>cerned shall not put its proposed measures into effect until this procedure<br>has resulted in a final decision.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. An advisory committee shall assist the EFTA Surveillance Authority in<br>its examination of aid granted for transport by rail, road and inland water-<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol3</p>
<p>187</p>
<p>way. The committee shall have as Chairman a representative of the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority and shall consist of representatives appointed by<br>each EFTA State. Not less than ten days’ notice of meetings of the commit-<br>tee shall be given and such notice shall include details of the agenda. This<br>period may be reduced for urgent cases.</p>
<p>2. The committee may examine, and give an opinion on, all questions con-<br>cerning the operation of the provisions of the EEA Agreement on the grant-<br>ing of aid in the transport sector.</p>
<p>3. The committee shall be kept informed of the nature and amount of aid<br>granted to transport undertakings and, generally, of all relevant details con-<br>cerning such aid, as soon as the latter is notified to the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority in accordance with the provisions laid down in Annex XIII, sec-<br>tion I (iv), to the EEA Agreement governing the granting of aid in the trans-<br>port sector.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol3</p>
<p>188</p>

<h1>PART I GENERAL RULES</h1>
<h2>CHAPTER I INTRODUCTION</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>This Protocol sets out provisions for the implementation of competition rules<br>applicable to undertakings in the EEA Agreement, and in particular for the<br>implementation of Protocols 21 to 25 to that Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. Chapters II to V, XIII and XIV apply to all sectors covered by the EEA<br>Agreement unless otherwise provided.</p>
<p>2. Chapters II to IV shall not apply to agreements, decisions or concerted<br>practices in the transport sector which have as their object or effect the fixing<br>of transport rates and conditions, the limitation or control of the supply of<br>transport or the sharing of transport markets; nor shall they apply to the ab-<br>use of a dominant position, within the meaning of Article 54 of the EEA<br>Agreement, within the transport market. Such cases are covered by Chap-<br>ters VI to XII.</p>
<p>3. Chapters II to V, XIII and XIV shall not apply to cases covered by<br>Chapter XV, on the conditions set out therein.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Chapter XVI sets out the transitional rules applicable for Chapters II to XV.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority may, in accordance with Article49 of this<br>Agreement, submit to the Governments of the EFTA States proposals for<br>amendments to this Protocol including its Appendices.</p>
<h2>CHAPTER II GENERAL PROCEDURAL RULES<br>IMPLEMENTING ARTICLES 53 AND 54 OF THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Basic provision</p>
<p>Without prejudice to Article 6 of this Chapter and Article 3 of Chapter XVI,<br>agreements, decisions and concerted practices of the kind described in<br>Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement and the abuse of a dominant position<br>in the market, within the meaning of Article 54 of the EEA Agreement, shall<br>be prohibited, no prior decision to that effect being required.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>192</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Negative clearance</p>
<p>Upon application by the undertakings or associations of undertakings con-<br>cerned, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may certify that, on the basis of<br>the facts in its possession, there are no grounds under Article 53(1) or<br>Article 54 of the EEA Agreement for action on its part in respect of an agree-<br>ment, decision or practice.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Termination of infringements</p>
<p>1. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority, upon application or upon its<br>own initiative, finds that there is infringement of Article 53 or Article 54 of<br>the EEA Agreement, it may by decision require the undertakings or associ-<br>ations of undertakings concerned to bring such infringement to an end.</p>
<p>2. Those entitled to make application are:</p>
<p>(a) EFTA States;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;natural or legal persons who claim a legitimate interest.</p>
<p>3. Without prejudice to the other provisions of this Protocol, the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority may, before taking a decision under paragraph 1, ad-<br>dress to the undertakings or associations of undertakings concerned recom-<br>mendations for termination of the infringement.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Notification of new agreements, decisions and practices</p>
<p>1. Agreements, decisions and concerted practices of the kind described in<br>Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement which come into existence after the<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement and in respect of which the parties<br>seek application of Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement shall be notified to<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to Article 56 of the EEA Agree-<br>ment, the rules referred to in Articles 1 to 3 of Protocol 21 and the rules re-<br>ferred to in Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement, as well as in Chapters III,<br>VI, VII, IX, X, XI, XII and XV. Until they have been notified, no decision<br>in application of Article 53(3) may be taken.</p>
<p>2. Paragraph 1 shall not apply to agreements, decisions and concerted prac-<br>tices where:</p>
<p>(a) the only parties thereto are undertakings from one EC Member<br>State or from one EFTA State and the agreements, decisions or<br>concerted practices do not reläte either to imports or to exports be-<br>tween Contracting Parties to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(b) not more than two undertakings are party thereto, and the agree-<br>ments only:</p>
<p>(i) restrict the freedom of one party to the contract in determining</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>193</p>
<p>13 Riksdagen 199H92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<p>the prices or conditions of business upon which the goods which<br>he has obtained from the other party to the contract may be re-<br>sold; or</p>
<p>(ii) impose restrictions on the exercise of the rights of the assignee<br>or user of industrial property rights - in particular patents, u t ili ty<br>models, designs or trademarks - or of the person entitled under<br>a contract to the assignment, or grant, of the right to use a<br>method of manufacture or knowledge relating to the use and to<br>the application of industrial processes;</p>
<p>(c) they have as their sole object:</p>
<p>(i) the development or uniform application of standards or types;<br>or</p>
<p>(ii) joint research or development; or</p>
<p>(iii) specialization in the manufacture of products including agree-<br>ments necessary for achieving this:</p>
<p>-where the products which are the subject of specialization do<br>not, in a substantial part of the territory covered by this<br>Agreement, represent more than 15% of the volume of busi-<br>ness done in identical products or those considered by con-<br>sumers to be similar by reason of their characteristics, price<br>and use; and</p>
<p>- where the total annual turnover of the participating undertak-<br>ings does not exceed 200 million ECU.</p>
<p>These agreements, decisions and concerted practices may be notified to the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to Article 56 of the EEA Agree-<br>ment, the rules referred to in Articles 1 to 3 of Protocol 21 and the rules re-<br>ferred to in Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement, as well as in Chapters III,<br>VI, VII, IX, X, XI, XII and XV.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Notification of existing agreements, decisions and practices</p>
<p>(See Article 1 of Chapter XVI)</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>Decisions pursuant to Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement</p>
<p>1. Whenever the EFTA Surveillance Authority takes a decision pursuant to<br>Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement, it shall specify therein the date from<br>which the decision shall take effect. Such date shall not be earlier than the<br>date of notification.</p>
<p>2. The second sentence of paragraph 1 shall not apply to agreements, de-<br>cisions or concerted practices falling within Article 4(2) of this Chapter and<br>Article 1(2) of Chapter XVI, nor to those falling within Article 1(1) of<br>Chapter XVI which have been notified within the time-limit specified in<br>Article 1(1) of Chapter XVI.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>194</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>Special provisions for existing agreements, decisions and practices</p>
<p>(See Article 3 of Chapter XVI)</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>Duration and revocation of decisions under Article 53(3)</p>
<p>1. A decision in application of Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement shall be<br>issued for a specified period and conditions and obligations may be attached<br>thereto.</p>
<p>2. A decision may on application be renewed if the requirements of<br>Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement continue to be satisfied.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may revoke or amend its decision or<br>prohibit specified acts by the parties:</p>
<p>(a) where there has been a change in any of the facts which were basic<br>to the making of the decision;</p>
<p>(b) where the parties commit a breach of any obligation attached to the<br>decision;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;where the decision is based on incorrect information or was induced<br>by deceit;</p>
<p>(d) where the parties abuse the exemption from the provisions of<br>Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement granted to them by the de-<br>cision.</p>
<p>In cases to which subparagraphs (b), (c) or (d) apply, the decision may be<br>revoked with retroactive effect.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>Powers</p>
<p>1. Subject to review of its decision by the EFTA Court in accordance with<br>Article 108(2) of the EEA Agreement and with the relevant provisions of<br>this Agreement, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have sole power to<br>declare Article 53(1) inapplicable pursuant to Article 53(3) of the EEA<br>Agreement on the conditions set out in Article 56 of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have power to apply Article 53(1)<br>and Article 54 of the EEA Agreement; this power may be exercised notwith-<br>standing that the time-limits specified in Articles 1(1) and 3(2) of<br>Chapter XVI relating to notification have not expired.</p>
<p>3. As long as the EFTA Surveillance Authority has not initiated any<br>procedure under Articles 2, 3 or 6, the authorities of the EFTA States shall<br>remain competent to apply Article 53(1) and Article 54; they shall remain<br>competent in this respect notwithstanding that the time-limits specified in<br>Articles 1(1) and 3(2) of ChapterXVI relating to notification have not ex-<br>pired.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>195</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>Liaison with the authorities of the EFTA States</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall forthwith transmit to the compet-<br>ent authorities of the EFTA States a copy of the applications and notifica-<br>tions together with copies of the most important documents lodgcd with the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority for the purpose of establishing the existence<br>of infringements of Articles 53 or 54 of the EEA Agreement or of obtaining<br>negative clearance or a decision in application of Article 53(3).</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall forthwith transmit to the compet-<br>ent authorities of the EFTA States a copy of notifications, complaints and<br>information on opening of ex officio procedures received from the EC Com-<br>mission pursuant to Articles 2 and 10 of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall forthwith transmit to the compet-<br>ent authorities of the EFTA States a copy of documents received from the<br>EC Commission pursuant to Article 7 of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall carry out the procedure set out<br>in the first subparagraph of paragraph 1 in close and constant liaison with the<br>competent authorities of the EFTA States; such authorities shall have the<br>right to express their views upon that procedure.</p>
<p>3. An Advisory Committee on Competition shall be consulted prior to the<br>taking of any decision following upon a procedure under the first subpara-<br>graph of paragraph 1, and of any decision concerning the rencwal, amend-<br>ment or revocation of a decision pursuant to Article 53(3) of the EEA Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>The Advisory Committee shall be consulted prior to a proposal referred<br>to in Article 22.</p>
<p>4. The Advisory Committee shall be composed of officials competent in the<br>matter of restrictive practices and monopolies. Each EFTA State shall ap-<br>point an official to represent it who, if prevented from attending, may be<br>replaced by another official.</p>
<p>The EC Commission and the EC Member States shall be entitled to be<br>present in the Advisory Committee and to express their views therein. How-<br>ever, their representatives shall not have the right to vote.</p>
<p>5. The consultation shall take place at a joint meeting convened by the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority; such meeting shall be held not earlier than<br>fourteen days after dispatch of the notice convening it. The notice shall, in<br>respect of each case to be examined, be accompanied by a summary of the<br>case together with an indication of the most important documents, and a pre-<br>liminary draft decision.</p>
<p>In view of the participation provided for in the second subparagraph of<br>paragraph 4, the EC Commission shall receive an invitation to the meeting<br>and the relevant information as provided for in Article 6 of Protocol 23 to the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>6. The Advisory Committee may deliver an opinion notwithstanding that</p>
<p>196</p>
<p>some of its members or their alternates are not present. A report of the out-<br>come of the consultative proceedings shall be annexed to the draft decision.<br>It shall not be made public.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>Requests for information</p>
<p>1. In carrying out the duties assigned to it by Articles 55 and 58 of the EEA<br>Agreement, by the provisions set out in Protocol 23 and in Annex XIV to<br>the EEA Agreement or by the provisions of this Chapter, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority may obtain all necessary information from the Governments<br>and competent authorities of the EFTA States and from undertakings and<br>associations of undertakings.</p>
<p>2. When sending a request for information to an undertaking or association<br>of undertakings, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall at the same time for-<br>ward a copy of the request to the competent authority of the EFTA State in<br>whose territory the seat of the undertaking or association of undertakings is<br>situated.</p>
<p>3. In its request the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall State the legal basis<br>and the purpose of the request and also the penalties provided for in<br>Article 15(l)(b) for supplying incorrect information.</p>
<p>4. The owners of the undertakings or their representatives and, in the case<br>of legal persons, companies or firms, or of associations having no legal per-<br>sonality, the persons authorized to represent them by law or by their consti-<br>tution, shall supply the information requested.</p>
<p>5. Where an undertaking or association of undertakings does not supply the<br>information requested within the time-limit fixed by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority, or supplies incomplete information, the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall by decision require the information to be supplied. The de-<br>cision shall specify what information is required, fix an appropriate time-<br>limit within which it is to be supplied and indicate the penalties provided for<br>in Article 15(l)(b) and Article 16(l)(c) and the right to have the decision re-<br>viewed by the EFTA Court in accordance with Article 108(2) of the EEA<br>Agreement and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement, in particular<br>Article 35.</p>
<p>6. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall at the same time forward a copy<br>of its decision to the competent authority of the EFTA State in whose terri-<br>tory the seat of the undertaking or association of undertakings is situated.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>Inquiry into sectors of the economy</p>
<p>1. If in any sector of the economy the trend of trade, price movements, in-<br>flexibility of prices or other circumstances suggest that in the economic sec-<br>tor concerned competition is being restricted or distorted within the territory</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>197</p>
<p>covered by the EEA Agreement, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may de-<br>cide, in accordance with the provisions of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment, to conduct a general inquiry into that economic sector and in the<br>course thereof may request undertakings in the sector concerned to supply<br>the information necessary for giving effect to the principles formulated in<br>Articles 53 and 54 of the EEA Agreement and for carrying out the duties<br>entrusted to the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may in particular request every under-<br>taking or association of undertakings in the economic sector concerned to<br>communicate to it all agreements, decisions and concerted practices which<br>are exempt from notification by virtue of Article 4(2) of this Chapter and<br>Article 1(2) of Chapter XVI.</p>
<p>3. When making inquiries pursuant to paragraph 2, the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall also request undertakings or groups of undertakings whose<br>size suggests that they occupy a dominant position within the territory cov-<br>ered by the EEA Agreement or a substantial part thereof to supply to the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority such particulars of the structure of the under-<br>takings and of their behaviour as are requisite to an appraisal of their posi-<br>tion in the light of Article 54 of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>4. Article 10(3) to (6) and Articles 11,13 and 14 shall apply correspondingly.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>Investigations by the authorities of the EFTA States</p>
<p>1. At the request of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the competent auth-<br>orities of the EFTA States shall undertake the investigations which the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority considers to be necessary under Article 14(1),<br>or which it has ordered by decision pursuant to Article 14(3). The officials of<br>the competent authorities of the EFTA States responsible for conducting<br>these investigations shall exercise their powers upon production of an au-<br>thorization in writing issued by the competent authority of the EFTA State<br>in whose territory the investigation is to be made. Such authorization shall<br>specify the subject matter and purpose of the investigation.</p>
<p>2. If so requested by the EFTA Surveillance Authority or by the competent<br>authority of the EFTA State in whose territory the investigation is to be<br>made, the officials of the EFTA Surveillance Authority may assist the offi-<br>cials of such authority in carrying out their duties.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>Investigating powers of the EFTA Surveillance Authority</p>
<p>1. In carrying out the duties assigned to it by Articles 55 and 58 of the EEA<br>Agreement, by the provisions set out in Protocol 23 and in Annex XIV to<br>the EEAAgreement or by the provisions of this Chapter, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority may undertake all necessary investigations into undertak-<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>198</p>
<p>ings and associations of undertakings in the territory of an EFTA State. To<br>this end the officials authorized by the EFTA Surveillance Authority are em-<br>powered:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;to examine the books and other business records;</p>
<p>(b) to take copies of or extracts from the books and business records;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;to ask for oral explanations on the spot;</p>
<p>(d) to enter any premises, land and means of transport of undertakings.</p>
<p>2. The officials of the EFTA Surveillance Authority authorized for the pur-<br>pose of these investigations shall exercise their powers upon production of<br>an authorization in writing specifying the subject matter and purpose of the<br>investigation and the penalties provided for in Article 15( 1) (c) in cases where<br>production of the required books or other business records is incomplete. In<br>good time before the investigation, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall<br>inform the competent authority of the EFTA State in whose territory the<br>same is to be made of the investigation and of the identity of the authorized<br>officials. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall also provide such an au-<br>thorization to representatives of the EC Commission who shall take part in<br>the investigation in accordance with Article 8(4) of Protocol 23 to the EEA<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>3. Undertakings and associations of undertakings shall submit to investi-<br>gations ordered by decision of the EFTA Surveillance Authority. The de-<br>cision shall specify the subject matter and purpose of the investigation, ap-<br>point the date on which it is to begin and indicate the penalties provided for<br>in Article 15(l)(c) and Article 16(l)(d) and the right to have the decision re-<br>viewed by the EFTA Court in accordance with Article 108(2) of the EEA<br>Agreement and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement, in particular<br>Article 35.</p>
<p>4. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take decisions referred to in<br>paragraph 3 after consultation with the competent authority of the EFTA<br>State in whose territory the investigation is to be made.</p>
<p>5. Officials of the competent authority of the EFTA State in whose territory<br>the investigation is to be made may, at the request of such authority or of the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority, assist the officials of the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority in carrying out their duties.</p>
<p>6. Where an undertaking opposes an investigation ordered pursuant to this<br>Article, the EFTA State concerned shall afford the necessary assistance to<br>the officials authorized by the EFTA Surveillance Authority to enable them<br>to make their investigation.</p>
<p>7. EFTA States shall, after consultation with the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority, take the necessary measures to this end within six months of the entry<br>into force of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>199</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>Fines</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on undertak-<br>ings or associations of undertakings fines of from 100 to 5 000 ECU where,<br>intentionally or negligently:</p>
<p>(a) they supply incorrect or misleading information in an application<br>pursuant to Article 2 or in a notification pursuant to Article 4 of this<br>Chapter or Article 1 of Chapter XVI; or</p>
<p>(b) they supply incorrect information in response to a request made pur-<br>suant to Article 11(3) or (5) or to Article 12, or do not supply in-<br>formation within the time-limit fixed by a decision taken under<br>Article 11(5); or</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;they produce the required books or other business records in incom-<br>plete form during investigations under Article 13 or 14, or refuse to<br>submit to an investigation ordered by decision issued in implementa-<br>tion of Article 14(3).</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on undertak-<br>ings or associations of undertakings fines of from 1 000 to 1000 000 ECU, or<br>a sum in excess thereof but not exceeding 10% of the turnover in the preced-<br>ing business year of each of the undertakings participating in the infringe-<br>ment where, either intentionally or negligently:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;they infringe Article 53(1) or Article 54 of the EEA Agreement; or</p>
<p>(b) they commit a breach of any obligation imposed pursuant to<br>Article 8(1).</p>
<p>In fixing the amount of the fine, regard shall be had both to the gravity and<br>to the duration of the infringement.</p>
<p>3. Article 10(3) to (6) shall apply.</p>
<p>4. Decisions taken pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not be of a criminal<br>law nature.</p>
<p>5. The fines provided for in paragraph 2(a) shall not be imposed in respect<br>of acts taking place:</p>
<p>(a) after notification to the EFTA Surveillance Authority and before its<br>decision in application of Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement, pro-<br>vided they fall within the limits of the activity described in the noti-<br>fication;</p>
<p>(b) before notification and in the course of agreements, decisions or<br>concerted practices in existence at the date of entry into force of the<br>EEAAgreement, provided that notification was effected within the<br>time-limits specified in Articles 1(1) and 3(2) of Chapter XVI.</p>
<p>6. Paragraph 5 shall not have effect where the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>has informed the undertakings concerned that after preliminary examination<br>it is of the opinion that Article 53(1) of the EEAAgreement applies and that<br>application of Article 53(3) is not justified.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>200</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Periodic penalty payments</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on undertak-<br>ings or associations of undertakings periodic penalty payments of from 50 to<br>1 000 ECU per day, calculated from the date appointed by the decision, in<br>order to compel them:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;to put an end to an infringement of Articles 53 or 54 of the EEA<br>Agreement, in accordance with a decision taken pursuant to<br>Article 3 of this Chapter;</p>
<p>(b) to refrain from any act prohibited under Article 8(3);</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;to supply complete and correct information which it has requested<br>by decision taken pursuant to Article 11(5);</p>
<p>(d) to submit to an investigation which it has ordered by decision taken<br>pursuant to Article 14(3).</p>
<p>2. Where the undertakings or associations of undertakings have satisfied the<br>obligation which it was the purpose of the periodic penalty payment to en-<br>force, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may fix the total amount of the peri-<br>odic penalty payment at a lower figure than that which would arise under the<br>original decision.</p>
<p>3. Article 10(3) to (6) shall apply.</p>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>Review by the EFTA Court</p>
<p>The EFTA Court, in accordance with Article 108(2) of the EEA Agreement<br>and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement, shall have unlimited jur-<br>isdiction within the meaning of Article 35 of this Agreement to review de-<br>cisions whereby the EFTA Surveillance Authority has fixed a fine or periodic<br>penalty payment; it may cancel, reduce or increase the fine or periodic pen-<br>alty payment imposed.</p>
<p>Article 18</p>
<p>ECU</p>
<p>For the purposes of applying Articles 15 to 17, ’ECU’ means the ECU as<br>defined by the competent authorities of the European Communities.</p>
<p>Article 19</p>
<p>Hearing of the parties and of third persons</p>
<p>1. Before taking decisions as provided for in Articles 2, 3, 6, 8,15 and 16 of<br>this Chapter and in Article 3 of Chapter XVI, the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority shall give the undertakings or associations of undertakings concerned<br>the opportunity of being heard on the matters to which the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority has taken objection.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>201</p>
<p>2. If the EFTA Surveillance Authority or the competent authorities of the<br>EFTA States consider it necessary, they may also hear other natural or legal<br>persons. Applications to be heard on the part of such persons shall, where<br>they show a sufficient interest, be granted.</p>
<p>3. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority intends to give negative clear-<br>ance pursuant to Article 2 or take a decision in application of Article 53(3)<br>of the EEA Agreement, it shall publish a summary of the relevant applica-<br>tion or notification and invite all interested third parties to submit their ob-<br>servations within a time-limit which it shall fix being not less than one month.<br>Publication shall have regard to the legitimate interest of undertakings in the<br>protection of their business secrets.</p>
<p>Article 20</p>
<p>Professional secrecy</p>
<p>1. Without prejudice to Article 9(3) of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement,<br>information acquired as a result of the application of Articles 11,12, 13 and<br>14 of this Chapter or of Article 58 of the EEA Agreement and Protocol 23<br>thereto shall be used only for the purpose of the relevant request or investi-<br>gation.</p>
<p>2.
