To this end<br>the EFTA States shall, after Consulting the EFTA Surveillance Authority,<br>take the necessary measures within six months of the entry into force of the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>Fines</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on the persons<br>referred to in Article 3(l)(b) of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV<br>to the EEA Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89), undertakings or as-<br>sociations of undertakings fines of from 1 000 to 50 000 ECU where inten-<br>tionally or negligently:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;they fail to notify a concentration in accordance with Article 4 of the<br>said act;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;they supply incorrect or misleading information in a notification pur-<br>suant to Article 4 of the said act;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;they supply incorrect information in response to a request made pur-<br>suant to Article 11 or fail to supply information within the period<br>fixed by a decision taken pursuant to Article 11;</p>
<p>(d) they produce the required books or other business records in incom-<br>plete form during investigations under Article 12 or 13, or refuse to<br>submit to an investigation ordered by decision taken pursuant to<br>Article 13.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose fines not ex-<br>ceeding 10% of the aggregate turnover of the undertakings concerned within<br>the meaning of Article 5 of the said act on the persons or undertakings con-<br>cerned where, either intentionally or negligently, they:</p>
<p>(a) fail to comply with an obligation imposed by decision pursuant to<br>Article 7(4) or 8(2), second subparagraph;</p>
<p>(b) put into effect a concentration in breach of Article 7(1) or disregard<br>a decision taken pursuant to Article 7(2);</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;put into effect a concentration declared incompatible with the func-<br>tioning of the EEA Agreement by decision pursuant to Article 8(3)<br>or do not take the measures ordered by decision pursuant to<br>Article 8(4).</p>
<p>3. In setting the amount of a fine, regard shall be had to the nature and grav-<br>ity of the infringement.</p>
<p>4. Decisions taken pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not be of a criminal<br>law nature.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>262</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>Periodic penalty payments</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on the persons<br>referred to in Article 3(l)(b) of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV<br>to the EEAAgreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89), undertakings or as-<br>sociations of undertakings concerned periodic penalty payments of up to 25<br>000 ECU for each day of delay calculated from the date set in the decision,<br>in order to compel them:</p>
<p>(a) to supply complete and correct information which it has requested<br>by decision pursuant to Article 11;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;to submit to an investigation which it has ordered by decision pursu-<br>ant to Article 13.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may by decision impose on the persons<br>referred to in Article 3(l)(b) of the said act or on undertakings periodic pen-<br>alty payments of up to 100 000 ECU for each day of delay calculated from<br>the date set in the decision, in order to compel them:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;to comply with an obligation imposed by decision pursuant to<br>Article 7(4) or Article 8(2), second subparagraph; or</p>
<p>(b) to apply the measures ordered by decision pursuant to Article 8(4).</p>
<p>3. Where the persons referred to in Article 3(l)(b) of the said act, undertak-<br>ings or associations of undertakings have satisfied the obligation which it was<br>the purpose of the periodic penalty payment to enforce, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority may set the total amount of the periodic penalty payments<br>at a lower figure than that which would arise under the original decision.</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Review by the EFTA Court</p>
<p>The EFTA Court, in accordance with Article 108(2) of the EEA Agreement<br>and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement, shall have unlimited jur-<br>isdiction within the meaning of Article 35 of this Agreement to review de-<br>cisions whereby the EFTA Surveillance Authority has fixed a fine or periodic<br>penalty payments; it may cancel, reduce or inerease the fine or periodic pen-<br>alty payments imposed.</p>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>Professional secrecy</p>
<p>1. Without prejudice to Article 9 of Protocol 24 to the EEAAgreement, in-<br>formation acquired as a result of the application of Articles 57 and 58 of the<br>EEA Agreement, of Protocol 24 to the EEA Agreement and of Articles 11,<br>12, 13 and 18 of this Chapter shall be used only for the purposes of the<br>relevant request, investigation or hearing.</p>
<p>2. Without prejudice to Article 4(3) of the act referred to in point 1 of An-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>263</p>
<p>nex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89) and of<br>Articles 18 and 20 of this Chapter, the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the<br>competent authorities of the EFTA States, their officials and other servants<br>shall not disclose information they have acquired through the application of<br>Protocol 24 to the EEA Agreement, of the said act or of this Chapter of the<br>kind covered by the obligation of professional secrecy.</p>
<p>3. Paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not prevent publication of general information<br>or of surveys which do not contain information relating to particular under-<br>takings or associations of undertakings.</p>
<p>Article 18</p>
<p>Hearing of the parties and of third persons</p>
<p>1. Before taking any decision provided for in Articles 7(2) and (4), 8(2), se-<br>cond subparagraph, and (3) to (5), Articles 14 and 15, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority shall give the persons, undertakings and associations of un-<br>dertakings concerned the opportunity, at every stage of the procedure up to<br>the consultation of the Advisory Committee, of making known their views<br>on the objections against them.</p>
<p>2. By way of derogation from paragraph 1, a decision to continue the sus-<br>pension of a concentration or to grant a derogation from suspension as re-<br>ferred to in Article 7(2) or (4) may be taken provisionally, without the per-<br>sons, undertakings or associations of undertakings concerned being given<br>the opportunity to make known their views beforehand, provided that the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority gives them that opportunity as soon as poss-<br>ible after having taken its decision.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall base its decision only on objec-<br>tions on which the parties have been able to submit their observations. The<br>rights of the defence shall be fully respected in the proceedings. Access to<br>the file shall be open at least to the parties directly involved, subject to the<br>legitimate interest of undertakings in the protection of their business secrets.</p>
<p>4. In so far as the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the competent author-<br>ities of the EFTA States deem it necessary, they may also hear other natural<br>or legal persons. Natural or legal persons showing a sufficient interest and<br>especially members of the administrative or management bodies of the un-<br>dertakings concerned or the recognized representatives of their employees<br>shall be entitled, upon application, to be heard.</p>
<p>Article 19</p>
<p>Liaison with the authorities of the EFTA States</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall transmit to the competent auth-<br>orities of the EFTA States copies of notifications within three working days<br>and, as soon as possible, copies of the most important documents lodged<br>with or issued by the EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to the act re-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>264</p>
<p>ferred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regulation<br>(EEC) No 4064/89) and this Chapter.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall carry out the procedures set out<br>in the said act and in this Chapter in close and constant liaison with the com-<br>petent authorities of the EFTA States, which may express their views upon<br>those procedures. For the purposes of Article 9 it shall obtain information<br>from the competent authority of the EFTA State as referred to in paragraph</p>
<p>2 of that Article and give it the opportunity to make known its views at every<br>stage of the procedure up to the adoption of a decision pursuant to paragraph</p>
<p>3 of that Article; to that end it shall give it access to the file.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall forthwith transmit to the compet-<br>ent authorities of the EFTA States a copy of notifications and information<br>received from the EC Commission pursuant to Articles 3 and 10 of<br>Protocol 24 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall forthwith transmit to the compet-<br>ent authorities of the EFTA States a copy of documents received from the<br>EC Commission pursuant to Article 8 of Protocol 24 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>3. An Advisory Committee on Concentrations shall be consulted before any<br>decision is taken pursuant to Articles 8(2) to (5), 14 or 15, or prior to a pro-<br>posal referred to in Article 23.</p>
<p>4. The Advisory Committee shall consist of representatives of the author-<br>ities of the EFTA States. Each EFTA State shall appoint one or two<br>representatives; if unable to attend, they may be replaced by other<br>representatives. At least one of the representatives of an EFTA State shall<br>be competent in matters of restrictive practices and dominant positions.</p>
<p>5. Consultation shall take place at a joint meeting convened at the invitation<br>of and chaired by the EFTA Surveillance Authority. A summary of the case,<br>together with the most important documents and a preliminary draft of the<br>decision to be taken for each case considered, shall be sent with the invita-<br>tion. The meeting shall take place not less than 14 days after the invitation<br>has been sent. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may in exceptional cases<br>shorten that period as appropriate in order to avoid serious harm to one or<br>more of the undertakings concerned by a concentration.</p>
<p>6. The Advisory Committee shall deliver an opinion on the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority’s draft decision, if necessary by taking a vote. The Advisory<br>Committee may deliver an opinion even if some members are absent and<br>unrepresented. The opinion shall be delivered in writing and appended to<br>the draft decision. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take the utmost<br>account of the opinion delivered by the Committee. It shall inform the Com-<br>mittee of the manner in which its opinion has been taken into account.</p>
<p>7. The Advisory Committee may recommend publication of the opinion.<br>The EFTA Surveillance Authority may carry out such publication. The de-<br>cision to publish shall take due account of the legitimate interest of undertak-<br>ings in the protection of their business secrets and of the interest of the un-<br>dertakings concerned in such publication’s taking place.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>265</p>
<p>Article 20</p>
<p>Publication of decisions</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall publish the decisions which it<br>takes pursuant to Article 8(2) to (5) in the EEA Section of the Official<br>Journal of the European Communities.</p>
<p>2. The publication shall State the names of the parties and the main content<br>of the decision; it shall have regard to the legitimate interest of undertakings<br>in the protection of their business secrets.</p>
<p>Article 21</p>
<p>Jurisdiction</p>
<p>1. Subject to review by the EFTA Court in accordance with Article 108(2)<br>of the EEA Agreement and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement,<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have sole jurisdiction, on the condi-<br>tions set out in Article 58 of the EEA Agreement, to take the decisions pro-<br>vided for in the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA Agree-<br>ment (Regulation No 4064/89) and this Chapter.</p>
<p>2. No EFTA State shall apply its national legislation on competition to any<br>concentration that has an EFTA dimension within the meaning of Article 1<br>of the said act.</p>
<p>The first subparagraph shall be without prejudice to any EFTA State’s<br>power to carry out any enquiries necessary for the application of Article 9(2)<br>or after referral, pursuant to Article 9(3), first subparagraph, indent (b), or<br>(5), to take the measures strictly necessary for the application of Article 9(8).</p>
<p>3. Notwithstanding paragraphs 1 and 2, the EFTA States may take appropri-<br>ate measures to protect legitimate interests other than those taken into con-<br>sideration by the said act and this Chapter and compatible with the general<br>principles and other provisions as provided for, directly or indirectly, under<br>the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Public security, plurality of the media and prudential rules shall be re-<br>garded as legitimate interests within the meaning of the first subparagraph.</p>
<p>Any other public interest must be communicated to the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority by the EFTA State concerned and shall be recognized by the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority after an assessment of its compatibility with<br>the general principles and other provisions as provided for, directly or<br>indirectly, under the EEAAgreement before the measures referred to above<br>may be taken. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall inform the EFTA<br>State concerned of its decision within one month of that communication.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>266</p>
<p>Article 22</p>
<p>Application of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA<br>Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89) and of this Chapter</p>
<p>1. The act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEAAgreement (Re-<br>gulation (EEC) No 4064/89) and this Chapter alone shall apply to concentra-<br>tions as defined in Article 3 of the said act.</p>
<p>2. Chapters II, VI, IX and XI and the acts referred to in points 10 and 11<br>of Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regulations (EEC) No 1017/68 and<br>(EEC) No 4056/86) shall not apply to concentrations as defined in Article 3<br>of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEAAgreement (Regu-<br>lation (EEC) No4064/89).</p>
<p>3. If the EFTA Surveillance Authority finds, at the request of an EFTA<br>State, that a concentration as defined in Article 3 of the said act that has no<br>EFTA dimension within the meaning of Article 1 of the said act creates or<br>strengthens a dominant position as a result of which effective competition<br>would be significantly impeded within the territory of the EFTA State con-<br>cerned it may, in so far as the concentration affects trade between EFTA<br>States, adopt the decisions provided for in Article 8(2), second subpara-<br>graph, (3) and (4).</p>
<p>4. Articles 2(l)(a) and (b), and 5 of the said act and Articles 6, 8 and 10 to<br>20 of this Chapter shall apply. The period within which proceedings may be<br>initiated pursuant to Article 10(1) shall begin on the date of the receipt of<br>the request from the EFTA State. The request must be made within one<br>month at most of the date on which the concentration was made known to<br>the EFTA State or effected. This period shall begin on the date of the first<br>of those events.</p>
<p>5. Pursuant to paragraph 3 the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take only<br>the measures strictly necessary to maintain or restore effective competition<br>within the territory of the EFTA State at the request of which it intervenes.</p>
<p>6. Paragraphs 3 to 5 shall continue to apply until the thresholds referred to<br>in Article 1(2) of the said act have been reviewed.</p>
<p>Article 23</p>
<p>Special provisions</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority may submit to the Governments of the<br>EFTA States, in accordance with the provisions of Article 49 of this Agree-<br>ment, proposals for forms to be used for notifications pursuant to Article 4<br>of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regu-<br>lation (EEC) No 4064/89), as well as proposals for complementary notes to<br>the forms.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>267</p>
<p>Article 24</p>
<p>Relations with countries not party to the EEA Agreement</p>
<p>1. The EFTA States shall inform the EFTA Surveillance Authority of any<br>general difficulties encountered by their undertakings with concentrations as<br>defined in Article 3 of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the<br>EEA Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89) in a country not Party to<br>the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. Initially not more than one year after the entry into force of the EEA<br>Agreement and thereafter periodically the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>shall draw up a report examining the treatment accorded to EFTA undertak-<br>ings, in the terms referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4, as regards concentrations<br>in countries not party to the EEA Agreement. The EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall submit those reports to the Standing Committee, together<br>with any recommendations.</p>
<p>3. Whenever it appears to the EFTA Surveillance Authority, either on the<br>basis of the reports referred to in paragraph 2 or on the basis of other in-<br>formation, that a country not party to the EEA Agreement does not grant<br>EFTA undertakings treatment comparable to that granted by EFTA States<br>to undertakings from that country, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may<br>submit proposals to each of the Governments of the EFTA States with a view<br>to obtaining comparable treatment for EFTA undertakings.</p>
<p>4. Measures taken under this Article shall comply with the obligations of the<br>EFTA States under international agreements, whether bilateral or multilat-<br>eral.</p>
<p>Article 25</p>
<p>(See Article 10 of Chapter XVI)</p>
<p>CHAPTER XIV DETAILED RULES CONCERNING<br>NOTIFICATIONS, TIME LIMITS AND HEARINGS IN<br>THE FIELD OF CONTROL OF CONCENTRATIONS<br>BETWEEN UNDERTAKINGS</p>
<p>SECTION I</p>
<p>NOTIFICATIONS</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Persons entitled to submit notifications</p>
<p>1. Notifications shall be submitted by the persons or undertakings referred<br>to in Article 4(2) of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA<br>Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No 4064/89).</p>
<p>2. Where notifications are signed by representatives of persons or of under-<br>takings, such representatives shall produce written proof that they are au-<br>thorized to act.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>268</p>
<p>3. Joint notifications should be submitted by a joint representative who is<br>authorized to transmit and to receive documents on behalf of all notifying<br>parties.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Submission of notifications</p>
<p>1. Notifications shall be submitted in the manner prescribed in the form<br>issued for this purpose by the Governments of the EFTA States, by common<br>accord, as shown in Appendix 9, or by the EC Commission. Joint notifica-<br>tions shall be submitted on a single form.</p>
<p>2. Nine copies of each notification and of the supporting documents shall be<br>submitted to the EFTA Surveillance Authority at the address indicated in the<br>form as issued by the Governments of the EFTA States, by common accord.</p>
<p>3. The supporting documents shall be either originals or copies of the ori-<br>ginals; in the latter case the notifying parties shall confirm that they are true<br>and complete.</p>
<p>4. Notifications shall be in an official language of an EFTA State or of the<br>Community. If undertakings choose to notify the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority in a language which is not one of the official languages of the States<br>falling within the competence of that Authority, or a working language of<br>that Authority, they shall simultaneously supplement all documentation with<br>a translation into an official language or a working language of that auth-<br>ority. The language which is chosen for the translation shall determine the<br>language in which the undertaking may be addressed by the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority. Supporting documents shall be submitted in their original<br>language. Where the original language is not one of the official languages as<br>referred to above, a translation into the language of the proceeding shall be<br>attached.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Information to be provided</p>
<p>1. Notifications shall contain the information requested by the form as<br>issued by the Governments of the EFTA States, by common accord, or the<br>EC Commission. The information must be correct and complete.</p>
<p>2. Material changes in the facts specified in the notification which the notify-<br>ing parties know or ought to have known must be communicated to the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority voluntarily and without delay.</p>
<p>3. Incorrect or misleading information shall be deemed to be incomplete in-<br>formation.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>269</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Effective date of notifications</p>
<p>1. Subject to paragraph 2, and without prejudice to Article 11 of Protocol 24<br>to the EEA Agreement, notifications shall become effective on the date on<br>which they are received by the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>2. Subject to paragraph 3, where the information contained in the notifica-<br>tion is incomplete in a material respect, the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>shall without delay inform the notifying parties or the joint representative<br>in writing and shall fix an appropriate time-limit for the completion of the<br>information; in such cases, the notification shall become effective on the date<br>on which the complete information is received by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may dispense with the obligation to<br>provide any particular information requested by the form as issued by the<br>Governments of the EFTA States, by common accord, or the EC Commis-<br>sion where the EFTA Surveillance Authority considers that such informa-<br>tion is not necessary for the examination of the case.</p>
<p>4. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall without delay acknowledge in<br>writing to the notifying parties or the joint representative receipt of the noti-<br>fication and of any reply to a letter sent by the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>pursuant to paragraph 2 above.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Conversion of notifications</p>
<p>1. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority finds that the operation notified<br>does not constitute a concentration within the meaning of Article 3 of the act<br>referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regulation<br>(EEC) No4064/89) it shall inform the notifying parties or the joint<br>representative in writing. In such a case, the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>may, if requested by the notifying parties, as appropriate and subject to<br>paragraph 2 below, treat the notification as an application within the mean-<br>ing of Article 2 or a notification within the meaning of Article 4 of Chapter II,<br>as an application within the meaning of Article 12 of Chapter VI, as an ap-<br>plication within the meaning of Article 12 of Chapter IX or as an application<br>within the meaning of Article 3(2) or of Article 5 of Chapter XI.</p>
<p>2. In cases referred to in paragraph 1, second sentence, the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority may require that the information given in the notification be<br>supplemented within an appropriate time-limit fixed by it in so far as this is<br>necessary for assessing the operation on the basis of the above-mentioned<br>Chapters. The application or notification shall be deemed to fulfil the re-<br>quirements of such Chapters from the date of the original notification where<br>the additional information is received by the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>within the time-limit fixed.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>270</p>
<h2>SECTION II</h2>
<p>TIME LIMITS FOR INITIATING PROCEEDINGS AND FOR<br>DECISIONS</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>Beginning of the time-limit</p>
<p>1. The periods referred to in Article 10(1) of Chapter XIII shall start at the<br>beginning of the day following the effective date of the notification, within<br>the meaning of Article 4(1) and (2) of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex<br>XIV to the EEA Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No4064/89).</p>
<p>2. The period referred to in Article 10(3) of Chapter XIII shall start at the<br>beginning of the day following the day on which proceedings were initiated.</p>
<p>3. Where the first day of a period is not a working day within the meaning<br>of Article 19, the period shall start at the beginning of the following working<br>day.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>End of the time-limit</p>
<p>1. The period referred to in the first subparagraph of Article 10(1) of<br>Chapter XIII shall end with the expiry of the day which in the month follow-<br>ing that in which the period began falls on the same date as the day from<br>which the period runs. Where such a day does not occur in that month, the<br>period shall end with the expiry of the last day of that month.</p>
<p>2. The period referred to in the second subparagraph of Article 10(1) of<br>Chapter XIII shall end with the expiry of the day which in the sixth week<br>following that in which the period began is the same day of the week as the<br>day from which the period runs.</p>
<p>3. The period referred to in Article 10(3) of Chapter XIII shall end with the<br>expiry of the day which in the fourth month following that in which the<br>period began falls on the same date as the day from which the period runs.<br>Where such a day does not occur in that month the period shall end with the<br>expiry of the last day of that month.</p>
<p>4. Where the last day of the period is not a working day within the meaning<br>of Article 19, the period shall end with the expiry of the following working<br>day.</p>
<p>5. Paragraphs 1 to 4 above shall be subject to the provisions of Article 8.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>Addition of holidays</p>
<p>Where public holidays or other holidays of the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>as defined in Article 19 fall within the periods referred to in Article 10(1) and<br>in Article 10(3) of ChapterXIII, these periods shall be extended by a<br>corresponding number of days.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>271</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>Suspension of the time-limit</p>
<p>1. The period referred to in Article 10(3) of Chapter XIII shall be suspended<br>where the EFTA Surveillance Authority, pursuant to Articles 11(5) or 13(3)<br>of Chapter XIII, has to take a decision because:</p>
<p>(a) information which the EFTA Surveillance Authority has requested<br>pursuant to Article 11(2) of Chapter XIII from an undertaking in-<br>volved in a concentration is not provided or not provided in full<br>within the time-limit fixed by the EFTA Surveillance Authority;</p>
<p>(b) an undertaking involved in the concentration has refused to submit<br>to an investigation deemed necessary by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority on the basis of Article 13(1) of Chapter XIII or to cooper-<br>ate in the carrying out of such an investigation in accordance with<br>the above-mentioned provision;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;the notifying parties have failed to inform the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority of material changes in the facts specified in the notifica-<br>tion.</p>
<p>2. The period referred to in Article 10(3) of ChapterXIII shall be sus-<br>pended:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;in the cases referred to in subparagraph l(a) above, for the period<br>between the end of the time-limit fixed in the request for informa-<br>tion and the receipt of the complete and correct information re-<br>quired by decision;</p>
<p>(b) in the cases referred to in subparagraph l(b) above, for the period<br>between the unsuccessful attempt to carry out the investigation and<br>the completion of the investigation ordered by decision;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;in the cases referred to in subparagraph l(c) above, for the period<br>between the occurrence of the change in the facts referred to therein<br>and the receipt of the complete and correct information requested<br>by decision or the completion of the investigation ordered by de-<br>cision.</p>
<p>3. The suspension of the time-limit shall begin on the day following that on<br>which the event causing the suspension occurred. It shall end with the expiry<br>of the day on which the reason for suspension is removed. Where such day<br>is not a working day within the meaning of Article 19, the suspension of the<br>time-limit shall end with the expiry of the following working day.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>Compliance with the time-limit</p>
<p>The time limits referred to in Article 10(1) and (3) of Chapter XIII shall be<br>met where the EFTA Surveillance Authority has taken the relevant decision<br>before the end of the period. Notification of the decision to the undertakings<br>concerned must follow without delay.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>272</p>
<h2>SECTION III</h2>
<p>HEARING OF THE PARTIES AND OF THIRD PARTIES</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>Decisions on the suspension of concentrations</p>
<p>1. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority intends to take a decision under<br>Article 7(2) of Chapter XIII or a decision under Article 7(4) of that Chapter<br>which adversely affects the parties, it shall, pursuant to Article 18(1) of that<br>Chapter, inform the parties concerned in writing of its objections and shall<br>fix a time-limit within which they may make known their views.</p>
<p>2. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to Article 18(2) of<br>Chapter XIII has taken a decision referred to in paragraph 1 provisionally<br>without having given the parties concerned the opportunity to make known<br>their views, it shall without delay and in any event before the expiry of the<br>suspension send them the text of the provisional decision and shall fix a time-<br>limit within which they may make known their views.</p>
<p>Once the parties concerned have made known their views, the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority shall take a final decision annulling, amending or con-<br>firming the provisional decision. Where the parties concerned have not<br>made known their view within the time-limit fixed, the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority’s provisional decision shall become final with the expiry of that<br>period.</p>
<p>3. The parties concerned shall make known their views in writing or orally<br>within the time-limit fixed. They may confirm their oral statements in writ-<br>ing.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>Decisions on the substance of the case</p>
<p>1. Where the EFTA Surveillance Authority intends to take a decision pursu-<br>ant to Article 8(2), second subparagraph, Article 8(3), (4) and (5), Article 14<br>or Article 15 of Chapter XIII, it shall, before Consulting the Advisory Com-<br>mittee on Concentrations, hold a hearing of the parties concerned pursuant<br>to Article 18 of that Chapter.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall inform the parties concerned in<br>writing of its objections. The communication shall be addressed to the noti-<br>fying parties or to the joint representative. The EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority shall, when giving notice of objections, fix a time-limit within which<br>the parties concerned may inform the EFTA Surveillance Authority of their<br>views.</p>
<p>3. Having informed the parties of its objections, the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall upon request give the parties concerned access to the file for<br>the purposes of preparing their observations. Documents shall not be access-<br>ible in so far as they contain business secrets of other parties concerned or of<br>third parties, or other confidential information including sensitive commer-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>273</p>
<p>18 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<p>cial information the disclosure of which would have a significant adverse ef-<br>fect on the supplier of such information or where they are internal docu-<br>ments of the authorities.</p>
<p>4. The parties concerned shall, within the time-limit fixed, make known in<br>writing their views on the EFTA Surveillance Authority’s objections. They<br>may in their written comments set out all the matters relevant to the case and<br>may attach any relevant documents in proof of the facts set out. They may<br>also propose that the EFTA Surveillance Authority hear persons who may<br>corroborate those facts.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>Oral hearings</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall afford parties concerned who<br>have so requested in their written comments the opportunity to put forward<br>their arguments orally, if those persons show a sufficient interest or if the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority proposes to impose a fine or periodic penalty<br>payment on them. It may also in other cases afford the parties concerned the<br>opportunity of expressing their views orally.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall summon the persons to be heard<br>to attend on such date as it shall appoint.</p>
<p>3. It shall forthwith transmit a copy of the summons to the competent auth-<br>orities of the EFTA States, who may appoint an official to take part in the<br>hearing.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>Hearings</p>
<p>1. Hearings shall be conducted by persons appointed by the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority for that purpose.</p>
<p>2. Persons summoned to attend shall either appear in person or be<br>represented by legal representatives or representatives authorized by their<br>constitution. Undertakings and associations of undertakings may be<br>represented by a duly authorized agent appointed from among their perman-<br>ent staff.</p>
<p>3. Persons heard by the EFTA Surveillance Authority may be assisted by<br>lawyers or advisers who are entitled to plead before the EFTA Court, or by<br>other qualified persons.</p>
<p>4. Hearings shall not be public. Persons shall be heard separately or in the<br>presence of other persons summoned to attend. In the latter case, regard<br>shall be had to the legitimate interest of the undertakings in the protection<br>of their business secrets.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>5. The statements made by each person heard shall be recorded.</p>
<p>274</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>Hearing of third parties</p>
<p>1. If natural or legal persons showing a sufficient interest, and especially<br>members of the administrative or management organs of the undertakings<br>concerned or recognized workers’ representatives of those undertakings, ap-<br>ply in writing to be heard pursuant to the second sentence of Article 18(4) of<br>Chapter XIII, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall inform them in writing<br>of the nature and subject matter of the procedure and shall fix a time-limit<br>within which they may make known their views.</p>
<p>2. The third parties referred to in paragraph 1 above shall make known their<br>views in writing or orally within the time-limit fixed. They may confirm their<br>oral statements in writing.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may likewise afford to any other third<br>parties the opportunity of expressing their views.</p>
<h2>SECTION IV</h2>
<p>MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Transmission of documents</p>
<p>1. Transmission of documents and summonses from the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority to the addressees may be effected in any of the following ways:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;delivery by hand against receipt;</p>
<p>(b) registered letter with acknowledgement of receipt;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;telefax with a request for acknowledgement of receipt;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;telex.</p>
<p>2. Subject to Article 18(1), paragraph 1 above also applies to the transmis-<br>sion of documents from the parties concerned or from third parties to the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>3. Where a document is sent by telex or by telefax, it shall be presumed that<br>it has been received by the addressee on the day on which it was sent.</p>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>Setting of time limits</p>
<p>1. In fixing the time limits provided for in Articles 4(2), 5(2), 11(1) and (2),<br>12(2) and 15(1), the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have regard to the<br>time required for preparation of statements and to the urgency of the case.<br>It shall also take account of public holidays in the country of receipt of the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority’s communication.</p>
<p>2. The day on which the addressee received a communication shall not be<br>taken into account for the purpose of fixing time limits.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>275</p>
<p>Article 18</p>
<p>Receipt of documents by the EFTA Surveillance Authority</p>
<p>1. Subject to Article 4(1), notifications must be delivered to the EFTA Sur-<br>veillance Authority at the address indicated in the form as issued by the Gov-<br>ernments of the EFTA States, by common accord, or the EC Commission or<br>have been dispatched by registered letter before expiry of the period re-<br>ferred to in Article 4(1) of the act referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the<br>EEA Agreement (Regulation (EEC) No4064/89). Additional information<br>requested to complete notifications pursuant to Article 4(2) or to supple-<br>ment notifications pursuant to Article 5(2) of the said act must reach the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority at the aforesaid address or have been dispat-<br>ched by registered letter before the expiry of the time-limit fixed in each<br>case. Written comments on EFTA Surveillance Authority Communications<br>pursuant to Articles 11(1) and (2), 12(2) and 15(1) must be delivered to the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority at the aforesaid address before the time-limit<br>fixed in each case.</p>
<p>2. Where the last day of a period referred to in paragraph 1 is a day by which<br>documents must be received and that day is not a working day within the<br>meaning of Article 19, the period shall end with the expiry of the following<br>working day.</p>
<p>3. Where the last day of a period referred to in paragraph 1 is a day by which<br>documents must be dispatched and that day is a Saturday, Sunday or public<br>holiday in the country of dispatch, the period shall end with the expiry of the<br>following working day in that country.</p>
<p>Article 19</p>
<p>Definition of EFTA Surveillance Authority working days</p>
<p>The term 'working days’ in Articles 6(3), 7(4), 9(3) and 18(2) means all days<br>other than Saturdays, Sundays, public holidays set out in Appendix 10 to this<br>Protocol and other holidays as determined by the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority and published in the EEA Section of the Official Journal of the Euro-<br>pean Communities before the beginning of each year.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>276</p>
<p>PART IV COAL AND STEEL</p>
<h2>CHAPTER XV RULES APPLICABLE TO<br>UNDERTAKINGS IN THE FIELD OF COAL AND<br>STEEL</h2>
<h2>SECTION I GENERAL RULES REGARDING<br>AGREEMENTS AND CONCENTRATIONS</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. Authorizations pursuant to Article 1(2) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment may be granted subject to specified conditions and for limited periods.<br>In such cases the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall renew an authorization<br>once or several times if it finds that the requirements of subparagraphs (a)<br>to (c) of Article 1(2) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement are still met at<br>the time of renewal.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall revoke or amend an authoriza-<br>tion if it finds that as a result of a change in circumstances the agreement no<br>longer meets these requirements, or that the aetual results of the agreement<br>or of the application thereof are contraiy to the requirements for its author-<br>ization.</p>
<p>3. Decisions granting, renewing, amending, refusing or revoking an author-<br>ization shall be published together with the reasons therefor; the restrictions<br>imposed by Article 3(2) shall not apply thereto.</p>
<p>4. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may, as provided in Article 3, obtain<br>any information needed for the application of Article 1 of Protocol 25 to the<br>EEA Agreement and of this Article, either by making a special request to<br>the parties concerned or by means of decisions stating the kinds of agree-<br>ment, decision or practice which must be communicated to it.</p>
<p>5. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have sole jurisdiction, subject to<br>the right to bring actions before the EFTA Court in accordance with<br>Article 108(2) of the EEA Agreement and with the relevant provisions of<br>this Agreement and, on the conditions set out in Article 55 of the EEA<br>Agreement and Protocols 22 and 25 thereto, to rule whether any such agree-<br>ment or decision is compatible with Article 1 of Protocol 25 to the EEA<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>6. On any undertaking which has entered into an agreement which is auto-<br>matically void pursuant to Article 1(3) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment, or has enforced or attempted to enforce, by arbitration, penalty, boy-<br>cott or any other means, an agreement or decision which is automatically<br>void or an agreement for which authorization has been refused or revoked,<br>or has obtained an authorization by means of information which it knew to<br>be false or misleading, or has engaged in practices prohibited by Article 1(1)<br>of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement, the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>may impose fines or periodic penalty payments not exceeding twice the turn-<br>over on the products which were the subject of the agreement, decision or</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>277</p>
<p>practice prohibited by Article 1(1) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement;<br>if, however, the purpose of the agreement, decision or practice is to restrict<br>production, technical development or investment, this maximum may be<br>raised to 10% of the annual turnover of the undertakings in question in the<br>case of fines, and 20% of the daily turnover in the case of periodic penalty<br>payments.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. In assessing whether the requirements of Article 2(2) of Protocol 25 to the<br>EEA Agreement are met, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, in accord-<br>ance with the principle of non-discrimination, take account of the size of like<br>undertakings in the territory covered by the EEA Agreement, to the extent<br>it considers justified in order to avoid or correct disadvantages resulting from<br>unequal competitive conditions.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may make its authorization subject to<br>any conditions which it considers appropriate for the purposes of Article 2(2)<br>of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>3. Before ruling on a transaction concerning undertakings at least one of<br>which is not subject to Article 3 of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement, the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority shall obtain the comments of the Govern-<br>ments concerned.</p>
<p>4. Without prejudice to the application of Article 3 to undertakings within<br>its jurisdiction, the EFTA Surveillance Authority may obtain from the nat-<br>ural or legal persons who have acquired or regrouped or are intending to<br>acquire or regroup the rights or assets in question any information needed<br>for the application of Article 2 of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement and<br>of the present Article concerning transactions liable to produce the effect<br>referred to in Article 2(1) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>5. If a concentration should occur which the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>finds has been effected contrary to the provisions of Article 2(1) of<br>Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement but which nevertheless meets the re-<br>quirements of Article 2(2) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement, the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority shall make its approval of that concentration subject<br>to payment by the persons who have acquired or regrouped the rights or as-<br>sets in question of the fine provided for in paragraph 12(b); the amount of<br>the fine shall not be less than half of the maximum determined in that subpar-<br>agraph (b) should it be clear that authorization ought to have been applied<br>for. If the fine is not paid, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take the<br>steps hereinafter provided for in respect of concentrations found to be un-<br>lawful.</p>
<p>6. If a concentration should occur which the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>finds cannot fulfil the general or specific conditions to which an authorization<br>under Article 2(2) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement would be subject,<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall, by means of a reasoned decision,</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>278</p>
<p>declare the concentration unlawful and, after giving the parties concerned<br>the opportunity to submit their comments, shall order separation of the un-<br>dertakings or assets improperly concentrated or cessation of joint control,<br>and any other measures which it considers appropriate to return the under-<br>takings or assets in question to independent operation and restore normal<br>conditions of competition. Any person directly concerned may institute pro-<br>ceedings against such decisions, as provided in Articles 108(2)(b) of the EEA<br>Agreement and 18 of the present Agreement. The EFTA Court, in accord-<br>ance with Article 108(2) of the EEAAgreement and with the relevant provi-<br>sions of this Agreement, shall have unlimited jurisdiction to assess whether<br>the transaction effected is a concentration within the meaning of Article 2(1)<br>of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement and of the acts concerning coal and<br>Steel as contained in Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement. The institution of<br>proceedings shall have suspensory effect. Proceedings may not be instituted<br>until the measures provided for above have been ordered, unless the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority agrees to the institution of separate proceedings<br>against the decision declaring the transaction unlawful.</p>
<p>7. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may at any time, unless Article 41 of<br>this Agreement is applied, take or cause to be taken such interim measures<br>of protection as it may consider necessary to safeguard the interests of com-<br>peting undertakings and of third parties, and to föreställ any step which<br>might hinder the implementation of its decisions. Unless the EFTA Court<br>decides otherwise, proceedings shall not have suspensory effect in respect of<br>such interim measures.</p>
<p>8. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall allow the parties concerned a<br>reasonable period in which to comply with its decisions, on expiration of<br>which it may impose daily penalty payments not exceeding one-tenth of 1%<br>of the value of the rights or assets in question.</p>
<p>9. Furthermore, if the parties concerned do not fulfil their obligations, the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority shall itself take steps to implement its de-<br>cision.</p>
<p>10. The EFTA Surveillance Authority is also empowered to make such re-<br>commendations to the EFTA States concerned as may be necessary to ensure<br>that the measures provided for in the preceding paragraphs are implemented<br>under their own law.</p>
<p>11. In the exercise of its powers, the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall take<br>account of the rights of third parties which have been acquired in good faith.</p>
<p>12. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may impose fines not exceeding:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;3% of the value of the assets acquired or regrouped or to be acquired<br>or regrouped, on natural or legal persons who have evaded the ob-<br>ligations laid down in paragraph 4;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;10% of the value of the assets acquired or regrouped, on natural or<br>legal persons who have evaded the obligations laid down in<br>Article 2(1) of Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement; this maximum<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>279</p>
<p>shall be increased by one twenty-fourth for each month which<br>elapses after the end of the twelfth month following completion of<br>the transaction until the EFTA Surveillance Authority establishes<br>that there has been an infringement;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;10% of the value of the assets acquired or regrouped or to be ac-<br>quired or regrouped, on natural or legal persons who have obtained<br>or attempted to obtain authorization under Article 2(2) of<br>Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement by means of false or misleading<br>information;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;15% of the value of the assets acquired or regrouped, on undertak-<br>ings within its jurisdiction which have engaged in or been party to<br>transactions contrary to the provisions of Article 2 of Protocol 25 to<br>the EEA Agreement or of the present Article.</p>
<p>13. Persons fined under paragraph 12 may appeal to the EFTA Court as pro-<br>vided in Article 35 of this Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may obtain the information it requires<br>to carry out its tasks. It may have any necessary checks made.</p>
<p>2. Without prejudice to Article 9 of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement, the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority must not disclose information acquired as a<br>result of the application of Articles 55 and 58 of the EEA Agreement, of<br>Protocol 25 thereto and of the provisions of this Chapter and which is of the<br>kind covered by the obligation of professional secrecy, in particular informa-<br>tion about undertakings, their business relations or their cost components.<br>This obligation shall also apply to the representatives of the EC Commission<br>and of the EC Member States who participate in the Advisory Committee<br>pursuant to Article 10(4) of Chapter II and in the hearing pursuant to<br>Article 8(2) of Chapter IV.</p>
<p>Subject to this reservation, it shall publish such data as could be useful to<br>governments or to any other parties concerned.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may impose fines or periodic penalty<br>payments on undertakings which evade their obligations under decisions<br>taken in pursuance of this Article or which knowingly furnish false informa-<br>tion. The maximum amount of such fines shall be 1% of the annual turnover,<br>and the maximum amount of such penalty payments shall be 5% of the aver-<br>age daily turnover for each day’s delay.</p>
<p>4. Any breach of professional secrecy by the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>which has caused damage to an undertaking may be the subject of an action<br>for compensation before the EFTA Court in accordance with Article 108(2)<br>of the EEA Agreement and with the relevant provisions of this Agreement,<br>in particular Article 39.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>280</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Before imposing a pecuniary sanction or ordering a periodic penalty pay-<br>ment as provided for in this Chapter, the EFTA Surveillance Authority must<br>give the party concerned the opportunity to submit its comments.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>The turnover taken as the basis for calculating any fines and periodic penalty<br>payments imposed on undertakings under this Chapter shall be the turnover<br>on products referred to in Protocol 14 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<h2>SECTION II INFORMATION TO BE FURNISHED<br>(ARTICLE 2(4) OF SECTION I)</h2>
<h2>PART ONE</h2>
<p>Compulsory notification</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>All natural and legal persons except persons engaged within the territory co-<br>vered by the EEA Agreement in the production of coal and Steel or in the<br>distribution of those products other than by way of sale to domestic con-<br>sumers or small craft industries shall, where they effect transactions specified<br>in the following Articles, furnish information as provided for in this Section.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>The persons referred to in Article 1 shall notify the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority of any acquisition of rights in an undertaking covered by Article 3 of<br>Protocol 25 to the EEA Agreement and any acquisition of power to exercise<br>on their own behalf or on behalf of third parties rights in any such undertak-<br>ing, whereby they acquire more than 10% of the voting power at meetings<br>of shareholders or other members of such undertaking and where the total<br>value of the rights held by them exceeds 100000 ECU. Any rights, or power<br>to exercise rights on behalf of others, held by the persons concerned before<br>the transaction in question shall be included in that calculation.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Article 1 shall also apply to the acquisition of rights in any undertaking which<br>exercises control over an undertaking covered by Article 3 of Protocol 25 to<br>the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>1. Banks and their agents shall be exempt from the obligation to notify the<br>transactions mentioned in Articles 2 and 3 where exercise of voting rights<br>attachés:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>281</p>
<p>to shares belonging to customers of those or other banks; or</p>
<p>- to registered shares or stock in respect of which the bank is entitled<br>to exercise such rights in a fiduciary capacity on behalf of its clients.</p>
<p>2. Paragraph 1 shall not affect:</p>
<p>the obligation for banks to furnish information on such transactions<br>under Article 7;</p>
<p>the obligation for their customers to notify such transactions in ac-<br>cordance with Articles 2 and 3 or to furnish information under<br>Article 7.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority may, by special authorization and subject<br>to certain conditions, grant exemption from the obligation to notify the<br>transactions mentioned in Articles 2 and 3 to duly accredited stockbrokers<br>where they do not exercise the voting rights attaching to the stock held by<br>them.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>The notification provided for in Articles 2 and 3 shall be made within four<br>weeks from the date on which the person required to make notification has<br>knowledge of the transaction in question.</p>
<h2>PART TWO</h2>
<p>Special requests for information</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority may, by special request, obtain from<br>the persons mentioned in Article 1 all information necessary for the imple-<br>mentation of Article 2 of Section I regarding:</p>
<p>(1) &nbsp;acquisition of ownership of or of rights to use premises, industrial<br>plant or concessions of any undertaking if, before such acquisition,<br>those premises, plant or concessions were used in the operations of<br>that undertaking;</p>
<p>(2) &nbsp;acquisition of rights, in an undertaking, conferring voting powers at<br>meetings of shareholders or other members of such undertaking;</p>
<p>(3) &nbsp;acquisition of the power to exercise on their own behalf or on behalf<br>of third parties rights of the kind referred to in subparagraph (2) be-<br>longing to third parties;</p>
<p>(4) &nbsp;acquisition by contract of the power to make decisions as to how the<br>profits of an undertaking are shown in the accounts or applied;</p>
<p>(5) &nbsp;acquisition of the power to participate in the management of an un-<br>dertaking, alone or with others, whether as owner, beneficiary, man-<br>ager or member of the managing organs;</p>
<p>(6) &nbsp;appointment to the Board of Directors of an undertaking.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>282</p>
<p>2. The persons subject to the obligation to furnish information must likewise<br>declare to the EFTA Surveillance Authority at the latter’s request the name<br>and address of the actual owner of the rights concerned, where they are em-<br>powered:</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;to exercise the rights referred to in paragraph 1 in a fiduciary capa-<br>city on behalf of a third party;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;to exercise on their own behalf or on behalf of third parties the rights<br>referred to in paragraph 1 belonging to third parties.</p>
<p>SECTION III LIMITATION PERIODS IN<br>PROCEEDINGS AND THE ENFORCEMENT OF<br>SANCTIONS UNDER PROTOCOL 25 TO THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT AND THE PRESENT CHAPTER</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Limitation periods in proceedings</p>
<p>1. The power of the EFTA Surveillance Authority to impose fines for in-<br>fringements of the provisions of Articles 53 and 54 of the EEA Agreement<br>and Protocol 25 thereto or of the provisions contained in this Chapter shall<br>be subject to a limitation period:</p>
<p>(a) of three years in the case of infringements of provisions concerning<br>applications or Communications of the parties, requests for informa-<br>tion, or the carrying out of investigations;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;of five years in the case of all other infringements.</p>
<p>2. Time shall begin to run upon the day on which the infringement is com-<br>mitted. However, in the case of continuing or repeated infringements, time<br>shall begin to run upon the day on which the infringement ceases.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Interruption of the limitation period in proceedings</p>
<p>1. Any action taken by the EFTA Surveillance Authority for the purpose of<br>the preliminary investigation or proceedings in respect of an infringement<br>shall interrupt the limitation period in proceedings. The limitation period<br>shall be interrupted with effect from the date on which the action is notified<br>to at least one party which has participated in the infringement.</p>
<p>Actions which interrupt the running of the period shall include in particu-<br>lar the following:</p>
<p>(a) written requests for information by the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority or decisions by the EFTA Surveillance Authority requiring the<br>requested information;</p>
<p>(b) written authorizations to carry out investigations issued to their offi-<br>cials by the EFTA Surveillance Authority or a decision by the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority ordering an investigation;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;the commencement of proceedings by the EFTA Surveillance Auth-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>283</p>
<p>ority;</p>
<p>(d) notification by the EFTA Surveillance Authority of a letter giving<br>the party concerned the opportunity to submit its comments, pursu-<br>ant to Article 4 of Section I.</p>
<p>2. The interruption of the limitation period shall apply for all parties which<br>have participated in the infringement.</p>
<p>3. Each interruption shall start time running afresh. However, the limitation<br>period shall expire at the latest on the day on which a period equal to twice<br>the limitation period has elapsed without the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>having imposed a fine or a penalty; that period shall be extended by the time<br>during which limitation is suspended pursuant to Article 3.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Suspension of the limitation period in proceedings</p>
<p>The limitation period in proceedings shall be suspended for as long as the<br>decision of the EFTA Surveillance Authority is the subject of proceedings<br>pending before the EFTA Court.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Limitation period for the enforcement of sanctions</p>
<p>1. The power of the EFTA Surveillance Authority to enforce decisions im-<br>posing fines or periodic payments for infringements of the provisions of the<br>EEA Agreement or of provisions made for its implementation shall be sub-<br>ject to a limitation period of five years.</p>
<p>2. Time shall begin to run upon the day on which the decision becomes final.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Interruption of the limitation period for the enforcement of sanctions</p>
<p>1. The limitation period for the enforcement of sanctions shall be inter-<br>rupted:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;by notification of a decision varying the original amount of the fine<br>or periodic penalty payments or refusing an application for vari-<br>ation;</p>
<p>(b) by any action of the EFTA Surveillance Authority or of an EFTA<br>State at the request of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, for the pur-<br>pose of enforcing payments of a fine or periodic penalty payment.</p>
<p>2. Each interruption shall start time running afresh.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>Suspension of the limitation period for the enforcement of sanctions</p>
<p>The limitation period for the enforcement of sanctions shall be suspended<br>for so long as:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>284</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;time to pay is allowed; or</p>
<p>(b) enforcement of payment is suspended pursuant to a decision of the<br>EFTA Court.</p>
<p>SECTION IV POWERS OF OFFICIALS AND</p>
<p>AGENTS OF THE EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY<br>INSTRUCTED TO CARRY OUT THE CHECKS<br>PROVIDED FOR IN PROTOCOL 25 TO THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT AND IN THIS CHAPTER</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. Officials and agents of the EFTA Surveillance Authority instructed to<br>carry out the checks on undertakings provided for in Protocol 25 and Annex<br>XIV to the EEAAgreement and in the provisions of this Chapter, in particu-<br>lar Article 3(1) of Section I, are hereby empowered:</p>
<p>(a) to examine books and business records to the extent necessary for<br>the purpose of the check, including records held in automated sys-<br>tems of any kind, wherever such books or business records are kept;</p>
<p>(b) to take copies or photocopies of or extracts from the books and busi-<br>ness records, including data stored in automated systems of any<br>kind;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;to require oral explanations on the spot;</p>
<p>(d) to enter any premises, land or means of transport of undertakings,<br>and of any third party with whom books or business records have<br>been deposited, and in so doing to have sight of the said books and<br>business records so as to be able to select all those that are relevant<br>and are to be produced for inspection.</p>
<p>2. Forthcoming visits of inspection and the status of the officials shall be duly<br>notified to the State concerned. Officials of that State may, at its request or<br>at that of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, assist the officials of the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority in the performance of their tasks.</p>
<p>3. Undertakings shall assist officials and agents of the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority in carrying out their duties.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Officials and agents of the EFTA Surveillance Authority instructed to carry<br>out checks shall exercise their powers upon production of an authorization<br>in writing specifying the purpose of the check. The EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority shall also provide such an authorization to representatives of the EC<br>Commission who shall take part in the investigation in accordance with<br>Article 8(4) of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Undertakings shall comply with the obligations imposed by Article 1 of this<br>Section without an individual decision being required for that purpose, fail-</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>285</p>
<p>ure to do so rendering them liable to the fines and penalties provided for in Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<table border="1">
<tr><td>
<p>Article 3(3) of Section I.</p></td><td>
<p>Bilaga 16<br>ESA/Court<br>Agreement<br>Protocol4</p></td></tr>
</table>
<p>286</p>
<h1>PART V TRANSITIONAL AND OTHER</h1>
<h1>RULES</h1>
<h2>CHAPTER XVI TRANSITIONAL AND OTHER<br>RULES</h2>
<h2>SECTION I RULES APPLICABLE TO CHAPTERS II<br>TO XII AND XV</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>Notification of existing agreements, decisions and practices</p>
<p>1. Agreements, decisions and concerted practices of the kind described in<br>Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement which are in existence at the date of<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement and in respect of which the parties<br>seek application of Article 53(3) of the EEAAgreement shall be notified to<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to the provisions in Article 56 of<br>the EEA Agreement, the rules referred to in Articles 1 to 3 of Protocol 21<br>and Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement, as well as Chapters III, VI, VII, IX,<br>X, XI, XII and XV, within six months of the date of entry into force of the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>2. Paragraph 1 shall not apply to agreements, decisions or concerted prac-<br>tices of the kind described in Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement and falling<br>under Article 4(2) of Chapter II; these may be notified to the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority pursuant to Article 56 of the EEA Agreement, the rules re-<br>ferred to in Articles 1 to 3 of Protocol 21 and Protocol 23 to the EEA Agree-<br>ment, as well as Chapters III, VI, VII, IX, X, XI, XII and XV.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Decisions pursuant to Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement</p>
<p>1. Whenever the EFTA Surveillance Authority takes a decision pursuant to<br>Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement, it shall specify therein the date from<br>which the decision shall take effect. Such date shall not be earlier than the<br>date of notification.</p>
<p>2. The second sentence of paragraph 1 shall not apply to agreements, de-<br>cisions or concerted practices falling within Article 4(2) of Chapter II and<br>Article 1(2) of this Chapter, nor to those falling within Article 1(1) which<br>have been notified within the time-limit specified in Article 1(1).</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Special provisions for existing agreements, decisions and practices</p>
<p>1. Where agreements, decisions or concerted practices of the kind described<br>in Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement which are in existence at the date of<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement and notified within the time limits<br>specified in Article 1(1) of this Chapter do not satisfy the requirements of<br>Article 53(3) of the EEA Agreement and the undertakings or associations of<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>287</p>
<p>undertakings concerned cease to give effect to them or modify them in such<br>a manner that they no longer fall under the prohibition contained in<br>Article 53(1) or that they satisfy the requirements of Article53(3), the pro-<br>hibition contained in Article 53(1) shall apply only for a period fixed by the<br>EFTA Surveillance Authority. A decision by the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority pursuant to the foregoing sentence shall not apply as against undertak-<br>ings and associations of undertakings which did not expressly consent to the<br>notification.</p>
<p>2. Paragraph 1 shall apply to agreements, decisions or concerted practices<br>falling under Article 4(2) of Chapter II which are in existence at the date of<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement if they are notified within six months<br>after that date.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Applications and notifications submitted to the EC Commission prior to the<br>date of entry into force of the EEA Agreement shall be deemed to comply<br>with the provisions on application and notification under that Agreement.</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority pursuant to Article 56 of the EEA<br>Agreement and Article 10 of Protocol 23 to the EEA Agreement may re-<br>quire a duly completed form as prescribed for the implementation of the<br>EEA Agreement to be submitted to it within such time as it shall appoint.<br>In that event, applications and notifications shall be treated as properly<br>made only if the forms are submitted within the prescribed period and in<br>accordance with the provisions of the EEA Agreement and of Chapters II,<br>III, V, VII, X, XII and XV of this Protocol.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Fines</p>
<p>Fines for infringement of Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement shall not be<br>imposed in respect of any act prior to notification of the agreements, de-<br>cisions and concerted practices to which Articles 1 and 2 of this Chapter ap-<br>ply and which have been notified within the period specified therein.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>The EFTA States shall ensure that the measures affording the necessary as-<br>sistance to officials of the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the EC Commis-<br>sion, in order to enable them to make their investigations as foreseen under<br>the Agreement, are taken within six months of the entry into force of the<br>EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>As regards agreements, decisions and concerted practices already in exist-<br>ence at the date of entry into force of the EEA Agreement which fall under<br>Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement, the prohibition in Article 53(1) shall<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>288</p>
<p>not apply where the agreements, decisions or practices are modified within<br>six months from the date of entry into force of the EEA Agreement so as to<br>fulfil the conditions contained in the block exemptions provided for in<br>Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>As regards agreements, decisions of associations of undertakings and<br>concerted practices already in existence at the date of entry into force of the<br>EEA Agreement which fall under Article 53(1) of the EEA Agreement, the<br>prohibition in Article53(1) shall not apply, from the date of entry into force<br>of the Agreement, where the agreements, decisions or practices are modi-<br>fied within six months from the date of entry into force of the EEA Agree-<br>ment so as not to fall under the prohibition of Article 53(1) any more.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>Agreements, decisions of associations of undertakings and concerted prac-<br>tices which benefit from an individual exemption granted under Article 85(3)<br>of the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community before the<br>entry into force of the EEA Agreement shall continue to be exempted as<br>regards the provisions of the EEA Agreement, until their date of expiry as<br>provided for in the decisions granting these exemptions or until the EC Com-<br>mission otherwise decides, whichever date is the earlier.</p>
<h2>SECTION II RULES APPLICABLE TO<br>CHAPTERS XIII AND XIV</h2>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>The act as referred to in point 1 of Annex XIV to the EEA Agreement (Re-<br>gulation (EEC) No 4064/89) and Chapter XIII shall not apply to any concen-<br>tration which was the subject of an agreement or announcement or where<br>control was acquired within the meaning of Article 4(1) of the said act before<br>the entry into force of the EEA Agreement and they shall not in any circum-<br>stances apply to any concentration in respect of which proceedings were initi-<br>ated before that date by an EFTA State’s authority with responsibility for<br>competition.</p>
<p>19 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 samt. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 4</p>
<p>289</p>
<h2>APPENDICES</h2>
<p>(•••)</p>
<p>APPENDIX 7</p>
<p>LIST OF CERTAIN TECHNICAL AGREEMENTS IN THE AIR<br>TRANSPORT</p>
<p>SECTOR REFERRED TO IN ARTICLE 2 OF CHAPTERXI</p>
<p>(a) The introduetion or uniform application of mandatory or recom-<br>mended technical standards for aircraft, aircraft parts, equipment<br>and aircraft supplies, where such standards are set by an organiza-<br>tion normally accorded international recognition, or by an aircraft<br>or equipment manufacturer;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;the introduetion or uniform application of technical standards for<br>fixed installations for aircraft, where such standards are set by an<br>organization normally accorded international recognition;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;the exchange, leasing, pooling, or maintenance of aircraft, aircraft<br>parts, equipment or fixed installations for the purpose of operating<br>air services and the joint purchase of aircraft parts, provided that<br>such arrangements are made on a non-discriminatory basis;</p>
<p>(d) the introduetion, operation and maintenance of technical<br>communication networks, provided that such arrangements are<br>made on a non-discriminatory basis;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;the exchange, pooling or training of personnel for technical or op-<br>erational purposes;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;the organization and execution of substitute transport operations for<br>passengers, mail and baggage, in the event of breakdown/delay of<br>aircraft, either under charter or by provision of substitute aircraft<br>under contractual arrangements;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;the organization and execution of successive or supplementary air<br>transport operations, and the fixing and application of inclusive<br>rates and conditions for such operations;</p>
<p>(h) the consolidation of individual consignments;</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;the establishment or application of uniform rules concerning the<br>structure and the conditions governing the application of transport<br>tariffs, provided that such rules do not directly or indirectly fix trans-<br>port fares and conditions;</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;arrangements as to the sale, endorsement and acceptance of tickets<br>between air carriers (interlining) as well as the refund, pro-rating<br>and accounting schemes established for such purposes;</p>
<p>(k) the clearing and settling of accounts between air carriers by means<br>of a clearing house, including such services as may be necessary or<br>incidental thereto; the clearing and settling of accounts between air<br>carriers and their appointed agents by means of a centralized and<br>automated settlement plan or system, including such services as may<br>be necessary or incidental thereto.</p>
<p>(...)</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol4</p>
<p>290</p>
<table border="1">
<tr><td>
<p>PROTOCOL 5</p></td><td>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p></td></tr>
<tr><td>
<p>ON THE STATUTE OF THE EFTA COURT</p></td><td>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p></td></tr>
<tr><td>
<p>Article 1</p></td><td>
<p>Agreement</p></td></tr>
<tr><td>
<p>The EFTA Court established by Article 27 of this Agreement shall be consti-<br>tuted and function in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and<br>of this Statute.</p></td><td>
<p>Protocol5</p></td></tr>
</table>
<h2>PARTI</h2>
<p>JUDGES</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>Before taking up his duties each Judge shall, in open court, take an oath to<br>perform his duties impartially and conscientiously and to preserve the se-<br>crecy of the deliberations of the Court.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>Immediately after the oath has been taken, the Court shall proceed to choose<br>by lot the Judges of the Court whose terms of office are to expire at the end<br>of the first three years in accordance with Article 30 of the Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>The Judges may not hold any political or administrative office.</p>
<p>They may not engage in any occupation, whether gainful or not, unless<br>exemption is granted by the Governments of the EFTA States acting by com-<br>mon accord.</p>
<p>When taking up their duties, they shall give a solemn undertaking that,<br>both during and after their term of office, they will respect the obligations<br>arising therefrom, in particular the duty to behave with integrity and discre-<br>tion as regards the acceptance, after they have ceased to hold office, of cer-<br>tain appointments or benefits.</p>
<p>Any doubt on this point shall be settled by decision of the Court.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>Apart from normal replacement, or death, the duties of a Judge shall end<br>when he resigns.</p>
<p>Where a Judge resigns, his letter of resignation shall be addressed to the<br>President of the Court for transmission to the Governments of the EFTA<br>States. Upon this notification a vacancy shall arise on the bench.</p>
<p>Save where Article 6 applies, a Judge shall continue to hold office until his<br>successor takes up his duties.</p>
<p>291</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>A Judge may be deprived of his office or of his right to a pension or other<br>benefits in its stead only if, in the unanimous opinion of the Court in plenary,<br>he no longer fulfils the requisite conditions or meets the obligations arising<br>from his office. The Judge concerned shall not take part in any such delibera-<br>tions.</p>
<p>The Registrar of the Court shall notify such a decision to the Governments<br>of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>A Judge who is to replace a member of the Court whose term of office has<br>not expired shall be appointed for the remainder of his predecessor’s term.</p>
<h2>PART II</h2>
<p>ORGANIZATION</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>Decisions of the Court shall be taken by a majority of the Judges sitting in<br>the deliberations and in accordance with conditions laid down in the rules of<br>procedure.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>The Court shall appoint its Registrar and lay down the rules governing his<br>service.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>The Registrar shall take an oath before the Court to perform his duties im-<br>partially and conscientiously and to preserve the secrecy of the deliberations<br>of the Court.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>The Court shall arrange for replacement of the Registrar on occasions when<br>he is prevented from attending the Court.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>Officials and other servants shall be attached to the Court to enable it to<br>funetion. They shall be responsible to the Registrar under the authority of<br>the President.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>The Judges and the Registrar shall be required to reside at the place where<br>the Court has its seat.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol5</p>
<p>292</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>The Court shall remain permanently in session. The duration of the judicial<br>vacations shall be determined by the Court with due regard to the needs of<br>its business.</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
