<p>No Judge may take part in the disposal of a case in which he has previously<br>taken part as agent or adviser or has acted for one of the parties, or in which<br>he has been called upon to pronounce as a member of a court or tribunal, of<br>a commission of inquiry or in any other capacity.</p>
<p>If, for some special reason, any Judge considers that he should not take<br>part in the judgment or examination of a particular case, he shall so inform<br>the President of the Court. If, for some reason, the President considers that<br>any Judge should not sit in a particular case, he shall notify him accordingly.</p>
<p>Any difficulty arising as to the application of this Article shall be settled<br>by decision of the Court.</p>
<p>A party may not apply for a change in the composition of the Court on the<br>grounds of either nationality of a Judge or the absence from the Court of a<br>Judge of the nationality of that party.</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>Rules governing the languages of the Court shall be laid down in the rules of<br>procedure of the Court.</p>
<h2>PART III</h2>
<p>PROCEDURE</p>
<p>Article 17</p>
<p>The EFTA States, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the Community and<br>the EC Commission shall be represented before the Court by an agent ap-<br>pointed for each case; the agent may be assisted by an adviser or by a lawyer<br>entitled to practise before a court of a Contracting Party to the EEA Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>Other parties must be represented by a lawyer entitled to practise before<br>a court in a Contracting Party to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Such agents, advisers and lawyers shall, when they appear before the<br>Court, enjoy the rights and immunities necessary to the independent exer-<br>cise of their duties, under conditions laid down in the rules of procedure of<br>the Court.</p>
<p>As regards such advisers and lawyers who appear before it, the Court shall<br>have the powers normally accorded to courts of law, in accordance with the<br>rules of procedure of the Court.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol5</p>
<p>293</p>
<p>Article 18</p>
<p>The procedure before the Court shall consist of two parts: written and oral.</p>
<p>The written procedure shall consist of the communication to the parties of<br>applications, statements of case, defences and observations, and of replies,<br>if any, as well as of all papers and documents in support or of certified copies<br>of them.</p>
<p>Communications shall be made by the Registrar in the order and within<br>the time laid down in the rules of procedure of the Court.</p>
<p>The oral procedure shall consist of the reading of the report presented by<br>a Judge acting as Rapporteur, the hearing by the Court of agents, advisers<br>and lawyers, as well as the hearing, if any, of witnesses and experts.</p>
<p>Article 19</p>
<p>A case shall be brought before the Court by a written application addressed<br>to the Registrar. The application shall contain the applicanfs name and per-<br>manent address and the description of the signatory, the name of the party<br>against whom the application is made, the subject matter of the dispute, the<br>submissions and a brief statement of the grounds on which the application is<br>based.</p>
<p>The application shall be accompanied, where appropriate, by the measure<br>the annulment of which is sought or by any other relevant documents. If the<br>documents are not submitted with the application, the Registrar shall ask the<br>party concerned to produce them within a reasonable period, but in that<br>event the rights of the party shall not lapse even if such documents are pro-<br>duced after the time-limit for bringing proceedings.</p>
<p>Article 20</p>
<p>As soon as a case is pending before the Court, the Registrar shall notify the<br>Governments of the EFTA States, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the<br>Community and the EC Commission. Within two months of this notifica-<br>tion, the EFTA States, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the Community<br>and the EC Commission shall be entitled to submit statements of case or<br>written observations to the Court.</p>
<p>Article 21</p>
<p>The Court may require the parties to produce all documents and to supply<br>all information which the Court considers desirable. Formal note shall be<br>taken of any refusal.</p>
<p>The Court may also require the EFTA States not being parties to the case<br>to supply all information which the Court considers necessary for the pro-<br>ceedings.</p>
<p>Article 22</p>
<p>The Court may at any time entrust any individual, body, authority, commit-<br>tee or other organization it chooses with the task of giving an expert opinion.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol5</p>
<p>294</p>
<p>Article 23</p>
<p>Witnesses may be heard in accordance with the rules of procedure of the<br>Court.</p>
<p>Article 24</p>
<p>Witnesses and experts may be heard on oath taken in accordance with the<br>rules of procedure of the Court or in the manner laid down by the law of the<br>country of the witness or expert.</p>
<p>Article 25</p>
<p>The Court may order that a witness or expert be heard by the judicial auth-<br>ority of his place of permanent residence.</p>
<p>The order shall be sent for implementation to the competent judicial auth-<br>ority under conditions laid down in the rules of procedure of the Court. The<br>documents drawn up in compliance with the letters rogatory shall be re-<br>turned to the Court under the same conditions.</p>
<p>The Court shall defray the expenses, without prejudice to the right to<br>charge them, where appropriate, to the parties.</p>
<p>Article 26</p>
<p>An EFTA State shall treat any defaulting witness or any violation of an oath<br>by a witness or expert in the same manner as if the offence had been commit-<br>ted before one of its courts with jurisdiction in civil proceedings. At the in-<br>stance of the Court, the EFTA State concerned shall prosecute the offender<br>before its competent court.</p>
<p>Article 27</p>
<p>The hearing in court shall be public, unless the Court, of its own motion or<br>on application by the parties, decides otherwise for serious reasons.</p>
<p>Article 28</p>
<p>During the hearings the Court may examine the experts, the witnesses and<br>the parties themselves. The latter, however, may address the Court only<br>through their representatives.</p>
<p>Article 29</p>
<p>Minutes shall be made of each hearing and signed by the President and the<br>Registrar.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 5</p>
<p>295</p>
<p>Article 30</p>
<p>The case list shall be established by the President.</p>
<p>Article 31</p>
<p>The deliberations of the Court shall be and shall remain secret.</p>
<p>Article 32</p>
<p>Judgments shall State the reasons on which they are based. They shall con-<br>tain the names of the Judges who took part in the deliberations.</p>
<p>Article 33</p>
<p>Judgments shall be signed by the President and the Registrar. They shall be<br>read in open court.</p>
<p>Article 34</p>
<p>The Court shall adjudicate upon costs.</p>
<p>Article 35</p>
<p>The President of the Court may, by way of summary procedure, which may,<br>in so far as necessary, differ from some of the rules contained in this Agree-<br>ment and which shall be laid down in the rules of procedure, adjudicate upon<br>applications to suspend execution as provided for in Article 40 of this Agree-<br>ment, or to prescribe interim measures in pursuance of Article 41 of this<br>Agreement, or to suspend enforcement in accordance with Article 110,<br>fourth paragraph, of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Should the President be prevented from attending, his place shall be taken<br>by another Judge in accordance with the rules of procedure.</p>
<p>The ruling of the President or of the Judge replacing him shall be provi-<br>sional and shall in no way prejudice the decision of the Court on the sub-<br>stance of the case.</p>
<p>Article 36</p>
<p>Any EFTA State, the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the Community and the<br>EC Commission may intervene in cases before the Court.</p>
<p>The same right shall be open to any person establishing an interest in the<br>result of any case submitted to the Court, save in cases between EFTA States<br>or between EFTA States and the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>Submissions made in an application to intervene shall be limited to sup-<br>porting the submissions of one of the parties.</p>
<p>Article 37</p>
<p>Where the defending party, after having been duly summoned, fails to file<br>written submissions in defence, judgment shall be given against that party by</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 5</p>
<p>296</p>
<p>default. An objection may be lodged against the judgment within one month<br>of it being notified. The objection shall not have the effect of staying enforce-<br>ment of the judgment by default unless the Court decides otherwise.</p>
<p>Article 38</p>
<p>EFTA States, and any other natural or legal persons may, in cases and under<br>conditions to be determined by the rules of procedure, institute third-party<br>proceedings to contest a judgment rendered without their being heard,<br>where the judgment is prejudicial to their rights.</p>
<p>Article 39</p>
<p>If the meaning or scope of a judgment is in doubt, the Court shall construe<br>it on application by any party establishing an interest therein or by the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>Article 40</p>
<p>An application for revision of a judgment may be made to the Court only on<br>discovery of a fact which is of such nature as to be a decisive factor, and<br>which, when the judgment was given, was unknown to the Court and to the<br>party claiming the revision.</p>
<p>The revision shall be opened by a judgment of the Court expressly record-<br>ing the existence of a new fact, recognizing that it is of such a character as to<br>lay the case open to revision and declaring the application admissible on this<br>ground.</p>
<p>No application for revision may be made after the lapse of ten years from<br>the date of the judgment.</p>
<p>Article 41</p>
<p>Periods of grace based on considerations of distance shall be determined by<br>the rules of procedure of the Court.</p>
<p>No right shall be prejudiced in consequence of the expiry of a time-limit if<br>the party concerned proves the existence of unforeseeable circumstances or<br>of force majeure.</p>
<p>Article 42</p>
<p>Proceedings against the EFTA Surveillance Authority in matters arising<br>from non-contractual liability shall be barred after a period of five years from<br>the occurrence of the event giving rise thereto. The period of limitation shall<br>be interrupted if proceedings are instituted before the Court or if prior to<br>such proceedings an application is made by the aggrieved party to the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority. In the latter event the proceedings must be instituted<br>within two months of the publication of the measure, or of its notification to<br>the plaintiff, or, in the absence thereof, of the day on which it came to the<br>knowledge of the latter, as the case may be.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 5</p>
<p>297</p>
<h2>PART IV</h2>
<p>GENERAL PROVISIONS</p>
<p>Article 43</p>
<p>The rules of procedure of the Court shall contain, apart from the provisions<br>contemplated by this Statute, any other provisions necessary for applying<br>and, where required, supplementing it.</p>
<p>Article 44</p>
<p>The Governments of the EFTA States may, on a proposal from or after hear-<br>ing the Court, by common accord amend this Statute.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol5</p>
<p>298</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL 6</h1>
<h2>ON THE LEGAL CAPACITY, PRIVILEGES AND<br>IMMUNITIES OF</h2>
<h2>THE EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY</h2>
<h2>PARTI</h2>
<p>THE EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall possess legal personality. It shall in<br>particular have the capacity to contract, to acquire and dispose of movable<br>and immovable property, and to be a party to legal proceedings.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. Within the scope of its official activities, the EFTA Surveillance Auth-<br>ority shall have immunity from jurisdiction and execution, except:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;in so far as it has expressly waived such immunity in a particular<br>case;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;in respect of a civil action by a third party for damage arising from<br>an accident caused by a vehicle or other means of transport belong-<br>ing to or operated on behalf of the EFTA Surveillance Authority or<br>in respect of a traffic offence involving such means of transport;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;in the event of the attachment, pursuant to a decision by the admin-<br>istrative or judicial authorities, of the salaries and emoluments, in-<br>cluding pension rights, owed by the EFTA Surveillance Authority to<br>a Member, an official or other servant or a former Member, official<br>or other servant;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;in respect of a counterclaim directly connected with judicial pro-<br>ceedings initiated by the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>2. The property of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, wherever located,<br>shall be immune:</p>
<p>(a) from any form of requisition, confiscation or expropriation;</p>
<p>(b) from any form of sequestration and administrative or provisional ju-<br>dicial constraint, except in the cases provided for in the preceding<br>paragraph.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>The archives of the EFTA Surveillance Authority and all documents belong-<br>ing to it or held by it shall be inviolable wherever located.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>1. Without being restricted by financial Controls, regulations or moratoria<br>of any kind the EFTA Surveillance Authority may:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol6</p>
<p>299</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;hold funds or currency of any kind and operate accounts in any cur-<br>rency;</p>
<p>(b) freely transfer its funds or currency from one country to another or<br>within any country and convert any currency held by it into any other<br>currency.</p>
<p>2. In exercising its rights under paragraph 1 of this Article the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority shall pay due regard to any representations made by any<br>State Party to this Protocol and shall give effect to such representations in so<br>far as it is considered possible to do so without detriment to the interests of<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority, its assets, income and other property<br>shall be exempt:</p>
<p>(a) from all direct taxes; the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall not,<br>however, claim exemption from rates, taxes or dues which are in fact<br>charges for public utility services;</p>
<p>(b) from customs duties and prohibitions and restrictions on imports<br>and exports in respect of articles directly imported or exported by<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority for its official use. Articles im-<br>ported under such exemption shall not be sold in the territory of the<br>State into which they were imported except under conditions agreed<br>with the Government of that State;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;from customs duties and prohibitions and restrictions on imports<br>and exports in respect of its publications.</p>
<p>2. When purchases or services of substantial value and necessary for the ex-<br>ercise of the official activities of the EFTA Surveillance Authority are made<br>or used by the EFTA Surveillance Authority and when the price of such pur-<br>chases and services includes taxes or duties, the State Party to this Protocol<br>that has levied the taxes or duties shall take appropriate measures to grant<br>exemption from such taxes or duties or to provide for their reimbursement,<br>if they are identifiable.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall enjoy in the territory of each<br>State Party to this Protocol, for its official Communications, treatment not<br>less favourable than that accorded by the Government of that State to any<br>other comparable international organization, in the matter of priorities,<br>rates and taxes for posts and telecommunications and press rates for in-<br>formation to the press and radio.</p>
<p>2. No censorship shall be applied to the official correspondence and other<br>official Communications of the EFTA Surveillance Authority.</p>
<p>3. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall have the right to use codes and<br>to dispatch and receive correspondence by courier or in sealed bags, which</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 6</p>
<p>300</p>
<p>shall have the same immunities and privileges as diplomatic couriers and<br>bags.</p>
<h2>PART II</h2>
<p>THE MEMBERS, OFFICIALS AND OTHER SERVANTS OF THE<br>EFTA SURVEILLANCE AUTHORITY</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>1. The Members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the officials and other<br>servants thereof shall enjoy the following privileges and immunities:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;immunity from jurisdiction, even after they have left the service of<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in respect of acts, including words<br>written or spöken, done by them in the exercise of their function.<br>This immunity shall, however, not apply in the case of a traffic of-<br>fence committed by a Member, official or other servant, nor in the<br>case of damage caused by a vehicle or other means of transport be-<br>longing to or driven by him;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;inviolability for all their official papers and documents;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;exemption from all obligations in respect of national service, includ-<br>ing military service;</p>
<p>(d) together with members of their families forming part of their house-<br>holds, exemption from all measures restricting immigration and<br>from aliens’ registration formalities;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;together with members of their families forming part of their house-<br>holds, the same facilities as to repatriation, in time of international<br>crisis, as are normally accorded to staff members of international or-<br>ganizations;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;the same treatment in respect of currency and exchange regulations<br>as is normally accorded to staff members of international organiza-<br>tions;</p>
<p>(g) exemption from all national income tax on their salaries and emolu-<br>ments paid to them by the EFTA Surveillance Authority, excluding<br>pensions and other similar benefits paid by the EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority. The States Parties to this Protocol reserve the right to<br>take those salaries and emoluments into account when assessing the<br>amount of tax to be applied to income from other sources.</p>
<p>2. The EFTA Surveillance Authority shall specify the classes of officials and<br>other servants to whom paragraph 1 applies and shall inform the EFTA<br>States of its decision. The names of the officials and other servants included<br>in these classes shall regularly be made known to the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>In addition to the privileges and immunities provided for in Article 7(1), the<br>Members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority shall enjoy:</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol6</p>
<p>(a) immunity from arrest and detention, except when found commit-</p>
<p>301</p>
<p>ting, attempting to commit or just having committed an offence;</p>
<p>(b) immunity from civil and administrative jurisdiction and execution<br>enjoyed by diplomatic agents, except in the case of damage caused<br>by a vehicle or other means of transport belonging to or driven by<br>him;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;full immunity from criminal jurisdiction, except in a case of a traffic<br>offence caused by a vehicle or other means of transport belonging to<br>or driven by him, subject to subparagraph (a);</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;the same customs facilities as regards his personal luggage as are ac-<br>corded to diplomatic agents.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol6</p>
<h2>PART III</h2>
<p>MEMBERS OF ADVISORY BODIES AND EXPERTS</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>1. Members of advisory bodies assisting the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>in its work shall enjoy the following privileges and immunities while per-<br>forming their duties for the EFTA Surveillance Authority or carrying out<br>missions on its behalf:</p>
<p>(a) immunity from jurisdiction, even after the termination of their mis-<br>sion, in respect of acts, including words spöken or written, done by<br>them in the exercise of their functions; this immunity shall not apply,<br>however, in the case of a traffic offence committed by a member of<br>an advisory body, nor in the case of damage caused by a vehicle or<br>other means of transport belonging to or driven by him;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;inviolability for all their official papers and documents;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;exemption from all measures restricting immigration and from<br>aliens’ registration formalities;</p>
<p>(d) the same treatment in respect of currency and exchange regulations<br>as is accorded to the representatives of foreign governments on tem-<br>porary official missions.</p>
<p>2. Paragraph 1 shall also apply to experts on missions while performing their<br>duties on behalf of the EFTA Surveillance Authority as well as to<br>representatives of the Commission of the European Communities and the<br>EC Member States who participate in the work of the advisory bodies re-<br>ferred to in paragraph 1.</p>
<h2>PART IV</h2>
<p>GENERAL PROVISIONS</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>1. The EFTA Surveillance Authority has a duty to waive its immunity in all<br>cases where reliance upon it would impede the course of justice and it can<br>be waived without prejudicing the interests of the Authority.</p>
<p>2. Privileges and immunities are granted to the Members, officials and other<br></p>
<p>302</p>
<p>servants in the interests of the EFTA Surveillance Authority and not for the<br>personal benefit of the individuals themselves. The EFTA Surveillance<br>Authority shall have the right, and is under a duty, to waive the immunity of<br>a Member, official or other servant in any case where, in its opinion, the<br>immunity would impede the course of justice and could be waived without<br>prejudice to the interests of the Authority.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>No State Party to this Protocol shall be obliged to accord the privileges and<br>immunities referred to in Article 7(1)(c), (d) and (e) to its own nationals or<br>permanent residents.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>The provisions of this Protocol shall not prejudice the right of each State<br>Party to this Protocol to take all precautionary measures necessary in the<br>interest of its security.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>If any State Party to this Protocol considers that there has been an abuse of a<br>privilege or immunity conferred by this Protocol, consultations shall be held<br>between that State and the EFTA Surveillance Authority to determine<br>whether any such abuse has occurred, and, if so, to ensure that no repetition<br>occurs. A State which considers that any person has abused any privilege or<br>immunity granted to him under this Protocol may require him to leave its<br>territory.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol6</p>
<p>303</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL 7</h1>
<h2>ON THE LEGAL CAPACITY, PRIVILEGES AND<br>IMMUNITIES OF THE EFTA COURT</h2>
<h2>PARTI</h2>
<p>THE EFIA COURT</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>The EFTA Court shall possess legal personality. It shall in particular have<br>the capacity to contract, to acquire and dispose of movable and immovable<br>property, and to be a party to legal proceedings.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>1. Within the scope of its official activities, the Court shall have immunity<br>from jurisdiction and execution, except:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;in so far as it has expressly waived such immunity in a particular<br>case;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;in respect of a civil action by a third party for damage arising from<br>an accident caused by a vehicle or other means of transport belong-<br>ing to or operated on behalf of the Court or in respect of a traffic<br>offence involving such means of transport;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;in the event of the attachment, pursuant to a decision by the admin-<br>istrative or judicial authorities, of the salaries and emoluments, in-<br>cluding pension rights, owed by the Court to a Judge, the Registrar,<br>an official or other servant or to a former Judge, Registrar, official<br>or other servant;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;in respect of a counterclaim directly connected with judicial pro-<br>ceedings initiated by the Court.</p>
<p>2. The property of the Court, wherever located, shall be immune:</p>
<p>(a) from any form of requisition, confiscation or expropriation;</p>
<p>(b) from any form of sequestration and administrative or provisional ju-<br>dicial constraint, except in the cases provided for in the preceding<br>paragraph.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>The archives of the Court and all documents belonging to it or held by it shall<br>be inviolable wherever located.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>1. Without being restricted by financial Controls, regulations or moratoria<br>of any kind the Court may:</p>
<p>(a) hold funds or currency of any kind and operate accounts in any cur-<br>rency;</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol7</p>
<p>304</p>
<p>(b) freely transfer its funds or currency from one country to another or<br>within any country and convert any currency held by it into any other<br>currency.</p>
<p>2. In exercising its rights under paragraph 1 of this Article the Court shall<br>pay due regard to any representations made by any State Party to this Proto-<br>col and shall give effect to such representations in so far as it is considered<br>possible to do so without detriment to the interests of the Court.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>1. The Court, its assets, income and other property shall be exempt:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;from all direct taxes; the Court shall not, however, claim exemption<br>from rates, taxes or dues which are in fact charges for public utility<br>services;</p>
<p>(b) from customs duties and prohibitions and restrictions on imports<br>and exports in respect of articles directly imported or exported by<br>the Court for its official use. Articles imported under such exemp-<br>tion shall not be sold in the territory of the State into which they<br>were imported except under conditions agreed with the Govern-<br>ment of that State;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;from customs duties and prohibitions and restrictions on imports<br>and exports in respect of its publications.</p>
<p>2. When purchases or services of substantial value and necessary for the ex-<br>ercise of the official activities of the Court are made or used by the Court<br>and when the price of such purchases and services includes taxes or duties,<br>the State Party to this Protocol that has levied the taxes or duties shall take<br>appropriate measures to grant exemption from such taxes or duties or to pro-<br>vide for their reimbursement, if they are identifiable.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>1. The Court shall enjoy in the territory of each State Party to this Protocol,<br>for its official Communications, treatment not less favourable than that ac-<br>corded by the Government of that State to any other comparable interna-<br>tional organization, in the matter of priorities, rates and taxes for posts and<br>telecommunications and press rates for information to the press and radio.</p>
<p>2. No censorship shall be applied to the official correspondence and other<br>official Communications of the Court.</p>
<p>3. The Court shall have the right to use codes and to dispatch and receive<br>correspondence by courier or in sealed bags, which shall have the same im-<br>munities and privileges as diplomatic couriers and bags.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol7</p>
<p>305</p>
<p>20 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<h2>PART II</h2>
<p>THE JUDGES, THE REGISTRAR, THE OFFICIALS AND OTHER<br>SERVANTS OF THE COURT</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>1. The Judges shall be immune from legal proceedings. After they have<br>ceased to hold office, they shall continue to enjoy immunity in respect of<br>acts performed by them in their official capacity, including words spöken or<br>written.</p>
<p>2. The Court, sitting in plenary session, may waive the immunity.</p>
<p>3. Where immunity has been waived and criminal proceedings are instituted<br>against a Judge, he shall be tried, in any of the Member States, only by the<br>Court competent to judge the members of the highest national judiciary.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>1. The Judges, the Registrar, the officials and other servants of the Court<br>shall enjoy the following privileges and immunities:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;inviolability for all their official papers and documents;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;exemption from all obligations in respect of national service, includ-<br>ing military service;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;together with members of their families forming part of their house-<br>holds, exemption from all measures restricting immigration and<br>from aliens’ registration formalities;</p>
<p>(d) together with members of their families forming part of their house-<br>holds, the same facilities as to repatriation, in time of international<br>crisis, as are normally accorded to staff members of international or-<br>ganizations;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;the same treatment in respect of currency and exchange regulations<br>as is normally accorded to staff members of international organiza-<br>tions;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;exemption from all national income tax on their salaries and emolu-<br>ments paid to them by the Court, excluding pensions and other sim-<br>ilar benefits paid by the Court. The States Parties to this Protocol<br>reserve the right to take those salaries and emoluments into account<br>when assessing the amount of tax to be applied to income from other<br>sources.</p>
<p>2. In addition to the privileges and immunities provided for above, the Re-<br>gistrar, the officials and other servants shall enjoy immunity from jurisdic-<br>tion, even after they have left the service of the Court, in respect of acts,<br>including words written or spöken, done by them in the exercise of their<br>function. This immunity shall, however, not apply in the case of a traffic of-<br>fence committed by the Registrar, an official or other servant, nor in the case<br>of damage caused by a vehicle or other means of transport belonging to or<br>driven by him.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 7</p>
<p>3. The Court shall specify the classes of officials and other servants to whom</p>
<p>306</p>
<p>paragraphs 1 and 2 applies and shall inform the EFTA States of its decision.<br>The names of the officials and other servants included in these classes shall<br>regularly be made known to the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>In addition to the privileges and immunities provided for in Article 8(1), the<br>Judges shall enjoy:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;immunity from civil and administrative jurisdiction and execution<br>enjoyed by diplomatic agents, except in the case of damage caused<br>by a vehicle or other means of transport belonging to or driven by<br>him;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;the same customs facilities as regards his personal luggage as are ac-<br>corded to diplomatic agents.</p>
<h2>PART III</h2>
<p>GENERAL PROVISIONS</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>1. The Court has a duty to waive its immunity in all cases where reliance<br>upon it would impede the course of justice and it can be waived without pre-<br>judicing the interests of the Court.</p>
<p>2. Privileges and immunities are granted to the Registrar, the officials and<br>other servants of the Court in the interests of the Court and not for the per-<br>sonal benefit of the individuals themselves. The Court shall have the right,<br>and is under a duty, to waive the immunity of the Registrar, an official or<br>other servant in any case where, in its opinion, the immunity would impede<br>the course of justice and could be waived without prejudice to the interests<br>of the Court.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>No State Party to this Protocol shall be obliged to accord the privileges and<br>immunities referred to in Article 8(l)(b), (c) and (d) to its own nationals or<br>permanent residents.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>The provisions of this Protocol shall not prejudice the right of each State<br>Party to this Protocol to take all precautionary measures necessary in the<br>interest of its security.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>If any State Party to this Protocol considers that there has been an abuse of a<br>privilege or immunity conferred by this Protocol, consultations shall be held<br>between that State and the Court to determine whether any such abuse has</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol7</p>
<p>307</p>
<p>occurred, and, if so, to ensure that no repetition occurs. A State which con-<br>siders that any person has abused any privilege or immunity granted to him<br>under this Protocol may require him to leave its territory.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol7</p>
<p>308</p>

<p>313</p>
<h1>AGREED MINUTES</h1>
<p>OF THE NEGOTIATIONS FOR AN AGREEMENT<br>BETWEEN THE EFTA STATES ON THE<br>ESTABLISHMENT OF A SURVEILLANCE<br>AUTHORITY AND A COURT OF JUSTICE</p>
<p>The Contracting Parties agreed that:</p>
<p>Ad Protocol 4, Article 10(1) of Chapter II, Article 16(2) of Chapter VI, Article<br>15(2) of Chapter IX, Article 8(2) of Chapter XI and Article 19(2) of Chapter<br>XIII</p>
<p>the transmission of information to the competent authorities of the EFTA<br>States shall concern all applications and notifications received by the EFTA<br>Surveillance Authority, including those resulting from a misunderstanding,<br>on the part of the economic operators, of the substance rules or the rules<br>contained in Article 56 of the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>Ad Protocol 4, Article 14(2) of Chapter II, Article 21(2) of Chapter VI, Article<br>18(2) of Chapter IX and Article 13(2) of Chapter XIII</p>
<p>the authorization provided by the EFTA Surveillance Authority to the<br>representatives of the EC Commission shall be of declarative nature only;</p>
<p>Ad Protocol 6, Article 7(1), and Protocol 7, Article 8(1),</p>
<p>it would be provided in the Headquarters Agreements that the Members of<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority, the officials and other servants thereof,<br>as well as the Judges, the Registrar, the officials and other servants of the<br>Court shall have the right to import free of custom duties and other import<br>charges their furniture and personal effects, including motor vehicles for<br>their personal use, at the time of taking up their post in the territory of a<br>Contracting Party, and the right to export them free of duty upon termina-<br>tion of their functions, subject to the conditions laid down by the laws and<br>regulations of the Contracting Party concerned;</p>
<p>goods thus imported and exempted shall not be sold, hired out, lent or given<br>away against payment or free of charge, except in accordance with the condi-<br>tions laid down by the Contracting Party which has granted the exemptions;<br>they would endeavour to achieve the same in Headquarters Agreements<br>with other States.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>ESA/Court</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Agreed minutes</p>
<p>314</p>
<h2>AGREEMENT ON A STANDING COMMITTEE OF</h2>
<h2>THE EFTA STATES</h2>
<h2>THE REPUBLIC OF AUSTRIA, THE REPUBLIC OF<br>FINLAND, THE REPUBLIC OF ICELAND, THE<br>PRINCIPALITY OF LIECHTENSTEIN, THE</h2>
<h2>KINGDOM OF NORWAY, THE KINGDOM OF SWEDEN<br>AND THE SWISS CONFEDERATION,</h2>
<p>HAVING REGARD to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>RECALLING the objective to establish a dynamic and homogeneous Euro-<br>pean Economic Area;</p>
<p>AIMING at facilitating the elaboration of decisions to be taken by the EEA<br>Council and the EEA Joint Committee;</p>
<p>CONSIDERING that for the purposes of the EEA, functions in respect of<br>decision-making, administration and management, as well as consultations,<br>have to be carried out among the EFTA States;</p>
<p>RECALLING the Convention establishing the European Free Trade Asso-<br>ciation;</p>
<p>WHEREAS nothing in this Agreement shall prejudice the competences of<br>the surveillance authority referred to in the Agreement between the EFTA<br>States on the establishment of a surveillance authority and a court of justice;</p>
<p>HAVE DECIDED to conclude the following Agreement:</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. A Standing Committee of the EFTA States, hereinafter referred to as the<br>Standing Committee, shall, in accordance with the provisions of this Agree-<br>ment and of the EEA Agreement, carry out functions in respect of decision-<br>making, administration and management, as well as consultations, among<br>EFTA States.</p>
<p>2. For the purposes of this Agreement:</p>
<p>(a) the term ’EEA Agreement’ means the main part of the EEA Agree-<br>ment, its Protocols and Annexes as well as the acts referred to<br>therein;</p>
<p>(b) the term ’EFTA State’ means a Contracting Party which is a Mem-<br>ber of the European Free Trade Association and is a Party to the<br>EEA Agreement and to the present Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>The EFTA States shall, when appropriate, consult within the Standing Com-<br>mittee for the purpose of taking decisions in the EEA Council and the EEA<br>Joint Committee.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>315</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>1. The Standing Committee shall, without prejudice to the competences of<br>the EFTA Surveillance Authority set up under the Agreement between the<br>EFTA States on the establishment of a surveillance authority and a court of<br>justice, carry out the following tasks:</p>
<p>(a) take decisions necessary for the management of rules of, or adopted<br>pursuant to, the EEA Agreement, in particular as specified in<br>Article 1 of Protocol 1 to the present Agreement, in the cases which,<br>through the application of Protocol 1 to the EEA Agreement, follow<br>from the acts referred to in the Annexes to that Agreement;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;take decisions in the cases referred to it under procedures to be es-<br>tablished in accordance with Article 3 of Protocol 1 to the Agree-<br>ment between the EFTA States on the establishment of a surveil-<br>lance authority and a court of justice;</p>
<p>(c) receive information which an EFTA State or a competent authority<br>according to the EEA rules is to submit to the Standing Committee<br>or to one or several other EFTA States in addition to the Standing<br>Committee and, in the latter case, pass it on to the EC Commission;</p>
<p>(d) receive from the EC Commission information which an EC Member<br>State is to submit to one or several other EC Member States for dis-<br>tribution to the EFTA States or their competent authorities;</p>
<p>(e) perform the functions laid down in Protocol 2 to this Agreement, in<br>the cases referred to in Article 43 of the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;in the veterinary field, lay down the necessary procedures on noti-<br>fication of diseases as well as on cooperation between administrative<br>authorities of the EFTA States and on cooperation between these<br>authorities and the EFTA Surveillance Authority and/or the Stand-<br>ing Committee;</p>
<p>(g) extend the time period during which an EFTA State may maintain a<br>safeguard measure, or a derogation from a provision of an act, in the<br>cases provided for in Chapter XII, Foodstuffs, and Chapter XVII,<br>Environment protection, of Annex II, TBT, to the EEA Agree-<br>ment;</p>
<p>(h) take decisions in cases where an EFTA State has referred to the<br>Standing Committee a decision of the EFTA Surveillance Authority<br>regarding safeguard measures, in the cases provided for in Chapter<br>XII, Foodstuffs, and XIII, Medicinal products, of Annex II, TBT,<br>to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;take decisions in cases where an EFTA State has requested it to an-<br>nul or amend a decision by the EFTA Surveillance Authority, in the<br>cases provided for in Annex V, Free movement of workers, to the<br>EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;examine matters relative to Capital movements and prepare reports<br>thereon in cases where, according to the acts referred to in<br>Annex XII to the EEA Agreement, the EC Monetary Committee<br>carries out such tasks;</p>
<p>(k) settle disputes between the EFTA States, in the cases provided for<br>in Annex XIII to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>316</p>
<p>2. The Standing Committee shall, unless otherwise agreed with the EC<br>Commission, concurrently with the EC Commission prepare, as appropri-<br>ate, reports, assessments or the like with regard to the EFTA States, in the<br>cases which are directly related to the functions of the Standing Committee<br>set out in Protocol 1 to this Agreement and which through the application of<br>paragraph 5 of Protocol 1 to the EEA Agreement follow from the acts re-<br>ferred to in the Annexes to that Agreement. The Standing Committee shall<br>consult, and exchange views with, the EC Commission during the prep-<br>aration of their respective reports, copies of which are to be sent to the EEA<br>Joint Committee.</p>
<p>3. Furthermore, the Standing Committee shall also carry out other tasks as-<br>signed to it in the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>1. Each EFTA State shall be represented in the Standing Committee and<br>shall have one vote.</p>
<p>2. The Standing Committee can meet at the level of Ministers or High Offi-<br>cials. Meetings at other levels will be held in such subcommittees and other<br>bodies as set up pursuant to Article 5(1).</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>1. The Standing Committee may decide to set up subcommittees and other<br>bodies to assist it in accomplishing its tasks.</p>
<p>2. The Standing Committee may also, on a proposal from the EFTA Surveil-<br>lance Authority, set up new committees, or designate already existing com-<br>mittees, to assist the EFTA Surveillance Authority in carrying out its func-<br>tions under the EEA Agreement as well as under the Agreement between<br>the EFTA States on the establishment of a surveillance authority and a court<br>of justice.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>1. In exercising its responsibilities under Article 3, the Standing Committee<br>may take decisions, which shall be binding on all EFTA States, and may<br>make recommendations to EFTA States.</p>
<p>2. Decisions and recommendations of the Standing Committee shall be<br>made by unanimous vote, unless otherwise provided for in the Annex to this<br>Agreement. Decisions or recommendations shall be regarded as unanimous<br>unless any EFTA State casts a negative vote. Decisions and recommenda-<br>tions which are to be made by majority vote require the affirmative vote of<br>the majority of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>3. Decisions of the Standing Committee shall be published in accordance<br>with the provisions of the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>317</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>The Standing Committee shall adopt its rules of procedure.</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>The Secretariat services for the Standing Committee shall be provided by the<br>EFTA Secretariat.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>The Standing Committee may seek the advice of a committee consisting of<br>the members of Parliament of the EFTA States who are members of the<br>EEA Joint Parliamentary Committee and the advice of the EFTA Consultat-<br>ive Committee.</p>
<p>Each of these Committees may furthermore express its views to the Standing<br>Committee on any matter of relevance for the functioning and development<br>of the EEA.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>The Protocols and the Annex to this Agreement shall form an integral part<br>thereof.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>An amendment to this Agreement shall be submitted to the EFTA States for<br>acceptance if it is approved by decision of the Standing Committee and it<br>shall enter into force provided it is accepted by all EFTA States.</p>
<p>Instruments of acceptance shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden which shall notify all other EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>1. Any EFTA State which withdraws from the EEA Agreement shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>withdrawal takes effect.</p>
<p>2. Any EFTA State which accedes to the European Community shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>accession takes effect.</p>
<p>3. The Governments of the remaining EFTA States shall, by common ac-<br>cord, decide on the necessary amendments to be made to the present Agree-<br>ment.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>Any EFTA State acceding to the EEA Agreement shall accede to the pre-<br>sent Agreement on such terms and conditions as may be laid down by com-<br></p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>318</p>
<p>mon accord by the EFTA States. The instrument of accession shall be depos-<br>ited with the Government of Sweden which shall notify the other EFTA<br>States.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>1. This Agreement, drawn up in a single copy and authentic in the English<br>language, shall be ratified by the Contracting Parties in accordance with their<br>respective constitutional requirements.</p>
<p>Before the entry into force of this Agreement, it shall also be drawn up and<br>authenticated in Finnish, French, German, Icelandic, Italian, Norwegian<br>and Swedish.</p>
<p>2. This Agreement shall be deposited with the Government of Sweden<br>which shall transmit a certified copy to each EFTA State.</p>
<p>The instruments of ratification shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden which shall notify all other EFTA States.</p>
<p>3. This Agreement shall enter into force on 1 January 1993 provided that<br>the EEA Agreement enters into force on that day and provided that the in-<br>struments of ratification of the present Agreement have been deposited by<br>all EFTA States.</p>
<p>If the EEA Agreement does not enter into force on that day the present<br>Agreement shall enter into force on the day the EEA Agreement enters into<br>force or when all instruments of ratification of the present Agreement have<br>been deposited by all EFTA States, whichever day is the later.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Main agreement</p>
<p>319</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL1</h1>
<p>ON THE FUNCTIONS AND POWERS OF THE<br>STANDING COMMITTEE WHICH, THROUGH THE<br>APPLICATION OF PROTOCOL 1 TO THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT, FOLLOW FROM THE ACTS REFERRED<br>TO IN THE ANNEXES TO THAT AGREEMENT</p>
<p>HAVING REGARD to the EEA Agreement and, in particular, Protocol 1<br>thereto;</p>
<p>NOTING the references, in paragraph 4(d) ofProtocol 1 to the EEAAgree-<br>ment, to the EFTA Surveillance Authority and the Standing Committee;</p>
<p>FURTHER NOTING the reference, in paragraph 4(d) of Protocol 1 to the<br>EEA Agreement, to procedures established among the EFTA States;</p>
<p>WHEREAS for the proper application of acts referred to in the Annexes to<br>the EEA Agreement, it is necessary to establish among the EFTA States the<br>functions corresponding to those of the EC Commission which, through the<br>application of Protocol 1 to the EEA Agreement, should be carried out ei-<br>ther by the EFTA Surveillance Authority or the Standing Committee, as well<br>as to establish the procedures to be applied among the EFTA States for that<br>purpose;</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>Where the acts referred to in the Annexes to the EEA Agreement contain<br>provisions on procedures under which the EC Commission:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;shall summarize, compile or otherwise prepare information received<br>and/or distribute such information to the Member States;</p>
<p>(b) &nbsp;deals with the management of lists, such as lists of notified bodies,<br>diplomas, etc;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;may update lists of entities;</p>
<p>(d) &nbsp;in the veterinary and phytosanitary field,</p>
<p>- shall designate at least one reference laboratory in each Member<br>State;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;in the field of technical regulations, standards, testing and certifica-<br>tion,</p>
<p>- is entrusted with functions relating to standardization, such as issu-<br>ing mandates to European standardization institutions and initiat-<br>ing procedures concerning harmonized standards not in conform-<br>ity with the essential safety requirements;</p>
<p>- deals with the management of conformity assessment;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;in the field of energy,</p>
<p>- shall consult quarterly with the Member States;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;in the fields of free movement of workers, mutual recognition of dip-<br>lomas and vocational training,</p>
<p>- shall or may instigate or coordinate activities of, cooperate with,<br>or take any other common action with the Member States;</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 1</p>
<p>320</p>
<p>(h) &nbsp;in the field of vocational training,</p>
<p>- shall draw up a structure of training levels;</p>
<p>- shall determine the manner in which information shall be drawn<br>up and the intervals at which it shall be communicated as well as<br>establish uniform criteria for the assessment of the State of the la-<br>bour markets in the Member States;</p>
<p>- shall, on request, give coordination bodies of the Member States<br>all necessary assistance and advice;</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;in the field of environment,</p>
<p>- shall set up and keep at the disposal of Member States a register<br>containing information about accidents which have occurred;</p>
<p>- shall set up a system of exchange of information;</p>
<p>- deals with the management and monitoring of Member States’<br>conformity to certain specific objectives and requirements;</p>
<p>(j) &nbsp;in the field of company law,</p>
<p>- shall inform a Member State that it must amend its legislation to<br>comply with the minimum Capital as regards public limited liability<br>companies;</p>
<p>those and comparable functions shall, among the EFTA States, be<br>carried out by the Standing Committee in accordance with the<br>procedures laid down in the acts referred to.</p>
<p>2. If the EC Commission is entrusted with other comparable functions, the<br>corresponding functions shall also be carried out by the Standing Commit-<br>tee.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 1</p>
<p>321</p>
<p>21 Riksdagen 1991/92. 1 saml. Nr 170. Bil. 16</p>
<h1>PROTOCOL 2</h1>
<h2>ON INTERNAL PROCEDURES BETWEEN THE</h2>
<h2>EFTA STATES FOR APPLICATION OF MEASURES IN<br>ACCORDANCE WITH ARTICLE 43 OF THE EEA<br>AGREEMENT</h2>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. An EFTA State which intends to take measures in accordance with Art-<br>icle 43 of the EEA Agreement shall in good time give notice thereof to the<br>Standing Committee.</p>
<p>2. However, in cases of secrecy or urgency, notice shall be given to the<br>Standing Committee and to the other EFTA States at the latest by the date<br>of entry into force of the measures.</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>The Standing Committee shall examine the situation and deliver an opinion<br>regarding the introduetion of the measures. It shall keep the situation under<br>review, and may at any time make, by majority vote, recommendations re-<br>garding the possible amendment, suspension or abolition of the measures<br>introduced or regarding any other measures to assist the EFTA State con-<br>cerned to overcome its difficulties.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Protocol 2</p>
<p>322</p>
<h1>ANNEX</h1>
<h2>AS PROVIDED FOR IN ARTICLE 6(2)</h2>
<p>The Standing Committee shall take decisions and make recommendations<br>by majority vote in the cases listed below, following from the acts referred<br>to in Annexes to the EEA Agreement:</p>
<p>(a) under Article 3(l)(b) of this Agreement concerning decisions in<br>cases referred to it under procedures to be established in accordance<br>with Article 3 of Protocol 1 to the Agreement between the EFTA<br>States on the establishment of a surveillance authority and a court<br>of justice, in the cases specified in the Appendix;</p>
<p>(b) under Article 3(l)(e) of this Agreement concerning the procedure<br>set out in Protocol 2;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;under Article 3(l)(f), when laying down the necessary procedures<br>on notification of diseases as well as on cooperation between admin-<br>istrative authorities of the EFTA States and on cooperation between<br>the latter and the EFTA Surveillance Authority and/or the Standing<br>Committee, in accordance with Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA<br>Agreement;</p>
<p>(d) when authorizing derogations concerning certain requirements with<br>regard to particular products, as specified in Chapter I of Annex I<br>to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;under Article l(l)(d) of Protocol 1 to this Agreement, when desig-<br>nating reference laboratories in the EFTA States;</p>
<p>(f) &nbsp;under Article 3(l)(g) of this Agreement when extending the time<br>period during which an EFTA State may maintain a safeguard meas-<br>ure or a derogation from a provision of an act;</p>
<p>(g) &nbsp;under Article 3(l)(h) of this Agreement when taking decisions in<br>cases regarding safeguard measures referred to it by an EFTA State;</p>
<p>(h) under Article 3(l)(i) of this Agreement when taking decisions in<br>cases where an EFTA State has requested it to annul or amend a<br>decision by the EFTA Surveillance Authority;</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;under Article 3(l)(k) of this Agreement when settling disputes, as<br>specified in Annex XIII to the EEA Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Annex</p>
<p>323</p>
<h1>APPENDIX</h1>
<h2>AS PROVIDED FOR IN THE ANNEX TO THIS<br>AGREEMENT</h2>
<p>The Standing Committee shall take the decisions provided for in subpara-<br>graph (a) of the Annex to this Agreement, concerning cases referred to it<br>under procedures to be established in accordance with Article 3 of Protocol 1<br>to the Agreement between the EFTA States on the establishment of a sur-<br>veillance authority and a court of justice, by majority vote in the following<br>cases:</p>
<p>(a) &nbsp;In the veterinary and phytosanitary field:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;when deciding whether a precautionary measure or safeguard<br>measure taken by an EFTA State was justified;</p>
<p>(ii) when, before an exemption or derogation from a provision of<br>an act is granted or undertaken by an EFTA State, agreeing or<br>authorizing that State to do so;</p>
<p>(iii) when giving approvals, or the like, or making recommenda-<br>tions, regarding plans, programmes, emergency vaccinations,<br>high-risk areas, etc.;</p>
<p>(b) In the veterinary field, when adopting appropriate measures in the<br>case of disputes;</p>
<p>(c) &nbsp;In the field of technical regulations, standards testing and certifica-<br>tion, when deciding whether national technical specifications shall<br>enjoy a presumption of conformity with the essential safety require-<br>ments;</p>
<p>(d) In the field of foodstuffs, when deciding whether certain conditions<br>are satisfied;</p>
<p>(e) &nbsp;In the field of dangerous substances:</p>
<p>(i) &nbsp;when deciding on additional information or amendments in<br>study programmes to protect man and the environment;</p>
<p>(ii) when deciding whether and, if so, under what conditions ac-<br>tions taken by a Member State may be continued or repeated;</p>
<p>(iii) when taking the appropriate measures regarding Good Labor-<br>atory Practices (GLP) compliance.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Standing Committee</p>
<p>Agreement</p>
<p>Annex</p>
<p>324</p>

<h1>RECORD OF UNDERSTANDING</h1>
<h2>REGARDING THE AGREEMENT ON A STANDING<br>COMMITTEEOF THE EFTA STATES</h2>
<p>The Annex</p>
<p>It is the understanding of the Contracting Parties that, at the entry into force<br>of the Agreement, the following Articles of the acts referred to in the An-<br>nexes to the EEA Agreement are covered by the respective subparagraphs<br>of the Annex:</p>
<p>ad subparagraph (d)</p>
<p>when authorizing derogations concerning certain requirements with regard<br>to particular products, as specified in Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA<br>Agreement, in accordance with:</p>
<p>- Article 6(2) of Council Directive 64/433/EEC, see point 18 in Chapter I of<br>Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>ad subparagraph (e)</p>
<p>- under Article l(l)(d) of Protocol 1 to this Agreement when designating<br>the necessary reference laboratories in each Member State, in accordance<br>with:</p>
<p>-Article 8(1) of Council Directive 64/433/EEC, see point 18 in Chapter I of<br>Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Article 5(3) of Council Directive 89/437/EEC, see point 23 in Chapter I of<br>Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>ad subparagraph (f)</p>
<p>under Article 3(l)(g) of this Agreement when extending the time period dur-<br>ing which an EFTA State may maintain a safeguard measure or a derogation<br>from a provision of an act, in accordance with:</p>
<p>-Article 1(3) of Council Directive of 23October 1962, see point 1 in<br>Chapter XII of Annex II to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Article 4(2) of Council Directive 64/54/EEC, see point 2 in Chapter XII of<br>Annex II to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>-Article 3(2) of Council Directive 70/357/EEC, see point 5 in Chapter XII<br>of Annex II to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>-Article 5(3) of Council Directive 73/241/EEC, see point 6 in Chapter XII<br>of Annex II to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>-Article 5(2) of Council Directive 74/329/EEC, see point 8 in ChapterXII<br>of Annex II to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>-Article 2(3) of Council Directive 75/716/EEC as amended by Council Dir-</p>

<h2>The Appendix</h2>
<p>It is the understanding of the Contracting Parties that, at the entry into force<br>of the Agreement, the following Articles of the acts referred to in the An-<br>nexes to the EEA Agreement are covered by the respective subparagraphs<br>of the Appendix:</p>
<p>ad subparagraph (a)</p>
<p>in the veterinary and phytosanitary field:</p>
<p>(i) when deciding whether a precautionary measure or safeguard meas-<br>ure taken by an EFTA State was justified, in accordance with:<br>-Article 13(3), third subparagraph, of Council Directive<br>85/511/EEC, see point 12 in Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA<br>Agreement;</p>
<p>(ii) when, before an exemption or derogation from a provision of<br>an act is granted or undertaken by an EFTA State, agreeing or<br>authorizing that State to do so, in accordance with:<br>-Articles 3(13) to (15), 9(2) third sentence, and (3), 9a(l) and<br>(2), first subparagraph, and (3), and 10 of Council Directive<br>64/432/EEC, see point 1 in Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA<br>Agreement;</p>
<p>-Articles 7(2), third sentence, and (3), and 8 of Council Dir-<br>ective 91/68/EEC, see point 2 in Chapter I of Annex I to the<br>EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Article 4(6), second subparagraph, third sentence, and third<br>subparagraph, of Council Directive 90/426/EEC, see point 3<br>in Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>-Articles 13(2), third sentence, and (3) and 14(2) and (3) of<br>Council Directive 90/539/EEC, see point 4 in Chapter I of<br>Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Articles 12(2), third sentence, and (3), 13(2) and (3), second<br>sentence, and 14(l)(a), second subparagraph, of Council Dir-<br>ective 91/67/EEC, see point 5 in Chapter I of Annex I to the<br>EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Article 3(a) of Council Directive 89/556/EEC, see point 6 in<br>Chapter I of Annex I to the EEA Agreement;</p>
<p>- Article 4(2) of Council Directive 88/407/EEC, see point 7 in<br>Chapter I of Annex I to the EEAAgreement;</p>

<p>understanding</p>
<p>331</p>
<h2>AGREEMENT ON A COMMITTEE OF MEMBERS OF<br>PARLIAMENT OF THE EFTA STATES</h2>
<h2>THE CONTRACTING PARTIES TO THE</h2>
<h2>AGREEMENT ON A STANDING COMMITTEE OF THE<br>EFTA STATES AND TO THE AGREEMENT</h2>
<h2>BETWEEN THE EFTA STATES ON THE<br>ESTABLISHMENT OF A SURVEILLANCE</h2>
<h2>AUTHORITY AND A COURT OF JUSTICE,</h2>
<p>HAVING REGARD to Article 95 of, and Protocol 36 to, the Agreement on<br>the European Economic Area;</p>
<p>CONSIDERING that Article 9 of the Agreement on a Standing Committee<br>of the EFTA States and Article 47 of the Agreement between the EFTA<br>States on the Establishment of a Surveillance Authority and a Court of Jus-<br>tice refer to a committee consisting of the members of Parliament of the<br>EFTA States who are members of the EEA Joint Parliamentary Committee;</p>
<p>CONVINCED of the important role that the Parliaments of the EFTA<br>States will play for the development of the European Economic Area;</p>
<p>RECALLING the objective of the Contracting Parties to the EEA Agree-<br>ment to contribute to the strengthening of the cooperation between the<br>members of the European Parliament and of the Parliaments of the EFTA<br>States;</p>
<p>DESIRING to further strengthen the cooperation between the Parliaments<br>of the EFTA States;</p>
<p>HAVE DECIDED to conclude the following Agreement:</p>
<p>Article 1</p>
<p>1. The Parliaments of the EFTA States shall, from among their own mem-<br>bers, appoint members for participation in the EEA Joint Parliamentary<br>Committee provided for in Article 95 of the EEAAgreement, in accordance<br>with the following;</p>
<p>from the Parliaments of Austria, Sweden and Switzerland six<br>members;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;from the Parliaments of Finland and Norway five members;</p>
<p>- &nbsp;&nbsp;from the Parliament of Iceland three members; and<br>from the Parliament of Liechtenstein two members.</p>
<p>2. The members of Parliament thus appointed shall form a Committee of<br>Members of Parliament of the EFTA States, hereinafter referred to as the<br>Committee. Each Parliament may appoint alternate members. The Commit-<br>tee may in its rules of procedure decide to invite observers from the EFTA<br>States.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16<br>Agreement on</p>
<p>Parlamentarians</p>
<p>332</p>
<p>Article 2</p>
<p>For the purposes of this Agreement the term 'EFTA State’ means a Member<br>State of the European Free Trade Association which is a Party to the EEA<br>Agreement, the Agreement on a Standing Committee of the EFTA States,<br>the Agreement between the EFTA States on the Establishment of a Surveil-<br>lance Authority and a Court of Justice as well as to the present Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 3</p>
<p>1. The Committee shall serve as a consultative body to the EFTA States on<br>matters of relevance to the EEA. It shall further serve as a channel of in-<br>formation on such matters between the EEA Joint Parliamentary Commit-<br>tee and the Parliaments of the EFTA States as well as between the latter<br>Parliaments.</p>
<p>2. Furthermore the Committee may express its views to the Standing Com-<br>mittee of the EFTA States on any matter of relevance for the functioning<br>and development of the EEA. It shall also carry out the tasks laid down in<br>Article 9, first paragraph, of the Agreement on a Standing Committee of the<br>EFTA States and Article 47, first paragraph, of the Agreement between the<br>EFTA States on the Establishment of a Surveillance Authority and a Court<br>of Justice.</p>
<p>Article 4</p>
<p>Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, the Committee shall act by an<br>absolute majority of the votes cast.</p>
<p>Article 5</p>
<p>The Committee may adopt recommendations or resolutions. Minority opin-<br>ions shall be attached to a recommendation or resolution which has been<br>adopted by a majority.</p>
<p>Article 6</p>
<p>1. The Committee shall elect its Chariman and Vice-Chairman from among<br>its members for a period of one year.</p>
<p>2. The Chairman shall call the sessions of the Committee on his own motion.<br>He shall furthermore call sessions either at the request of one-third of its<br>members or at the request of the Standing Committee of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>Article 7</p>
<p>The Committee may set up working parties among its members which shall<br>report to the Committee.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16<br>Agreement on<br>Parlamentarians</p>
<p>333</p>
<p>Article 8</p>
<p>1. The Committe may hold joint meetings with Ministers of the EFTA States<br>in conjunction with meetings at Ministerial level of the Standing Committee<br>of the EFTA States.</p>
<p>2. At other meetings of Ministers of the EFTA States, the Committee may<br>be invited to be represented in order to present the views of the Committee.</p>
<p>Article 9</p>
<p>The Chairman of the Standing Committee of the EFTA States as well as<br>Members of the EFTA Surveillance Authority may, upon invitation by the<br>Committee, attend meetings of the Committee to be heard by it. They may<br>reply orally or in writing to questions put to them by members of the Com-<br>mittee.</p>
<p>Article 10</p>
<p>The Chairman of the Committee shall keep the Standing Committee of the<br>EFTA States informed of the names of the members of Parliament who are<br>members of the Committee.</p>
<p>Article 11</p>
<p>1. The costs for participation in the Committee shall be borne by the Parlia-<br>ment which appointed a member.</p>
<p>2. If the Committee has been invited to meet in another place than Geneva<br>or Brussels the costs for the meeting facilities and interpretation equipment<br>shall normally be borne by the inviting EFTA State.</p>
<p>Article 12</p>
<p>The Committee shall adopt its rules of procedure acting by a majority of five<br>out of the seven National Delegations, members appointed by each Parlia-<br>ment forming a National Delegation.</p>
<p>Article 13</p>
<p>The Committee may by a separate decision of the Parties to this Agreement<br>be entrusted with other tasks than those mentioned above.</p>
<p>Article 14</p>
<p>Any EFTA State acceding to the EEA Agreement shall accede to the<br>present Agreement.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16<br>Agreement on</p>
<p>Parlamentarians</p>
<p>334</p>
<p>Article 15</p>
<p>1. Any EFTA State which withdraws from the EEA Agreement shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>withdrawal takes effect.</p>
<p>2. Any EFTA State which accedes to the European Community shall ipso<br>faeto cease to be a Party to the present Agreement on the same day as that<br>accession takes effect.</p>
<p>3. The Governments of the remaining EFTA States shall, by common<br>accord, decide on the necessary amendments to be made to the present<br>Agreement.</p>
<p>Article 16</p>
<p>1. The present Agreement, drawn up in a single authentic copy in the English<br>language, shall be ratified by the Contracting Parties in accordance with their<br>respective constitutional requirements.</p>
<p>2. The present Agreement shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden which shall transmit a certified copy to each EFTA State.</p>
<p>The instruments of ratification shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden which shall notify all other EFTA States.</p>
<p>3. The present Agreement shall enter into force on 1 January 1993 provided<br>that the EEA Agreement enters into force on that day and provided that the<br>instruments of ratification of the present Agreement have been deposited by<br>all EFTA States.</p>
<p>If the EEA Agreement does not enter into force on that day the present<br>Agreement shall enter into force on the day the EEA Agreement enters into<br>force or when all instruments of ratification of the present Agreement have<br>been deposited by all EFTA States, whichever day is the later.</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16</p>
<p>Agreement on</p>
<p>Parlamentarians</p>
<p>335</p>
<p>IN WITNESS WHEREOF the undersigned plenipotentiaries, being duly<br>authorized thereto, have signed the present Agreement.</p>
<p>DONE at Reykjavik, this 20th day of May 1992, in a single authentic copy<br>in the English language which shall be deposited with the Government of<br>Sweden. The Depositary shall transmit certified copies to all Signatory<br>States and States acceding to this Agreement.</p>
<p>For the Republic of Austria</p>
<p>For the Republic of Finland</p>
<p>For the Republic of Iceland</p>
<p>For the Principality of Liechtenstein</p>
<p>For the Kingdom of Norway</p>
<p>For the Kingdom of Sweden</p>
<p>For the Swiss Confederation</p>
<p>Prop. 1991/92:170</p>
<p>Bilaga 16<br>Agreement on<br>Parlamentarians</p>
<p>gotab 41337, Stockholm 1992</p>
